De terreno que se encuentra en la comunidad de Palca Grande cuenta con experiencia de 8 años en el rubro. Don Juanito y su esposa necesitan capital para comprar insumos agrícolas como ser abono orgánico, semilla de papa, el capital que tenía gasto en la celebración de su matrimonio ya que recién decidió casarse con la señora por la iglesia, Don Juanito comenta que ahora con el capital comprara los insumos agrícolas cultivara en más superficie de terreno done tendrá mayor ingreso económico para ahorro de dinero para el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juanito is 25 years old and married.  They live in the Palca Grande community.  They get income from selling potatoes, ‘oca’ [native tubers], and broad beans.  He cultivates three hectares of land that is in the Palca Grande community.  He has eight years of experience in the field.

Juanito and his wife need capital to buy agricultural supplies like organic fertilizer and potato seeds.  He spent the money that he had on their marriage celebration.  They recently decided to get married by the church.

Juanito comments that he will now use the money to buy agricultural supplies.  He will cultivate more land where he will get greater income.  He will save the money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is very thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy needed spare parts and accessories for her jeepney unit. Her income from this business also helped pay her everyday household expenditures. She has been in this business for 18 years. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and maintain their jeepney unit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amelia dreams of having another jeepney unit and hopes to have a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

- Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every-day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney vehicle.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 60 years old and married, with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arsenia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Arsenia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosaura Isabel

texts.es:
Rosaura, ha invertido con anterioridad créditos en su negocio que le ayudaron a mejorar los recursos para seguir adelante con su negocio y tener mejores ganancias, opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar más cerdos, comida para alimentarlos e insumos agrícolas.
Gracias a la rentabilidad que hoy tiene en su negocio su familia tiene una mejor vida y siguen adelante brindándole el apoyo en sus actividades.
texts.en:
Rosaura has invested her previous loans in her business.  They helped her to improve the resources in order to get ahead with her business and to have greater income.

She is deciding on a new loan to buy more pigs, food to feed them, and agricultural supplies.  Thanks to the profitability her business now has, her family has a better life.  They get ahead, providing her with support in her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, food to feed them, and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en: Genna is 41 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. Genna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Genna requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Genna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Rice farming has been Danilo's business for almost 25 years. With his last crop, he earned a net income of 50,000 PHP, which he spent on the school fees for his children. He uses his profits for daily expenditures and school fees for his children. 

Due to insufficient funds he would like to take out a loan amounting to 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. He hopes that this requested loan will be granted so that his agricultural business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Provia

texts.en:
Provia is a mother of six children who is determined to give her children the best in life despite the meager resources she has. She is a longtime farmer who has been in the farming business since 1999. Her farm is in a rural area in Igara in the Bushenyi District. Banana bacterial wilt is the main challenge in her business, since it affects the banana stems and hence the size and quality of the bananas harvested.

Provia has applied for 3,000,000 UGX to buy manure to apply on the farm so that she can have improved harvests. Her clients are the banana traders in her local area, and she believes that if she gets the loan she will supply them with better bananas and hence will satisfy her customers and keep the market. She has high hopes of being financially stable if the loan is given.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 19,21 y 13 años. Sus actividades agropecuarias son la crianza de ganado, siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas. Su jornada la hace acompañado de sus tres hijos de 5:00a.m. Hasta 3:00p.m., esté oficio lo aprendió de su padre. Tiene como ventaja trabajar en su propio terreno por lo que no tendrá dificultad en manejar dichas actividades.
E l préstamo lo invertirá en compra de insumos agrícolas (abono, herbicidas, insecticidas), para sembrar hortalizas (tomate, chile, ejotes, etc.)
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para salir adelante con la responsabilidad de la deuda adquirida, generar los ingresos económicos, que les permitan a sus hijos tener una mejor alimentación y un negocio más amplio.
texts.en:
Félix is in a relationship.  He lives with his life partner and their three children, ages 19, 21, and 13.  His farming activities are raising livestock and growing basic grains and vegetables.

He is accompanied by his three children during his workday from 5:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  He learned this trade from his father.  He has the advantage of working his own land.  Therefore, he will not have any difficulty managing these business activities.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides) to plant vegetables, (tomatoes, chilies, and beans, etc.).

His dream is to continue working in order to get ahead with the responsibility of the acquired debt.  He also dreams of generating income that will allow his children to have better food and a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides).

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 61 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, vive en casa de su hijo el mayor, y ella se dedica a la Costura hace más de 20 años. Ella pese a la edad es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha y se esfuerza para poder ser de ayuda en la casa, y no sentirse una molestia.
Desde siempre ha trabajado y no teme a hacerlo. El préstamo que la señora Maria solicita es para la terminación de su baño del taller de costura, ya que así tendrá una mejor condición y podrá dar un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
María, 61, lives in the city of Itá in her oldest son’s house.  She’s been sewing for more than 20 years.  Despite her age she’s a very hardworking woman who strives and struggles to be able to help at home and not feel like a burden.

She’s always worked and doesn’t shy away from it.  The loan she’s asking for will be used to finish her workshop’s bathroom so that it will be in better conditions to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to finish the workshop's bathroom.

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Elena es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada, continúa con la comercialización de alimentos preparados como nacatamales, además de su fuerte que es la venta de granos básicos los cuales distribuye en su casa, con anteriores préstamos ha hecho mejoras en la  infraestructura de su casa, pero considera que lo mas importante en invertir en el negocio, porque es su única fuente de ingreso desde que enviudó hace algunos años. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar por quintal los siguientes productos: frijol, arroz, aceite y azúcar, ofertándolos a sus clientes diariamente.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena’s a very hardworking, dedicated woman who continues selling prepared food like Nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] in addition to her main job which is selling basic grains at home.

She used previous loans to make improvements to her house’s infrastructure but she feels that the most important thing  is to invest in the business because it’s her only source of income since she was widowed some years ago.

She’s asking for the loan to buy the following supplies by the quintal to sell to her customers daily: beans, rice, oil and sugar.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Don Víctor de 53 años de edad vive en la Comunidad de Palca Grande, de estado civil soltero, tiene ingresos económicos por la venta de papa, oca haba cultiva 3 Has. De terreno que se encuentra en la comunidad de Palca Grande cuenta con experiencia de 25 años en el rubro. Don Víctor necesita capital para comprar insumos agrícolas abono orgánico, semilla de papa, el señor Victor con los ahorros que tenía los gasto en la compra de terreno agrícola, Don Víctor comenta que con el capital comprara el abono orgánico oportunamente y cultivara en más superficie de terreno con el cual tendrá mayor ingresos económico esto le permitirá a la larga mejorar su vivienda donde vive actualmente.
texts.en:
VÍctor, 53, lives in the community of Palca Grande.  He’s single and earns income growing potatoes and oca [a tuber] on a three-hectare parcel located in the community of Palca Grande; he has 25 years’ experience in this line of work.

Víctor needs capital to buy agricultural supplies like organic manure and potato seeds.  He used his savings to buy the farmland.  Víctor comments that he’ll use the capital to buy the organic manure in a timely fashion and will plant a larger surface area to earn higher income which in the long-run will make it possible for him to make improvements to the house he lives in at present.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria earns an income by operating a direct sales business. She previously accessed a loan in the amount of PhP 19,000, which she used to purchase merchandise items needed in her business. Her earnings improved a good deal, allowing her to provide for her child’s education and to support the family's personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would now like to apply for another PhP 19,000 loan in order to buy more merchandise items and new products to increase her product inventory. She believes that the more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. The increased profits from her business will help her significantly in sustaining her child’s education and meeting the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gleceria hopes to gain more customers and dreams of improving her standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and products to offer for sale, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old, married, and has six children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, and shampoo, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Lolita is requesting a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 54 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. Dionesia runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 31 years. 

Dionesia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase bread, canned goods, soft drinks, candies, soap, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, canned goods, soft drinks, candies, soap, etc.

loans.name: Isaias De Jesus

texts.es: Isaías es originario de la comarca Las Banderas, padre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicado con mucho esfuerzo a la venta y compra de piedras canteras. Se siente agradecido con Kiva y Micrédito porque logro comprar más productos,  y crecer poco a poco su negocio. Solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar piedras canteras y venderlo de forma ambulante, con el fin de aumentar la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que el financiamiento le generara más ingresos y así comprar productos y suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, además cumplir su sueño de comprar una camioneta.
texts.en:
Isaías is from the Las Banderas district; he’s father of two children.  He’s a merchant by profession, he buys and sells paving stones.  He’s grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he was able to buy more products and make his business gradually grow.

He’s asking for a loan once again to buy paving stones to resell from place to place hoping to increase customer demand.  He figures that the loan will generate higher income to buy products an meet customer needs as well as to reach his dream of buying a pick-up truck.

loans.use: to buy paving stones.

loans.name: Angela Group

texts.en:
Rabiha, age 48 (pictured at left), is the featured borrower in the Angela Group, which is comprised of three borrowers. Aline is in the center of the picture and Josette is at right.

Rabiha joined this group in order to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. The three borrowers have joined together for this loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. 
 
Rabiha sells clothes and underwear items to earn a living. She began her business four years ago. She tells us that she intends to work hard on expanding her business with her current loan funds, because she will be able to increase her business capital. She also intends to work hard to restart her old business: she used to sell Brazilian gold at the beginning of her working experience, but she wasn't capable of expanding and increasing her capital. Today, with the available customers and with Al Majmoua's support, Rabiha might have the chance to improve her socioeconomic situation.
 
Rabiha and her husband have four children, and she puts as much effort as she can into helping her husband to provide them with the best possible education and standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released autumn and winter collection items

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia  tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su hermano. Ella se  inició en el área de ventas desde el año 2005. Inicialmente comercializaba solo prendas de vestir para damas, hoy también vende calzados y artículos eléctricos a pequeñas ferreterías. Paralelamente tiene otro trabajo con sueldo fijo, es una persona muy trabajadora.
Gracias a los trabajos que  realiza ya está a muy poco de poder concluir la construcción de su casa propia. Leticia ha demostrado ser una persona muy sacrificada, responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Comenta que  siempre trata de buscar mejores precios para sus compras y de esa forma venderle a sus clientes a un precio razonable y lograr la fidelidad de estos. Solicita este crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir para la temporada Primavera-Verano que está por iniciar.  Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues esto le permitirá aumentar sus ingresos y poder así dar termino a la construcción de su casa que es su mayor anhelo.
texts.en:
Leticia is 31 years old and she lives with her brother. She began to work in sales back in 2005. She started by selling only women's clothes, but now she also sells footwear, as well electronics to small hardware stores. At the same time, Leticia has a job with a fixed salary; she is a very hardworking person. 

Thanks to the various jobs that she performs, Leticia is about to finish building her own home. She has demonstrated being a very diligent person, responsible and honest with her duties. Leticia says that she always seeks the lowest prices for her merchandise, in order to offer reasonable prices to her clients and earn their loyalty.

Leticia is now requesting this loan to buy clothes for the spring-summer season that is about to arrive. She is grateful for this opportunity, as this will enable her to increase her income, and in this way finalize the construction of her home, which is her greatest dream.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando actualmente se dedica a la prestación de servicios de sastrería, confecciona principalmente trajes a medida para instituciones y profesores además de pantalones y arreglos en general; su trabajo es muy solicitado esto debido a que cuenta con la experiencia necesaria obtenida en trabajos anteriores y por la prontitud de entrega. El señor Fernando está casado, su esposa es la que le ayuda en la confección de los trajes, tienen 2 hijos dependientes de sus ingresos; son personas responsables, trabajadoras y con ganas de superación; sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar y son alumnos destacados; el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar rollos de tela para la elaboración de trajes esto debido a que consiguieron un trabajo grande y le falto material para poder terminar dicho trabajo, y así poder tener un beneficio más grande para él, su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando currently works providing tailoring services.   He mainly works manufacturing outfits to order for institutions and teachers.  Also making pants and doing alterations in general.  His work is very sought-after because he has the necessary experience acquired in previous jobs and because of his quick turn-around time.

Fernando’s married and his wife helps him sew the outfits.  They have two children who are dependent on their income.  They are responsible, hardworking people who very much want to improve.  Their children are school age and are outstanding students.

The reason for the present loan is to buy bolts of fabric to make outfits because they got a large order and they ran out of fabric to complete it.  In this way, profits will be higher for him, his wife and his children.

loans.use: to buy bolts of fabric.

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma del Carmen continúa esforzándose a través de préstamos en hacer crecer su negocio, el cual inició con la oferta de algunos productos básicos para clientes dentro de su barrio. Ella es la mano derecha de su esposo que labora como albañil, ambos comparten los gastos generales de la casa y la educación de sus tres hijos de 19, 14 y 10 años de edad, los cuales estudian en colegios públicos. Solicita el crédito para abastecer su pulpería de los siguientes productos: carne de res, pollo y cerdo, refrescos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles  y aceite. En el futuro ella piensa tener un puesto más grande en alguno mercado de la capital, porque su casa tiene poco espacio.
texts.en:
Norma del Carmen continues striving to make her business grow by means of loans.  She started the business with just a few basic staples for her neighborhood customers.  She’s her husband’s right hand; he works in construction.  They both share household expenses and their three children’s schooling costs.  The children are 19, 14 and 10 years of age and attend public schools.

She’s asking for the loan to stock her store with the following products: beef, chicken, pork, soft-drinks, sugar, rice, beans and oil.  In future, she plans to have a larger stand in one of the capital’s markets because her house doesn’t have much space.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 38 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom work as motor mechanics. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her family is very poor, which is why her sons are working at a very young age.

Yasmeen is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for her husband who drives an auto rickshaw and has been feeding his family. The loan will allow her husband to maintain the rickshaw to keep it functioning properly. Yasmeen hopes that one day the poor living conditions of her family will change.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores. She previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dolores hopes to have an additional jeepney and dreams to have a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Fellowship groups are composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney.

loans.name: Maritena

texts.en:
Maritena earns an income by operating a fruit and vegetable stall business from her home. She has run her business for the past two months and sells her goods primarily to her neighbors. She is a single mother with one child who attends school. Their house has neither electricity nor piped water. Maritena's greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Maritena decided to join Yehu to receive financial support for her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of Kshs 10,000. With her loan funds, she will purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to offer for sale.

She dreams of establishing a mini green-grocer business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita  is married and has seven children.  She works hard to support her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling food.  

Sherlita is requesting her second loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase bread, canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. for her general store. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bread, canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married with two school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past six years, she has practiced farming; growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase seeds and pesticides for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four school-going children. They own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Josephine has operated a clothes selling business for the past ten years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. In addition, she operates a green grocery shop.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She has operated a cereals shop business at the market for the past two years; selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, rice, green grams, ground nuts, and lentils.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es: Manuel es un artista de 50 años de edad, padre soltero de 2 hijos, se ha dedicado a interpretar la música del género vallenato desde que era joven, actividad que desarrollaba en su ciudad natal, pero debido a factores externos  tuvo que trasladarse a otra ciudad y, hace 10 años formó su propio grupo musical, se dio a conocer ambientando fiestas, cumpleaños y todo tipo de eventos sociales y, con el tiempo se ha catalogado como el mejor grupo musical de la región. De esta manera ha generado los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y llevar el sustento a su hogar.  El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre, entusiasta, emprendedor y dedicado, ama su labor y se día a día para seguir avanzando. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar instrumentos musicales (acordeón, caja, guacharaca) y para arreglar los que ya posee, esto le permitirá mejorar la prestación de su servicio y satisfará los requerimientos de su clientela, dando como resultado un incremento notable en sus ingresos, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año que se aproxima, época en la que la demanda de su servicio aumenta. Manuel sólo desea seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación, para llegar a cumplir el sueño de formar una gran orquesta y en un futuro poder grabar un CD, así podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, 50, is an artist.  He’s a single father of two children.  He has been playing ‘vallenato’ style music [a popular folk music of Colombia primarily from the Caribbean region] since he was young, an activity he used to carry out in the town of his birth.  Due to external factors, however, he had to move to another city and ten years ago formed his own musical group and became known entertaining at parties, birthdays and all sorts of social events.  In time, he’s become the best musical group in the region.

He’s earned income this way sufficient to move his two children forward and provide sustenance at home.  He’s noted for being a cheerful, enthusiastic, enterprising man who loves his work and gives of himself daily in order to continue making progress.

He’s asking for support from the loan to buy musical instruments: accordion, 'caja' [drum similar to a tambora, is one of the three main or traditional instruments of the Vallenato music], ‘guacharaca’ [percussion instrument] and to repair the ones he already owns.  This will allow him to provide better service and meet customer needs leading as a result to notable increase in income especially during the end-of-year season that’s approaching when demand of his services grows.

Manuel’s only desire is to continue working with dedication and drive in order to reach his dream of forming a great orchestra and in future record a CD to provide his family with better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Rogelia tiene 36 años ella es conviviente, sus 03 hijos son pequeños y están en edad escolar. Rogelia  tiene su propio negocio ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa sobretodo lencería de mujer, antes alquilaba un puesto de venta en un mercado pero debido al alto costo del alquiler decidió trasladar  el negocio a su casa allí ha instalado un pequeño bazar donde todas sus clientas acuden para comprarle .Rogelia es integrante de la alcancía “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO”   grupo conformado por 9 socias. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de diferentes modelos, sobre todo para la época de verano, en el futuro desea  mejorar su negocio y poder  ampliar su bazar. Rogelia en representación del grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. En la foto es la ultima de la izquierda viste polera color azulina.
texts.en:
Rogelia, 36, has a spouse and three school age children.  She has her own business.  She sells clothes, especially women’s lingerie.  She used to lease a stand in a market but due to the high rental cost decided to move her business to her house where she set up a small bazaar where all her customers can come to buy.

Rogelia is a member of the “Mujeres Rumbo al Progresso’ (Women En Route to Progress) communal bank which has nine members.  The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy clothes in various styles above all for the summer season.  In future she hopes to improve the business and to be able to enlarge the bazaar.

In the name of the entire group, Rogelia thanks Kiva lenders for the loan.  In the photo, she’s last on the left wearing a blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold, and business expenditures. She also has a tailoring business were she makes rugs of different sizes for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more vegetables, needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Jane hopes that her business will continue growing, and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more meat products for her business which has been running for ten years now. Her loan is also helpful for the education of her children. Her income from the business helped in their everyday household expenditures. She also has a tricycle unit and she sells barbecue for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more chicken and pork for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria hopes to be successful in all her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for chicken and pork for her business.

loans.name: Jillian Faith

texts.en:
Jillian Faith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jillian Faith requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Jillian Faith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Drary

texts.en:
Drary is a hard-working businesswoman. The previous loan she took has really boosted her business and she is now experiencing high returns in her business. Her children have been able to attend school and they are still continuing with the studies. 

Drary is now taking a loan of SSP 3,500 (South Sudanese Pounds) to buy more stock in her business.

Drary is very appreciative of the loan support she is receiving from Kiva, through Finance Sudan Limited.

loans.use: to buy more onions, salt, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, está casado, tiene la edad de 28 años, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos   que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de un terreno familiar sembrado de café. Ella y su esposos poseen un terreno sembrado y actualmente todavía posee espacio por lo cual le sembraran café a lo que falta y asistirán lo demás. Ellos esperan poder aumentar su cosecha para estos próximos años y a su vez generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y salir con los pagos del crédito. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 28, is married living with her husband and two children who are her greatest priority.  She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies for her family plot of coffee.  She and her husband own a parcel of planted farmland that still has more available space that they’ll use to plant coffee on and also to assist the current plants.  They hope to be able to increase crop yield in the next few years while at the same time generate higher income for their family’s well-being and to repay the loan.

This is her first Fudecosur loan.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 35 years old and the leader of this four persons' lending group. She is the mother of six. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband's income is too low to meet the family expenses.

Farzana is very hard working and independent.  By selling hand-made dolls, she helps her husband to meet the family needs and to pay for the children's education fees. She has excellent skills in making dolls, and her customers like her hand-made dolls a lot.

Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase pearls, sequins, and polyester for making dolls to sell. 

Farzana is hopeful about her business success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: for purchasing pearls, sequins, and polyester for making dolls to sell.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 55-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children and she is equally responsible for all of them. 

Haleema belongs to an ultra-poor family -- that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his daily tasks. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to an increase in the iron’s prices, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material, such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, Haleema's husband needs some capital to buy welding material. Haleema requested a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy material to carry on his business. 

Haleema is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding material for manufacturing, such as welding rods, soldering rods, and iron rods.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 33-year-old single lady who works in a clothing sales shop since nine years ago to cover her needs and educational expenses. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort in developing herself through education and experience.

Manal loves knowledge; that's why she is still enrolled at a university, seeking more and more information and spending her free time doing something valuable, as she claims.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her university's additional education fees. She hopes that one day she will start her own business in the education sector and improve her living.

loans.use: to pay for her university educational fees.

loans.name: Ventanilla Alta 2 Group

texts.es: Evarista de 27 años es miembro del grupo “VENTANILLA ALTA  2”  es la tesorera  de la alcancía es soltera con  02  hijos pequeños. Evarista se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa donde  ofrece diferentes prendas de vestir  a sus clientas, lleva cerca de 05 años en este negocio del cual esta agradecida porque le permite solventar los gastos  de educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Por las mañanas trabaja como auxiliar de educación así obtiene más ingresos para su familia. Su mayor anhelo es  comprar una casa para vivir con sus hijos y alquilar un puesto para instalar su negocio. El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de verano como polos, faldas y vestidos. El grupo por medio de ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por la confianza. Evarista es la quinta del lado izquierdo en la parte de atrás tiene botines negros.
texts.en:
Evarista, 27, is a member of the “Ventanilla Alta 2” group; she’s its treasurer.  She’s single with two small children.  Her business is selling various articles of clothing to her customers.  She’s been in business almost five years and she’s grateful because she’s able to cover her children’s food and schooling costs that way.  

Morning she works as a teacher’s aide earning extra family income this way.  Her greatest wish is to buy a house to live in with her children and to lease a stand to install her business in.

She will use the requested loan to buy summer clothes like shirts, skirts and dresses.  Evarista is fifth from the left in the rear and is wearing black ankle boots.

Through her, the group thanks Kiva lenders for their trust.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married and has three children. She manages her own piggery as an aid to her husband's income from farming. She has been in this business for more than eight years to earn a living. 

She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy livestock's feeds. She wants to build a shelter for her piggery to be used for expansion. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her livestock.

loans.name: Alejandro Nils

texts.es: El Sr. Alejandro de condición humilde, profesión albañil, de estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos pero ayuda económicamente a su madre y a sus hermanos, su padre les abandono hace dos años, desde entonces el Sr. Alejandro  se hizo responsable de su madre y sus hermanos quienes aun están estudiando y necesitan un lugar cómodo donde realizar sus tareas, por ello el Sr. Alejandro  solicita un crédito para la construcción de vivienda, pues de esa manera podrá ofrecer a su familia un lugar más cómodo donde estén tranquilos sin sentirse mal por no tener un lugar donde realizar sus tareas. Además como cuenta con un terreno en el futuro quiere realizar la construcción del mismo para que ya no dependan de sus abuelos y puedan vivir de manera más cómoda y decente, su madre es quien le ayudara con los gastos de construcción, puesta actualmente está trabajando y percibe un ingreso que ayudara de manera positiva al Sr. Alejandro.
texts.en:
Alejandro lives under humble circumstances and works as a construction worker. He doesn't have children of his own but he helps his mother and his siblings economically, since their father abandoned them two years ago. Since then Alejandro has been responsible for his mother and his siblings, who still go to school and need a comfortable place where they can do their homework. 

This is why Alejandro is requesting a loan in order to build a house so that he can offer his family a more comfortable place where they can feel relaxed, without feeling bad about not having a place where they can perform their tasks. That way, they won't be dependent on their grandparents any more and they will have a more comfortable and decent living. They already own a piece of ground to build the house on. His mother will help him with the construction expenses, because she is currently working and receiving a salary.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is 28 years of age, married, and has five children. Two of her children are under school age, and three of them attend school. They are the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasha has operated a cafe business, making and selling comestables like rice, tea, beans, and chapati ( flat bread). Her customers are passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as a major challenge for her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods for use at the cafe, including maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important persons in their society.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods for use at the cafe, including maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Edna is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binders and other materials to use for her oyster culture business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders and other materials to use for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance, and he has applied for a loan of UGX1,000,000 so he can buy mulch and fertilizer to apply on his garden. 

He is a farmer dealing in growing and selling pineapples, and he has done this since 1990. He spends six hours on the pineapple plantation daily, and he also hopes to work on the banana garden when he has the time, since it gives him additional income. 

He started farming with a purpose of getting money to support his family so they could earn a living. He is an honest farmer who has suffered the negative effect of pests on the garden, and this he says affects his harvests. 

However, he has hopes that this challenge will be overcome with time, especially if he applies herbicides and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy mulch and fertilizer for his pineapples

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his younger brother by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

She wants to grow the business of her husband. She requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan; she is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings, and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva field partner's BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a General Store business.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en: Shumaila is 35-year-old married woman, and mother of a son. She is the leader of a two-persons lending group. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs an additional capital for the growth of the business. Shumaila is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit amount he will put aside some savings to pay for electricity and gas bills. Shumaila hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elcin

texts.en:
Elcin is 43 years old, married, and father of two children. Elcin  is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his  family in the Agdas  IDP Settlement. He  is a market vendor, as you can see from the photo he  has put up, but he does not have enough funds to buy products for his market. 

Elcin is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more food products such as soft drinks, juice, bread, cookies, milk, eggs, cheese, water, beans, sugar, and butter. With the support of this loan, he hopes to increase his inventory and thus the volume of his sales. This is going to be his first loan.

He hopes to get money to expand his business in the future. Elcin awaits your support.

loans.use: to increase his   inventory and thus the volume of his   sales

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty Joaju solicita su cuarto préstamo   del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona no muy alejada de la zona céntrica y se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Rumari es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeña Despensa, que logró montar con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, comenta también que todo lo que hace es por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. También quiere que su comunidad y barrio vaya mejorando, teniendo una mayor seguridad para su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, para que de esa forma vaya surtiendo su sección de verdulería y de mayor variedad a su clientela.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Aty Joaju is requesting its fourth loan in the women’s committee program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, in an area not too far from the city centre and it is growing. This is the reason the members want to fight, to continue its growth and give the area where they live a better environment so that it continues to grow slowly.

Rumari is one of the members. She has her own small store which she managed to set up with a lot of sacrifice and effort. She also says that everything she does is for her family, to be able to give them everything that she never had.  She also wants her community and neighbourhood to continue improving, having more security for her family.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of vegetables so that she can supply her produce section and have a greater variety for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Myrna Lee

texts.en:
Myrna Lee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Myrna Lee is 40 years old and all of her children are in school.

Myrna Lee has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP  (Philppines Pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for fifteen years. In the future, Myrna Lee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Karmen

texts.en: Karmen is a farmer from Tegh village of Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, 13-year-old daughter and 12-year-old son. To be able to meet the needs of her family, Karmen, with the help of her husband, is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows and hens, and in beekeeping. They realize the agricultural products and the honey in the local market. Agribusiness is the main source of income for the family. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Karmen needs to expand the agribusiness to be able to effectively meet the needs of her family. A loan of USD 1500 will greatly support this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 15 sheep. Karmen and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their good will and support in collecting the needed loan and helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Iselle

texts.es: Iselle es originaria de Teustepe, Boaco. De 40 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos a cargo. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada a su pulpería, la cual inicio hace 10 años, con un dinero que recibió de su trabajo anterior, y decidió invertirlo totalmente a este negocio. Con el apoyo de su mama y su hermana ha logrado mantener un negocio estable. Su meta próxima es comprar productos variados para su pulpería. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, gaseosas al por mayor entre otros, con el fin de surtir su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de su clientela. Estima que con el crédito obtendrá un crecimiento en sus ventas y mayores ganancias. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y brindar mejor atención a los consumidores.
texts.en:
Iselle, 40, is from Teustepe, Boaco.  She’s single with no children in her care.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She runs her grocery store that she opened ten years ago with money she got from her previous job and decided to invest all of it in this business.  She’s managed to maintain it stable with help from her mother and sister.

Her next goal is to buy assorted goods for her store.  She’s asking for the loan to buy such things as rice, sugar, beans, oil, soft-drinks and others at wholesale with the aim of stocking her store and meeting customer demand.  She figures that the loan will help her attain higher sales and profits.  Her future plan is to make improvements to the store’s infrastructure to provide better consumer service.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, two daughters, and three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business, providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about twenty years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable because he has a regular income and more free time. 

This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time. Bushra requested a loan so that her husband would be able to fix the engine and maintain the body of his auto rickshaw.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of Auto Rickshaw's engine and body.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 30year-old married man with 3 children. Elnur is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. Elnur and his wife are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet their family's needs. He has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 5 years. During these years, he gained the necessary skills and knowledge for the effective management of his business. 

He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. He also makes homemade yogurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to his neighbors. His monthly income is about 144 AZN. This business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, as people use it in everyday dishes like pilau (a rice dish) and dolma (stuffed grape leaves).

Now Elnur would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. This will be his 1st loan with AqroInvest.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en: Mirvat is a 27-year-old married mother of one child. She works as a hairdresser, to support her husband in making their living and covering their expenses. Mirvat has a very good reputation in her domain, and she is a good standing Al Majmoua borrower too. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy special hair colors and extensions highly requested by her customers. Mirvat is so optimistic about this loan, and is working hard to keep on developing her business in a well managed way, to make sure that it will be a very good financial support to her family. She will work hard to open a special facial beauty sector in the future which will surely come with an encouraging income.

loans.use: To buy special hair colors and extensions highly requested by her customers

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is married, with two children. She runs a service-based business, providing printing and encoding in their community, as an aid to  her husband's income from employment as an overseas worker. Lita has been in this business for more than five years to support their living. 

She had joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) recently and borrowed a loan to purchase ink, bond paper, linen, and other accessories. 

Lita wants to expand her business and build a little office where she could entertain clients. In the future, she wants to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to purchase ink, bond paper, linen, and other accessories.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor Santos es un hombre trabajador, de estado civil soltero, pero convive por mucho tiempo con su concubina, tiene 2 hijos de quienes dependen aun de su ingreso económico, viven en la comunidad de Santa Ana La Vieja, zona que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, misma que es de propiedad del señor Santos. El Sr. Santos quien es de condición muy humilde desea el presente crédito con el fin de poder seguir percibiendo ingresos con la nueva cosecha que vaya a realizar, indicar que el señor Santos  siembra papa y requiere para la compra de semilla como de fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otros y de esa forma con los ingresos que perciba poder concretar otros sueños que a corto plazo tiene como el de poder mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking, single man but has lived with his spouse for a long time; he has two children who depend on his economic activity.  They live in the community of Santa Ana La Vieja, a zone that has all basic utilities; he owns his house.

Santos, who is of very humble condition, wants the present loan to continue earning income from the crops he produces.  He grows potatoes and he needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. so that with the income he earns he will be able to reach his other short-term dreams like making home improvements.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS AZUCENAS” es una alcancía recién formada lo integran  5 socios. Uno de ellos es Román de 61 años soltero y muy trabajador, hace 6 años trabaja en su  bodega negocio que inicio gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres, quienes tiempo atrás también se dedicaron a lo mismo. Román conoce todo sobre el negocio y lo que más desea es en convertir su bodega en una de las mejores de su zona, para lograrlo siempre trata de surtirla con productos variados. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos  diversos como azúcar, arroz, menestras y toda clase de bebidas. Su mayor deseo es lograr que su negocio le permita mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo.
texts.en:
The group "Las Azucenas" is a recently formed communal bank with five members. One of them is Román who is 61 years old, single, and very hard-working. He has been running his grocery store for six years, and he learnt this business from his parents who used to work with the same thing. 

Román knows everything about this business and what he wishes for the most is to transform his grocery store into one of the best in the neighborhood. In order to achieve that he always tries to stock it with a variety of products. He will use this loan to buy different products such as sugar, rice, stews, and all kinds of beverages. His greatest wish to obtain a higher profit so that he can help his family. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Reizel

texts.en:
Reizel is 34 years old and a married mother of five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Reizel has a nito (native palm) weaving business in the Philippines. Reizel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nito weaving.

Reizel has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Reizel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nito (native palm) weaving.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with seven children. Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 6,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is 27 years old from the small village of Kharagauli district. He lives with his parents and grandmother. His mother works as a nurse at a local hospital. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a cow, calf and plot of land where nut trees are grown. They produce cheese to sell with the harvested nuts. 

Lasha decided to open a grocery and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $ 3,000 to purchase a stock of groceries. He will run the grocery store and be able to increase the income of his family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en:
Suleyman is 31; he is married and has one child. Suleyman is an IDP (internally displaced person), and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement.  He is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than five years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work; he considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to support his family. Suleyman ’s income from business is 130 AZN. 

To improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. 

He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,000 AZN. This loan is to buy fertilizer and seeds. It will help him grow more vegetables and fruit to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNIDOS PARA EL PROGRESO”   está iniciando su tercer ciclo, la alcancía está conformada por 06 socias todas con diferentes negocios prósperos. Paola una de sus integrantes es madre soltera de 02 niños, ella se dedica a la venta de  comidas anticuchos, carne y pollos a la parrilla. Su negocio está ubicado en su misma casa donde tiene un espacio con algunas mesas y sillas para atender a su clientela. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de vitrinas y otros enseres para mejorar su negocio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA. Paola es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo plomo,  la foto adjunta pertenece a la Sta. Maritza.
texts.en:
The "Unidos Para El Progreso" group is entering it's third cycle.  The group is made up of 6 members, all with different, prosperous businesses. 

Paola, one of its members, is a single mother of 2 children.  She works selling grilled kebabs, steak and chicken.  Her business is located in her home where she has a space with some tables and chairs for her customers.  The loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of cabinets and other equipment to improve her business.  

The group is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Paola is the first woman on the left, dressed in gray.  The adjacent picture is of Maritza.

loans.use: purchase cabinets and equipment

loans.name: Giovanny Cesar

texts.es: Giovanny  tiene 24  años es estudiante de traducción e interpretación, este es el último año de su carrera. Govanny se siente feliz por los logros obtenidos a pesar de muchos obstáculos ha salido adelante y ya está pensando estudiar Administración como segunda carrera, en la actualidad trabaja en una empresa como supervisor ingreso que le permite solventar algunos gastos. El préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para el pago del último ciclo en la universidad. Giovanny se siente muy agradecido a los inversionistas KIVA sin su apoyo el apoyo no habría podido culminar su carrera con éxito.
texts.en:
Giovanny, age 24, is a translation and interpreting student.  He is in the last year of his degree program.  Giovanny is pleased with what he has achieved despite facing many obstacles.  He plans to study Management as a second degree.  

Giovanny currently works for a company as a supervisor.  The income he earns enables him to pay for a few expenses.  The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for his final semester at the university.  Giovanny is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Without their support, he would not be able to complete his degree successfully.

loans.use: to pay for his last semester at the university.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie helps her husband in their vulcanizing and repair shop business. She earns enough from their shop that she has been able to provide for the needs of the entire family. From the returns of the business, they were able to buy a motorcycle that can also be used for transportation services. 

Recently, Rosemarie joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the repair shop. She is hopeful about sustaining and improving their business in the future for the good of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for the repair shop.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is married, with two children. To make a living, she runs a retail store in their community. Her husband is earning income from employment as a carpenter and a part-time driver. 

Shirley always finds ways to augment their living. She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) recently to gain access to microfinance services and now, she borrowed a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

She is hopeful of seeing her business progress and her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Alu Buga

texts.en:
Alu has grown her business significantly thanks to the previous loan she received. The business is now doing fine and she has been able to buy more stocks and mitigate between her challenges. Her children have been able to attend school and are still studying very well. Her previous loan has also been paid fully without difficulties.

She is now borrowing a loan worth of 3,500 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her purchase more goods, such as cooking oil, cassava, simsim, and many other items from Uganda to Juba to sell them.

She is very happy for the loan facilities she has received from Finance South Sudan Limited through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for purchase more goods, such as cooking oil, cassava, simsim, etc.

loans.name: Sisters Of Destiny Group

texts.en: Mariama is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama was born in Kailahun, in eastern Sierra Leone, 32 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has 3 children who are attending primary schools. For 8 years now, Mariama has been selling firewood, charcoal, etc. Mariama and her group members are requesting a loan of 1,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each individual. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve on their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of firewood and charcoal to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil and cooking oil.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Though Grace grew up in poverty and without an education, Grace's background has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Grace is an entrepreneur. She sells fish and cassava dough in Asafora (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. Grace is married and has six children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Grace wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish and cassava dough. In the long term, Grace plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of fish and cassava dough

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario, es una persona joven de 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, y no cuenta con dependientes económicos, vive en la casa de sus padres, la vivienda está construida con material local de tipo rustico, que se halla situado en el comunidad de Koari, su principal actividad económica del señor Mario  es la agricultura, anualmente produce los siguientes productos; papa 85 cargas, haba (verde) 40 cargas, zanahoria 30 cargas estas cultivos son producidos en los terrenos de sus padres sin costo alguno, solicita crédito para capital de operación para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como ser abono orgánico, semilla de papa una cabeza de ganado bovino, con la producción de estos productos el señor Mario  mejorará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mario is 20 years old and single. He has completed primary education. He doesn't have any economic dependants and lives in his parents' house. Their house is made of local materials in a rustic style and is located in a community called Koari. 

Mario's primary income-generating activity is agriculture. He currently produces the following products: 85 bags of potatoes, 40 bags of broad beans, and 30 bags of carrots. He produces these crops on his parents' land without any costs. He is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural inputs such as organic fertilizer, potato seeds and one head of cattle. With the production derived from these products Mario will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Muranga. She has 2 children and has been farming for 9 years. Her primary income sources are tea and crops. Besides farming, she has a motorbike which she uses to transport people and goods as a source of income. Florence owns the following: bicycle, motorcycle, mosquito net, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not own cows, pigs, poultry, pump, automobile, electricity, solar power, or sewing machine.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: selling her farm produce. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough money to purchase herbicides.

Florence was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: they offer low interest rate loans. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: micro finance institutions help low level farmers.

Her highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked: 'How this loan would benefit her family', Florence replied: 'Income from goat milk will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Shamsaddin

texts.en:
Shamsaddin is 50 years old, married, and has one 5-year-old child. Shamsaddin has been raising cattle for about 25 years.  He tries to earn money in order to provide income for the family. He selected this work because he enjoys raising cattle. Currently, he has three cows.
 
Today Shamsaddin is requesting a loan to pay for medical expenses and medicines so he can recover his health and continue his work routine. After treatment, he wants to take a loan to purchase a few more calves for breeding. He needs your financial support.

loans.use: to cover personal medical expenses.

loans.name: Riath

texts.en:
Riath is a 21-year-old married man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school only. His business is a cafeteria, which he has been running for six months. He offers his customers all types of staple products, such as hot drinks, fresh juices, and sandwiches. 

He started as a worker in a perfumes store. Then he strived to collect more money in order to open a cafeteria. The business allows him to support his family. He says that he is already established with customers in the area and highly esteemed by his neighbors and customers, who consider him a responsible man.

He wants to acquire more products with which he can grow his business in order to achieve his objective. So he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy food items to stock his business. He would like to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy food items to stock his business.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, age 33, is from the capital city of Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband and a mother in her own house. Nino's economic activity is her newly started clothing trading business. Specifically, she purchases apparel and household items in Turkey at wholesale prices and sells them among her neighbors and community members. Her business is going well but it needs financial support to develop.

Now, Nino is requesting the loan to purchase a stock of merchandise in bulk and increase the turnover in her trading business. She will offer a wide assortment of clothing to her customers and give them a chance to pay later for their purchases. This will attract more clients and Nino will generate good income. She will invest the profit in the same business and plans to start a clothing store in the future. Nino hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 51 años, no estudio pero si puede leer y escribir, ya que le enseño el padre de sus hijos, es madre soltera de 4 hijos. Ella vive solamente con una nieta y un hijo, la niña asiste a la escuela a cuarto grado y solamente la niña depende económicamente de ella.

Ella se dedica a la sastrería, desde que tenía doce años de edad, la mamá le enseño y desde entonces se dedica a la sastrería; pero también por ocasiones hace ventas en sus casa , para ir obteniendo otros ingresos para el hogar, ya qué solo de eso depende ella y su nieta.


Con el crédito comprara una máquina de coser  y tela para hacer más costuras, para incrementar el negocio, aparte de eso piensa enseñarle el mismo trabajo a su nieta.


Piensa aumentar el negocio de costuras y tener más empleadas, para darles trabajo a personas necesitadas como ella,  de la misma comunidad, para poder sustentar a sus familias y así sus hijos tengan mejor futuro así como ella pretende darle a su nieta
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old.  Even though she did not attend school, she is able to read and write since she was taught by the father of her children.  Rosa is a single mother with four children.  She lives with a son and a granddaughter.  Rosa’s granddaughter is in the fourth grade and financially dependent on her.  

Rosa has worked as a tailor for the past 12 years.  Her mother taught her how to sew and now she is able to make her living as a tailor.  Occasionally she will also conduct sales from her house in order to earn additional household income so that she can support herself and her granddaughter.  

With this loan, Rosa will buy a sewing machine and fabric for making more outfits, which will increase her business.  In addition, she intends to teach her granddaughter this same profession.  

Rosa plans to increase her tailoring business and hire more employees so that she can provide jobs to people in her community who are in need just as she was.  This will enable these people to support their families and provide a better future for their children, just as she intends to do with her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Samah Group

texts.en:
Samah is the featured borrower of Samah's group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Samah is a 23-year-old single lady who has been working as a tutor for five years. She has a very good reputation in her area and in her domain, and she's highly recommended by her students' parents. 

The loan she acquires will be invested in paying her university tuition fees. She's the lady at the center of the picture wearing a pink top. As for the other group members, Maya is the pregnant lady at the right side of the picture and Randa is the lady at the left side.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora makes a living through her retail store. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 20 years now. She sells various dry goods, ranging from children's toys to kitchen materials.
 
Teodora is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as toys, kitchen wares, basin, slippers, and others. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to attract and sell more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, such as toys, kitchen wares, basin, slippers, and others.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is married with four children. Her husband is earning from being a carpenter, while she manages raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for more than eleven years to earn a living.

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to build a shelter for her livestock to expand her piggery. She wants to improve the business and be able to renovate their own house for a comfortable living in the near future.

loans.use: to build a shelter for her livestock.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a farmer from Bohol in the Philippines. She is a married woman and has five grown-up children. Conchita has been in the farming business for more than five years now. She grows bananas and vegetables among other crops. She also sells home-cooked snack foods.

She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With these she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Conchita hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она имеет грандиозную идею организовать свой бизнес. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес скотоводством.
