С такой целью она обратилась за займом в сумме 4000 сомони. Она будет покупать скот, откармливать и продавать молочные продукты. Она надеется на то, что ее бизнес будет развеваться. Она трудолюбивая и добродушная женщина. Санобар ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sanobar is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She has a grand idea to organize her own business.  She wants to start her own animal husbandry business.  With this goal in mind, she requested a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni.  She will buy livestock, fatten it up and sell dairy products.  She hopes that her business will grow.  She is a hardworking and kind woman. Sanobar awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock to start her own business

loans.name: Zubeda Kadara

texts.en:
Zubeda has really improved her business from the previous loan she took. The business is now taking shape and her customers have increased due to her ability to purchase goods for resell. Her children have been able to go to school, and she paid the previous loan without any difficulties.

Zubeda is now taking another loan for 3,500 SSP, which will enable her to purchase more goods such as beans, cooking oil, cassava, and many other items from Uganda to sell in Juba. She is very appreciative of the loan resources provided to her from KIVA through Finance South Sudan Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as beans, cooking oil, cassava and many other items from Uganda to sell.

loans.name: Honey Ve

texts.en:
Honey Ve works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Honey Ve requested a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Honey Ve is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $90. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as milk, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, noodles, water, salt, coffee, sugar, slippers and body lotion. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use:
to buy milk, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko,
cigarettes, noodles, water, salt, coffee, sugar, slippers and body lotion.

loans.name: Fenioel Elizia

texts.en:
Fenioel Elizia is 30 years old and is married with four children, two of whom attend school. 

He has been in this business for over five years, and works as a sole proprietor. The local breed of goat is preferred for meat and rearing, and the market is guaranteed. Some people even buy them for paying dowries. 

He has received one loan with Finance (SS) Limited, and paid on time. 

He intends to apply the proceeds of the loan to buy more goats to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Tabassum's Group

texts.en:
Tabassum is a leader of this group. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and she is a mother of two children. 

Her husband is an educated person; he has been running a primary school for the past few years. As the enrollment is increasing, he needs to purchase furniture for the school. However due to lack of financing, he finds it difficult.

Tabassum has asked for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband. He would purchase chairs and desks for his school with the loan. 

Tabussum hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's school; she prays for the success of her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and desks for her husband's school.

loans.name: Yenny Dalila

texts.es: Yenny de 29 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 8 años y  de 9 meses de edad.  Habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos desde hace 3 años.  Ella trabaja en servicios domésticos principalmente en lavado y planchado desde hace mucho tiempo. Su compañero de vida le colabora en la economía del hogar y juntos van sacando a su familia adelante. Desea construir un cuarto para dormitorio ya que su casa es una sola área común y no cuenta con una división para dormitorio. Esta es la razón por la que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos, para construir lo antes posible el dormitorio y dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yenny, age 29, has two children.  One is eight years old, and the other is nine months.  She has lived in her own house with her life partner and her children for three years.  She has worked providing domestic services, mainly washing and ironing, for a long time.  He life partner contributes to the household finances, and together they are getting their family ahead.

She wishes to build a room to be used as a bedroom because her house has only one common area.  It does not have a division for a bedroom.  This is the reason that she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to build the bedroom as soon as possible and to give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Shucaat

texts.en:
Shucaat is 39-year-old married man, and he has 3 children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. Shucaat has 10 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and the fruits also make fresh punch. His monthly income is approximately 120 AZN.

Shucaat applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and thus increase his monthly turnover. This will be his 1st loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe runs a sari-sari store for a living. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Fe sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store. Fe hopes of expanding her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Asilamo

texts.ru: Асиламо родилась в 1968 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправляет достаточно денег, чтобы Асиламо могла купить все необходимые средства для своих детей. Она решила организовать свой бизнес. Она хочет организовать бизнес скотоводством. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать свой бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Она нуждается вашей финансовой поддержки.
texts.en: Asilamo was born in 1968.  She is married and raising four children.  Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation and does not send enough money for Asilamo to buy all of the necessities for the children.  She decided to start her own business in animal husbandry.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12000 somoni to buy livestock in order to organize her business.  She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.  She needs your financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to start her business

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия живет в старой квартире вместе со своими 3 детьми. Она не имеет кормильца. Робия и ее дети потеряли самого любимого человека несколько лет назад. Ее муж умер. Робия молодая и умная женщина. Ей 32 года. Она имеет высшее образование. Робия работает в учебном центре. Она очень любит свою работу и много работает над своим знанием. Она получает ежемесячно зарплату и тратит для покупки продуктов питания и обучения детей. Она уже давно хочет отремонтировать свою квартиру. Ее квартира в плохом состоянии. Она должна обновить обои, покрасить двери и окна, а также отремонтировать потолок. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 12000  сомони для покупки строительных материалов как обои, краски и т.п. для ремонта квартиры. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Robiya lives in an old apartment with her three children.  She does not have a provider.  Robiya and her children lost their beloved person several years ago.  Her husband passed away.  Robiya is a young and smart woman.  She is 32 years old.  She has a higher education.  Robiya works at an educational center.  She loves her work very much and has worked many years for her knowledge.  She earns a monthly salary and spends it on purchases of food products and education for her children.  She has wanted to repair her apartment for a long time.  Her apartment is in a bad condition.  She has to update the wallpaper, paint doors and windows and also to repair the ceiling.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12000 somoni to purchase construction materials, such as wallpaper, paint, etc., to repair her apartment.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as wallpaper, paint, etc., to repair her apartment

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente, es una persona de 37 años de edad, de estado civil soltero pero actualmente vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene 3 dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, la actividad principal a la que se dedica  es la agricultura de tal forma produce;  Papa 150 cargas, Haba (verde)  60 cargas, Oca 42 cargas, Cebada 8 cargas, Avena (forraje) 100 calchas. La siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus terrenos propios en una superficie de 4 Hectáreas. que están  ubicadas en la misma comunidad, con este préstamo que realiza es para capital de operación para la compra de abono de gallinaza y Semilla de papa, una vez cosechada  sus productos el señor Vicente  en el futuro mejorará sus ingresos económicos y de igual manera la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Vicente is 37 years old, he is not married, but he lives with his partner. He completed elementary school, he owns his home - which is located in the community of Tiraque- and he has three dependants, his three sons. 

Vicente works in agriculture, producing about 150 loads of potatoes, 60 loads of lima beans, 42 loads of oca, 8 loads of barley and oats for forage. He plants these crops in his own field, an area of 4 hectares located in his community. With this loan, he will buy organic compost and potato seeds. Once he will harvest his products, Vicente will increase his profits, as well as quality of life for his children.

loans.use: to buy organic compost and potato seeds.

loans.name: Glenda Merari

texts.es:
Glenda es una joven de 24 años,  estudio hasta  bachillerato, es soltera, no tiene hijos. El negocio que tiene es hacer pan  cuando le queda tiempo libre  y comercializarlo con los vecinos en su comunidad, este trabajo lo aprendió de su madre, además de eso,  trabaja en una tienda, en donde ofrece los productos a sus clientes. 

Con el crédito pretende comprar los materiales para la elaboración del pan, como lo es la leche, la harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, vainilla  y leña para calentar el horno artesanal, para pagar a una persona, quien es la que le vende el pan en su comunidad.


A futuro, desea hacer crecer el negocio, comprar un horno que le facilite el trabajo, para emplear  a mas gente de su comunidad y surtir las tiendas de su comunidad y del pueblo cercano. Para seguir apoyando a sus padres económicamente, tener sus propia casa.
texts.en:
Glenda is 24 years old and earned her baccalaureate degree.  She is single and has no children.  She has a business making bread and selling it to her neighbors in her community when she has free time.  She learned this skill from her mother.  She also works in a store where she also offers her bread to the customers.  

With the loan, she intends to purchase the materials she needs to bake bread such as: milk, flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, vanilla, fire wood, and to pay an employee to sell the bread in the community.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business, purchase an oven that will facilitate her work, hire more employees from her community and and supply stores in her town and neighboring towns.  She also hopes to continue to help her family financially and have her own home.

loans.use: purchase milk, flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, vanilla, firewood for her brick oven, and pay one employee who sells her bread in her community.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her in a previous loan, as she was able to buy the spare parts and accessories for her tricycle. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business assisted in herr everyday expenses at home. Aside from having a tricycle unit, she also has a van for rent for additional income.
 
She is applying for another loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedes dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle (motorcycle).

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира родилась в 1969 года. Она разведенная женщина. Она имеет 2 детей, дочку и сына. Мунира более 15 лет является сиделкой пожилых людей. Этим она зарабатывает на жизнь. Мунира старается, чтобы ее дети выросли в достатке и получили высшее образование. Ее сын учиться в лицее. Он  учиться по специальности геолога во втором курсе. Ее дочь учиться тоже в лицее по специальности модельера. Она должна оплатить за учебу своих детей в лицее, но так как она имеет маленький доход, она не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для оплаты учебы детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munira was born in 1969.  She is divorced woman.  She has two children - a daughter and a son.  Munira has been working as an attendant to elderly people for over 15 years.  This is how she earns a living.  Munira tries hard to ensure that her children grew up with plentitude and obtained a higher education.  He attends a lyceum.  He has been studying to become a geologist for two years.  Her daugher also attends the same lyceum with a designer major.  Munira has to pay for her children's education at the lyceum, but because she has a low income, she cannot afford to pay for it.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to pay for her children's education.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more jewelry for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy different jewelry needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maribel hopes that her business will be more successful and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for jewelry that she will use in her business.

loans.name: Bubare Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
The Bubare group is located on the outskirts of Ibanda town. It is comprised mainly of women who fall into different categories of married, divorced and a few single mothers. 

Loyce is a single mother who divorced her husband because he married a second wife. She was left with five children and also takes care of her sister's daughter because her mother cannot provide her basic needs. Loyce runs a small retail shop with a capital of UGX 400,000 where she earns income to look after the family.  

She has applied for a loan of UGX 800,000 to add more stock to her retail shop, and she will use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. Her customers are neighbors and a few outsiders. Her major challenge is that her children often fall sick which requires a lot of money to pay hospital bills, and this affects her cash flow.

Despite these challenges, Loyce is a very honest and hardworking woman, striving hard to provide all her family's basics and send her children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman and mother of five grown children from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a fishing business, with her husband, for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters. Through this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.
 
Vilma hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters.

loans.name: Asilamo

texts.en:
Asilamo is a woman who is married and has 4 children. She was born in 1977. Her parents were busy with animal husbandry and she helped them with feeding the cattle, so she has a great deal of experience. She is married to a kind man. Her husband works at an art company and makes a small salary. Their oldest child is 15 and the smallest is 3 years old. Three of the children are schoolboys. 

Asilamo wants to organize her own business with animal husbandry because she needs the income. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ through a women's organization. She is very happy that she took part in this kind of course. She will buy cattle, feed them for some months and then sell them at the local market. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is a private entrepreneur from Yerevan. He lives with his wife, mother, and elderly pensioner grandmother. Vahagn's mother and wife work in the private sector. All family members work hard to be able to earn a living.

Vahagn runs a small local grocery store. The assortment of goods he sells in his store in not that big and needs to be updated periodically in order for it to function in a sustainable way. Vahagn currently needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase new items for selling in his store. 

Expanding the assortment of goods will give him the opportunity to expand his sales and become more compatible. Vahagn highly relies on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for helping him collect the needed amount of loan to sustain his small business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in his grocery store.

loans.name: Shirine Group

texts.en:
Itaf is the featured borrower of Shirine's group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.
 
Itaf is a 44-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in preparing Mouneh for four years now. She specializes in conserving food from one season to another. Itaf is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's necessary school fees.
 
Itaf is the lady at the far side of the picture holding a jar that contains one of her products. As for the other group members, Houeida is wearing a black top at the far left side of the picture, and Faten is sitting in the middle.

loans.use: to pay for her children's necessary school fees.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana de 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos los cuales están estudiando secundaria y viven con ella, está casada quien se dedica a la albañilería y trabajos agrícolas. Su grado de estudio es a penas noveno grado y a pesar de eso no ha desistido en la vida, siempre ha trabajado para salir adelante, con su esfuerzo ha logrado implementar un pequeño negocio el cual está generando ingresos para su familia.

Ana es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde muy pequeña se dedicaba a realizar ventas de antojitos como pasteles, papas, enchiladas y más. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 22 años y lo aprendió gracias a su madre, que siempre se dedicó a la venta ambulante y fue así como ella aprendió. Cuando tenía unos 12 años ya salía ayudar a su mamá, vendiendo casa por casa, y después de todo eso su mamá se enfermó y falleció.

 Para ella fue un golpe bien duro, pero a pesar de eso ha ido saliendo adelante y decidió hacer la misma actividad, pero ya en un puesto fijo. Otra de las cosas que le generan ingresos son lo de que en algunas veces lava ropa ajena y así obtiene más ingresos a su familia también el esposo le ayuda económicamente, antes no tenía negocio solo la experiencia que dejo su madre 

El dinero de este crédito, seria para la compra de insumos para el negocio, donde comprara al menos 5qq de papa, 3qq de maíz, arroz, aceite, repollo y más que todo esto será para disponer de más producto para vender, ya que le sale más cómodo comprar por mayoreo que comprar cada día que hace su venta. Con esto el cliente podrá tener mejores ingresos para su hogar.

   Uno de los sueños es crecer un poco más, con el negocio para darle mejores condiciones, a sus hijos y que una de sus metas es darles el estudio a ellos, hasta donde les permita ayudarle, además piensa que con las pocas ganancias que obtenga poder ir ahorrando para ir preparando su propia casa y poder vivir en lo propio.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 39 years old, is a mother of four children who are in secondary school and live with her. She is married and her husband works in construction and farming. She only has a ninth grade education but in spite of that she has never given up in life. She has always worked in order to get ahead and her efforts have allowed her to set up a small business which is generating income for her family. 

Ana is a very hard worker. Ever since she was very young she worked selling food like pastries, potatoes, enchiladas, and more. She has had her business for 22 years and learned it from her mother, who was always a street vendor, and that is how she learned. When she was about twelve, she was already going out to help her mother, selling door to door. After all of that, her mother became ill and has since passed away. This was a very hard blow for her, but in spite of it she has kept moving forward and decided to continue in the same business, but in a permanent spot. 

Another way she makes money is by washing other people's clothing. That allows her to obtain extra income for her family. Her husband also helps her financially. Before she didn't have a business, only the experience her mother left her.

The money from this loan will be to stock her business. She will purchase at least 500 lbs of potatoes, 300 lbs of corn, rice, oil, cabagge, and other items in order to have more product available for sale, because it is easier for her to buy wholesale than to purchase each day she makes her sales. This will allow this client to have better income for her household.

One of her dreams is to expand her business a bit further in order to improve her children's situation, since one of her goals is to give them an education as best she can. She also believes that whatever little income she obtains will allow her to save up money in order to condition her home and live in something she owns.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, corn, oil, and cabagge to stock her business.

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN ANTONIO DE JICAMARCA” es un grupo puntual en sus cuotas. Quienes se encuentran muy contentos por estar pasando el 06 ciclo. Sonia tiene 36 años es conviviente con 03 hijos educando hace muchos se dedica a la crianza de aves menores y de cerdos. Es de esta manera que puede apoyar a su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería y conductor de auto. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus aves y cerdos. Su mayor deseo es agradar su actividad de crianzade aves y cerdos para poder ofrecer a los mercados grandes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Sonia es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste chompa de color acero.
texts.en:
San Antonio de Jicamarca is a group that makes its payments on time. Its members are very happy to be in their sixth cycle. 

Sonia is 36 years old. She lives with her partner and is raising three children. She has been working raising small animals and pigs for a long time. This allows her to help her husband, who works in construction and as a car driver. She will invest this loan in purchasing feed for her fowl and pigs. Her greatest wish is to expand her animal-raising business in order to offer her fowl and pigs to the larger markets. 

This group wants to thank Kiva lenders for the loans they grant. Sonia is the third person from the left, wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy feed for her fowl and pigs.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, está casado, tiene la edad de 48 años, vive con su esposa y 3 hijos   que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como abonos y plaguicidas para la asistencia de sus siembras de maíz y frijol.  El cuenta con unos terreno a su poder ya sembrados y necesita darle mejorar para tener sus plantaciones en condiciones optimas para generar más producción este año. El espera venderla a un muy buen precio y obtener de esta mayores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Es el tercer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gerardo is married and he is 48 years old. He lives with his wife and three children, who are his main priority. He will use this loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and pesticides for his crops of corn and beans. He has some land already planted and he needs to improve it so that his crops have the optimal conditions to yield a bigger harvest this year. He hopes to sell his products at a very good price and obtain a higher profit for his family's wellbeing. This is the third loan he receives from FUDECOSUR. They grant him loans with easier payment terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Sadaddin

texts.en:
Sadaddin is 39 years old. He is married and he has four children. Sadaddin is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He grows seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumber, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. He has eight years of experience, but in spite of the short period he has been in this business, he has gained respect from local vendors because he produces a good organic crop without chemical fertilizers.

Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch.

Sadaddin sells his crop from his yard and sometimes takes it to the local bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN and he would like to expand his business and purchase more seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops and increase his sales. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. This will be his first loan.

loans.use: to expand his business and purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zubayda

texts.ru: Зубайда давно мечтала организовать свой бизнес, но она не имела возможности, так как дети были маленькими, и она занималась их воспитанием. Данное время она уже женщина в возрасте и дети имеют своё отдельное домохозяйство. Теперь она имеет возможность организовать бизнес. Зубайда хочет организовать свой бизнес скотоводством. Ее муж поддержал ее идею и обещал помочь ей откармливать скота. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она надеется на ваше благотворительность.
texts.en:
Zubayda has wanted to start a business for a while, but she did not have the chance because she was raising her young children. Now she is an older woman and her children have their own households, so she has an opportunity to start a business. 

Zubayda wants to start a business in animal husbandry. Her husband supports her idea and promised to help her fatten the cattle. Zubayda completed a course titled "Achieve Success", organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and received a certificate. She is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to buy livestock. She appreciates your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle and start a business

loans.name: Istoda

texts.ru: Истода женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она замужем и воспитывает 5 детей. Истода трудится упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить своих детей. Она 4 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей сухофруктов. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она очень общительная женщина и поэтому она в состоянии привлечь много клиентов. Истода хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким путем увеличить доход, так как она нуждается больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Istoda is a woman with a beautiful soul and beautiful thoughts. She is married and is raising five children. Istoda works hard to earn money and feed her children. Four years ago she started her business buying and selling dried fruit. She has a shop in the local market. She is a very sociable woman and therefore is able to attract many customers. Istoda wants to increase her working capital and thereby increase revenue, since she needs more revenue. She is asking for a loan of 3000 KGS to buy dried fruit. She's awaiting your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: buy dried fruit to increase sales.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es: Julia, a sus 67 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de comidas y alimentos fritos ubicado al borde de una carretera muy transitada de la región de Córdoba, allí labora desde hace 10 años, de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 2:00 pm, cuenta con el apoyo de otra persona y de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar y apoyar económicamente a sus 3 hijos, pues la carga económica recayó sobre ella luego del fallecimiento de su esposo. La cliente manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir trabajando, pues le gusta lo que hace y además se siente útil. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de sillas y mesas, insumos al por mayor (carne, aceite, verduras, gaseosas, entre otros) y para realizar unas adecuaciones al espacio donde se encuentra ubicada; esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio y ofrecer más comodidad a sus comensales, además tendrá disponibilidad de insumos para aumentar su producción y sus ventas, todo esto se reflejará en el aumento de los ingresos con los que podrá seguir sustentando a su familia. Julia quiere seguir trabajando arduamente y espera poder cumplir el sueño de tener su negocio en un local propio ubicado en la ciudad, para seguir con su labor hasta que Dios se lo permita y dejar un buen legado para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia, at 67 years of age, has her own business, a stall where she sells meals and fried food. Her stall is located besides a very busy highway in the Córdoba region.  She has had this business for 10 years and works Monday to Saturday, from 6 a.m. till 2 p.m.  She has one other person to help her. In this way she generates sufficient income to support her household and to help her three grown children financially since this burden fell on her after her husband died.

This client states that her age does not prevent her from continuing to work since she enjoys what she is doing and feels useful. Currently she is requesting a loan in order to purchase chairs and tables as well as supplies wholesale (meat, oil, vegetables and soft drinks, among other items) and to make some improvements in the space where she is located.This will enable her to improve her business’ image and provide her diners with a more comfortable experience. In addition she will have supplies available to expand production and sales. All this will be reflected in an increase in earnings. Thus she will be able to continue supporting her family.

Julia wants to continue working hard and hopes to be able to fulfill her dream of having her business in her own locale, in the city. She wants to continue working as long as God permits and leave a good legacy for her children.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs and  wholesale supplies (meat, oil, vegetables and soft drinks, among other items) and to upgrade the space where she is located.

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira is a 57-year-old widowed woman. She has one son.  Zemfira is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her son in the Agdash IDP Settlement.  She is a Fuzulu refugee. 

When she was 30, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years.

Zemfira’s income from her business is 150 AZN. In order to increase the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes in the near future her sons will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruits business is profitable and a fun business, she wants the business to continue and prosper. Zemfira needs a 1500 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. 

Her biggest wish is to offer her son an education so that he can have a good career and help his mother. This is going to be her first loan. Zenfira hopes that Kiva will help her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees.

loans.name: Honorita

texts.en:
Honorita is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown up children from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area.

Honorita is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers in her area. 

In the future, Honorita hopes to expand her store so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru: Сайфулло пекарь, скотовод и житель города Истаравшан. Ему 32 года. Он женат, детей пока не имеет. У Сайфулло собственный лепешечный цех, где он каждый день выпекает горячие традиционные лепешки для продажи. Одновременно Сайфулло занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. Этим бизнесом он уже занимается 5 лет. Сайфулло обратился за кредитом для своей животноводческой деятельности. Он просит кредит, чтобы закупить одну корову и продолжить свой бизнес по откорму и продаже скота.
texts.en: Saifullo is a baker, a cattleman and a resident of Istaravshan. He is 32 years old. He is married but has no children yet. Saifullo owns his own bakery where he bakes traditional flat bread every day. At the same time Saifullo raises cattle. He has been doing this for five years. Saifullo applied for a loan for his work with livestock. He is asking for a loan to buy a cow and continue fattening and selling cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда вместе со своей семьей живет в сельской местности. Она замужем и мать 5 детей. Умеда работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера, для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить своих детей. Умеда более 10 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как картошка, лук и т.п. Она имеет свою землю. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Умеда постепенно улучшает условию проживания для своих детей. Умеда должна построить дом для своего сына. Ее сын женат и имеет детей, но не имеет собственного дома. Умеда запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, камень и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Umeda and her family live in a rural area. She is married and the mother of five children. Umeda works hard from early morning until late at night in order to make money and feed her children. For more than ten years, Umeda has farmed crops like potatoes, onions, etc. She has her own land. Her husband helps run her business. Umeda is gradually improving living conditions for her children. Umeda must build a house for her son. Her son is married and has children, but does not have his own home. Umeda is asking for a loan of 5,000 KGS to buy construction materials such as cement, wood, stone, etc. She's awaiting your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement, wood, and stone.

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es: Ana Karina es una Joven Soltera, sin hijos, habita con sus Padres, depende económicamente de ellos, su papá trabaja para una empresa Privada, y su mama es maestra de educación Primaria imparte clases en una escuela Pública, ellos se sacrifican para que su hija Ana Estudie. Sin embargo Ana ha tenido dificultad en sus Estudios, ya que no cuenta con el recurso suficiente para terminar su Carrera, por lo que se avecina el Titulo de su Licenciatura en Contabilidad y necesita pagarlo, asi como tambien los gastos de titulacion.  El logro de obtener su titulo le permitira  ser una excelente profesional y poner en prácticas sus conocimientos para el bien de su Familia y la Sociedad.
texts.en:
Ana Karina is a young single woman, without children, who lives with her parents. She depends on them economically. Her father works for a private company and her mother is a primary school teacher at a public school. They make sacrifices so that their daughter, Ana can study. Nevertheless, Ana has had difficulties with her studies since she does not have sufficient resources to finish her training. She is close to finishing her degree in Accounting and needs to pay the tuition and credential fees. 

Success in obtaining her degree will enable her to become an excellent professional and put her knowledge to work for the good of her family and society.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Josue Elias

texts.es: El señor Josué vive en la población de Entre Ríos, tiene un hijo dependiente del cual cuida y por el cual trabaja cada día para salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de ensaladas, comidas rápidas y otros aperitivos en un snack. su actividad económica se encuentra en una esquina de la plaza en un lugar estratégico donde va mucha clientela a consumir sus productos, el señor Josué  tiene un lote urbano lo cual adquirió con su esfuerzo del trabajo realizado y es donde quiere construir una vivienda ya que  actualmente vive en anticrético para ello solicita este préstamo para llevar a cabo la obra de construcción ya que el dinero con que cuenta no le alcanza. Con este crédito el señor Josué  podrá ser capaz de realizar su objetivo propuesto tener una casa donde vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Josué lives in Entre Ríos.  He has a dependent son he cares for and for whom he works every day in order to get ahead.  He works selling salads, fast-food and other snacks in his snack bar.  His economic activity is located on a corner of the square in a strategic spot frequented by many passers-by that come to enjoy his products. 

Josué owns an urban lot that he bought with much work effort where he wants to build his house since he’s currently living under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].  This is why he’s asking for the loan to carry out the construction project since he does not have enough money to do so.  With this loan, Josué will be able to reach his set goal of owning a house in which to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
María Verónica tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la actividad de comercio y agricultura que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo en la región de Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

María Verónica es una mujer emprendedora se dedica desde hace 3 años al servicio de tipeos e impresiones en su propio domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio con la compra de útiles de escritorio y la otra parte para darle mantenimiento a sus máquinas ofreciendo un mejor servicio para sus clientes, generándole de esta manera mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Verónica, 39, lives with her husband and son in a large community in the Cayalti urban zone.  Its residents work in commerce and agriculture.  It belongs to Chiclayo Province in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.

María Verónica is an enterprising woman who for the last three years has been providing  transcription and printing services at home.  She’s asking for a 1,000 new sol loan to expand the business purchasing office supplies and to service her machinery to provide better customers service thus ensuring higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy office supplies.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Valentina es una señora de 66 años de edad, originaria del Rama, RAAN. Madre soltera de 2 hijos ya independientes. Su oficio es de Secretaria, dedicada con empeño a su negocio de Cyber y alquiler de Videos juegos. Negocio que inicio hace 25 años, el cual le resulto más rentable que su negocio anterior de estudios fotográficos. Hoy en día además del cyber cuenta con el alquiler de Videos juegos. Su meta próxima es tener equipos modernos y cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de los equipos de computadora y comprar consolas de video  juegos, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio  a los clientes. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que aumentara las demandas y podrá cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es obtener más equipos tanto de computadoras como de videos juegos, para crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Valentina is a 66-year-old lady from El Rama, RAAN (Northern Atlantic Autonomous Region). She is a single mother of two adult children. Her occupation is secretary. She works dedicatedly in her business, a cyber cafe where she also rents video games. She started her business 25 years ago, and it turned out to be more profitable than her previous business, which was a photography studio. In addition to the cyber cafe, today she rents video games as well. Her next goal is to update her equipment and meet her customers' demands. 

She is requesting this loan for computer equipment maintenance and to purchase video game consoles in order to give her customers better service. She estimates the loan will be beneficial because it will increase demand and she will be able to meet her customers' needs. Her plan for the future is to acquire more equipment, both computers and video games, to expand her business.

loans.use: to maintain her computer equipment and buy video game consoles.

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa María, quien es madre soltera por efectos de viudez, se ha dedicado al abastecimiento de diversos productos perecederos todos los días en su barrio y los fines de semana prepara una deliciosa comida típica que se vende como pan caliente entre sus vecinos. Con este negocio, quien ha desarrollado a través de créditos otorgados anteriormente, ella ha podido apoyar a sus dos hijos, principalmente al menor que tiene capacidades diferentes. Elsa solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio, comprando productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, cereales, refrescos y otros, garantizando que sus vecinos la apoyan al comprarle siempre.
texts.en: Elsa María is a single mother due to widowhood.  She’s worked supplying perishable items every day in her neighborhood and on weekends prepares delicious traditional meals like hot bread that she sells among her neighbors.  By means of this business that she’s developed over time thanks to the loans she’s been able to support her two children especially the younger one who is disabled. She’s asking for the loan to invest in her business purchasing such products as rice, beans, sugar, oil, cereals, soft-drinks and others ensuring that her neighbor will support her by buying from her always.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
For four years, Albelardo has operated El Brother Tire Shop selling new and used tires in his tire repair shop. As the only employee of the shop, Albelardo normally finances his business from his savings. 

Recently, he needed funds to pay for the construction of a carport and for inventory. After a friend informed Albelardo about nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc., Albelardo applied and was approved for a loan.

Originally from Guatemala, Coban, Mexico, Albelardo says the loan will help his shop compete with the competition by making him look more professional. He says his future goal is to create jobs.

loans.use: to fund a carport and purchase inventory.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six. Her husband works in a nearby factory. 

Kishwar owns a small business selling ladies ready-made garments at home. She purchases ready-made garments from the market with her husband at low prices and sells them in her community at a higher price. The ladies of the town like her clothing selection for dresses and demand more variety because it is the marriage season. She also suggests to ladies which dress suits them and which one should be worn according to occasion. Her husband affords all the expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only to make savings. She requested a loan so that she could buy more variety of garments to fulfill the seasonal demand.

Kishwar wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide a better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy readymade garments for resale.

loans.name: Normaliza

texts.en:
Normaliza owns a retail store and raises hogs for sale. She is 38 years of age, married and blessed with two children who currently attend school. Normaliza's income from her retail store goes toward their daily consumption and allowances for her two children.

Normaliza wants to maintain her hog raising business, but due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 (Philippine pesos). She will use this loan in purchasing hog feed and medicine to nourish her hogs with proper nutrition for reaching their optimum growth. 

Normaliza is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount so she can secure her family’s future and be able to let her two children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and medicine for her hogs.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina’s age is 42. She is married and lives with her husband and 3 children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is doing a grocery job in a mill for very low wages. Her children are young still and fully dependent upon their parents. Sakina does not have any other source of income to meet household expenses so she decided to start a tailoring business at home.

Sakina purchases cloth at cheap rates, sews the garments and her husband supplies it into the market. She has been doing this since 2005. Now she has experience and knows cloth dealing very well. 

Sakina wants to utilize her clothing experience and wants to get more profit but she is compelled to take a loan due to her low financial condition. Therefore, she wants to take a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she could grow her business. 

Sakina's dreams are to provide better facilities, living standards and charming clothes to her children.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Dora Del Socorro

texts.es: Dora es originaria de San Francisco Libre, Managua. De 51 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada con esmero a su pulpería, la cual inicio hace varios años, con una venta pequeña, a medida de eso iba aumentando su nivel de compras y ventas. Hoy en día cuenta con variedad de productos en su negocio. Su meta próxima es comprar más productos para brindar una mercadería variada demandada por los clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos principales tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, entre otros, con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que con este crédito le ayudara a aumentar sus ventas y a obtener mayores  ganancias, además a aumentar la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer una tienda de ropa, zapatos, etc.
texts.en:
Dora, 51, is from San Francisco Libre, Managua.  She’s married and mother of four children.  She’s a merchant by profession running her store  with much dedication.   She opened it several years ago with just a few goods but as her sales have increased she’s increased them.  Today, she has a wide variety of products in her store.

Her next goal is to buy more products to provide more variety to meet customer demand.  She’s asking for the loan to buy the main products like rice, sugar, beans and oil, among others in order to meet customer needs.  She figures that with the loan she’ll be able to increase sales and earn higher profits.  Also, customer demand will rise.  Her future plan is to open a store selling clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 55 años de edad, es separada y junto a sus hijas y 01 nieta en el distrito de Cayaltí una zona donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y la agricultura, ubicado a 02 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque en la costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener mejores condiciones de vida, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, percibe ingresos por una mototaxi que lo alquila para uso de transporte y vende cerveza y alimentos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de aves de corral y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sara, 55, is separated living with her daughters and a niece in Cayalti district, a zone whose population works selling small animals and in agriculture.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.

They are a family that strives to have better living conditions.  She raises barnyard fowl to sell and earns income leasing out a mototaxi to provide transportation services.  She also sells beer and food.

She’s requested a 1,000 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl and to have more variety to offer her customers thus ensuring higher family income.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge vive en la comunidad de Colomi, de 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene un hijo pequeño porque cuenta con la custodia de su hijo, vive en la casa de su madre, económicamente es independiente,  percibe ingresos económicos de la actividad agrícola ya que produce papa y haba en terreno de 2 Has de herencia de sus padres, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, El Sr Jorge requiere el crédito para la compra de semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos para la siembra de este año, necesita urgente estos insumos agrícolas por la época de siembra y aprovechar con esta época de lluvia, por tal motivo solicitar un préstamo.  Mencionar que con el crédito solicitado podrá realizar la siembra de papa y haba y contribuir con la seguridad alimentaria de la región y poder generar ingresos económicos a través de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the Colomi communuty. He is 28 years old and single. He has a small child of whom he has custody. He lives in his mother’s house and is self-supporting. He earns a living from farming and produces potatoes and broad beans in a 2 hectare plot, which he inherited from his parents. He does crop rotation and has experience in this area.

Jorge needs a loan to purchase potato seed and agrochemicals for this year’s planting. He urgently needs these agricultural supplies for this year’s planting season so that he can take advantage of the rainy season. Thus he will be able to plant potatoes and broad beans this year and contribute to food security in the region and generate earnings through farming.

loans.use: to purchase seed potato and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes  (Jipijapa) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen De Lourdes está formado por 11 señoras que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, ellos se dedican a varias actividades entre ellas la agricultura, y el comercio en general. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Karina Consuelo, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 5 y 3 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es agricultor. 
Doña Karina Consuelo es una muy buena madre y esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido en su labor,  él tienen cultivos de maíz, maní y ciertas verduras, en la actualidad están en la época de recolección del maíz y el crédito lo van a emplear para pagar la mano de obra de dicha actividad y con esto poder guardar el maíz unos cuantos meses y luego venderlos a mejor precio ya que el precio que le pagan actualmente es muy bajo y al venderlo así tendría muchas pérdidas, es por eso que el crédito les permite guardarlo y luego si vender a un precio razonable que le permita tener ganancias por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito es para pago de mano de obra en la recolección del maíz, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien. 
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen De Lourdes comprises eleven women who meet biweekly in the canton of Jipijapa, which is very well-known for its vast coffee plantations. The coffee from this region has an incomparable taste. The region is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people, who work in different fields like agriculture and trade in general. 

Karina Consuelo is one of the members of this group. She is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She and her partner have three children, who are ages eleven, five, and three. The two older ones are in school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Karina Consuelo is a very good wife and mother who is requesting this loan in order to help her husband with his work. They grow corn, peanuts, and some vegetables. They are currently harvesting their corn and will use this loan to hire help from laborers. This will allow them to store the corn for a few months before selling it for a better price, since current prices are very low and selling now would result in great losses. That is why this loan will allow them to store it and eventually sell it at a reasonable price that will report a profit for their family's wellbeing.

This loan will be used to pay for labor during the corn harvest. She has belonged to the communal bank from the beginning and enjoys it because of the help she receives from the bank. Her dream is to see her children finish school and become upstanding people.

The small picture depicts a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
Ina is 34 years old, married and the mother of four school age children. The family lives in the village of Gamdlistskaro and runs an agricultural business to earn a living. Ina breeds six milk cows and produces dairy products, cheese and butter, with the milk. She sells the cheese and butter in the capital city open market. She works hard to feed her children but her earnings often are not enough to cover her costs.

In order to generate income, Ina and her husband decided to start a business. Ina’s relative advised them to serve tourists by car and transport them in mountainous regions of Georgia in return for a service fee. Their relative will also connect Ina’s husband to tourists and help him in communication. For this reason, the family decided to apply for the credit and buy a secondhand car for Ina’s husband to start working as a driver. He will transport foreigners and generate income. The couple hopes their project will be successful and they will improve the standard of living for their children.
Ina awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to work in the transportation business.

loans.name: Las Modelos Group

texts.es:
Evangelina es una señora casada de 24 años de edad, quien vive junto a sus 2 hijos y su esposo en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.  
Es una persona amable y sobre todo trabajadora, ella se dedica a fabricar prendas de vestir típicos que son utilizados por las mujeres indígenas de su región. Esto  los vende en el mercado local y a personas que le hacen algunos pedidos personales.
Ella  inicio este trabajo hace 7 años, aprendiéndolo de su madre desde pequeña. Comenta que este tipo de negocio es bastante rentable ya que se obtienen ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayuda aportar a la economía de su familia.
Por la temporada del año ella y sus compañeras han visto que estas prendas tienen mejor demanda, de esta manera deciden invertir más capital en su negocio, solicitando un préstamo para la compra hilos de varios colores y jaspeado (hilo teñido con figuras)  para fabricar mayor cantidad de prendas y tener mejores ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio, para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Evangelina, 24, is a married woman living with her two children and husband in Suchitepéquez Department.  She’s a kind, above all hardworking, person who works making traditional costumes used by indigenous women in her region.  She sells them in the local market and to individuals that place personal orders.

She started this work 7 years ago having learned from her mother when she was little.  She comments that this type of business is quite profitable in that good income and acceptable profits can be earned from it that help her contribute to her family’s economy.

Because of the season of the year she and her companions have seen demand rise for these articles of clothing which is why they’ve decided to invest more in the business and have asked for a loan to buy thread in various colors and ‘jaspeado’ [speckled or mottled thread] to manufacture larger numbers of items and earn higher profits.  Her greatest wish is to generate higher profits by means of her business in order to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Cladys

texts.es:
Cladys tiene 42 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en la Bocana una zona rural de Morropon donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Piura en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica hace más de 02 años a la venta de miel de abeja y algarrobina en su propio domicilio, también envía pedidos a otras ciudades, estos productos propios de la zona que se caracteriza por sus bondades curativas, ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles con la finalidad de mejorar la presentación de sus productos y adquirir en mayor cantidad la materia prima, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cladys, 42, lives with her husband in La Bocana, a rural zone in Morropón whose population works in commerce and in agriculture.  It’s located in Piura Region on Peru’s northern coast.

She’s worked more than two years selling honey and carob syrup at home and also ships orders to other cities.  These products are typical of the zone that’s noted for its curative properties.  She’s asked for a 1,500 new sol loan to improve her products' packaging and to acquire larger amounts of raw materials thus generating higher family income.

loans.use: to buy honey and carob syrup.

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guissela tiene 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposo en Morropon una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de de animales menores, que se encuentra ubicado a en la Región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo en su domicilio los fines de semana y los días lunes, martes y jueves realiza el servicio de limpieza en domicilios particulares y negocios de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglar la fachada y cuartos de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Guissela, 38, lives with her husband in Morropón, a community dedicated to agriculture and small animal commerce located in Piura Region on Peru’s northern coast.

She works selling pork at home on weekends and on Monday, Tuesday and Thursday works cleaning private homes and businesses in the zone. 

She’s asked for a 1,000 new sol loan to repair the façade and the bedrooms at home.

loans.use: to improve her home's facade.

loans.name: Ibodatkhon

texts.en:
Ibodatkhon is 41 years old and married with four children. Being a responsible mother, Ibodatkhon works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send some of her children to school. 

She started her farming business four years ago, growing potatoes and wheat on her own land. Nowadays, she grows greens and tomatoes. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she works hard from early morning until late evening.

Ibodatkhon would like to develop her business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. 

She awaits your support. She thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila earns a living through her seaweed farming business. She lives in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has six children. Leonila has been in the business with her husband for more than 20 years now.

Leonila is asking for a loan to buy more seaweed seedlings. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her seaweed farm. Leonila hopes to make her business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for their needs and to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for pigs

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos Eduardo tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Buenos Aires una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura en la costa norte del Perú.

El realiza el servicio de fotografías, videos y fotomontajes, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en mantenimiento y mejora de sus equipos de trabajo, ofreciendo de esta manera un mejor servicio a sus clientes, es reconocido en su comunidad porque es el único que ofrece tal servicio.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo, 29, lives with his wife in Buenos Aires district, a community dedicated to agriculture and commerce in Morropón Province belonging to Piura Region on Peru’s northern coast.

He provides photography, video and photo-montage services and has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to invest in service and improvement of his work equipment thus offering better customers service.  He’s noted in his community because he’s the only one offering this service.

loans.use: to service his equipment.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old. He is a father of five children aged between 4 and 17. He runs a restaurant and has been in the business for the past eight years. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more foodstuffs to use in his restaurant as he prepares food for his customers. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest much money in the business to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for better preparing food for the customers in the restaurant.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is 47 years old and a widow, with two children, four and two years old. She is trying to raise her children without feeling the absence of their father too much.  She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her kids in the Agdash IDP Settlement.  

She began working as a merchant. She sells different things: dishes, clothes, blankets. She would like to increase revenues from her business and improve the living conditions of her children. After all, the goal of this business is their future. 

Reyhan requests a loan for the purchase of industrial and household goods wholesale. The sum she needs is AZN 1,000.

loans.use: to purchase industrial and household goods wholesale

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 30 años de edad, vive en Buenos Aires una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en general ubicado en la Provincia de Morropon en la región Piura en la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a realizar transporte en su mototaxi, sus clientes son los transeúntes que lo solicitan y sus vecinos a solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de su servicio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, 30, lives in Buenos Aires, a community dedicated to general commerce located in Morropón Province in Piura Region on Peru’s north coast.

He works providing mototaxi transport services.  His customers are passers-by that request it and his neighbors.  He’s asked for a 500 new sol loan to service his vehicle in order to improve the quality of his service.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Humu Hawa

texts.en:
Meet Humu Hawa. She is a 43-year-old from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with seven children between the ages of 5 years and 29 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2003, Humu Hawa established a general merchandise business within a busy market area. She began her business because she wanted to change her status of living; she works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes sales are very slow.

Humu Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase cooking oil, rice and flour for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and improve her standard of living. In the future, Humu Hawa plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice and flour for resale.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Intibucá. Hace varios años que doña María se dedica a su propio negocio de confección y venta de delantales o gabachas de cocina para vender. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos, y los elabora en su casa. Ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 3,500.00 Lempiras y los utilizara para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de delantales como ser la tela, hilos, encajes etc. su meta es apoyar a su familia con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
María, 62, is married and her husband works in agriculture; she has two children and lives in the town of Intibucá.  She’s had her own business making and selling aprons or kitchen smocks for several years.  She works based on prior orders and makes them at home.

She’s decided to ask ODEF for her third loan for 3,500 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, lace, etc. to make aprons.  Her goal is to support her family with the profits she earns.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and lace to make aprons to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer casada de 47  años de edad, actualmente vive junto a sus 5 hijos y su esposo en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
Ella es una mujer que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Comenta que actualmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada a unos metros de su vivienda. Eligio esta actividad porque es rentable y productiva.
Ahora cuenta con 12 años de tener su negocio que le ha generado buenos ingresos y ganancias, que le han servido para solventar los gastos de su familia. Por lo que ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la  compra de productos de consumo diario, para poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es incrementar más sus ganancias para poder abrir otra tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, 47, is a woman living with her five children and husband in Suchitepéquez District.  She’s a woman who strives for her family’s well-being.  She comments that she currently has a grocery store located a few meters from her home.  She chose this activity because it was profitable and productive.

She’s now had the store for 12 years and it’s generated good income and profits that have helped her cover her family expenses.  She’s now decided to request a 7,000 Quetzal loan to buy basic daily staple goods to offer better customer service and increase profits that way.

Her dream is to increase profits more to be able to open another grocery store in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Ronald Giovanni

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 36 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de edades 16 años, 11 años, 2 años y 5 meses de edad. Los dos primeros cursan primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará, vive en casa propia de material rustico por un lapso de 19 años, es natural de la zona, cuenta con buenas referencias personales y económicas.

La actividad que realiza es la cría y comercio de aves de corral como gallinas, patos. Los compras en los caseríos y anexos de la zona, así como el suyo y vende en el distrito de Pucará, así como también lo sacrifica y vende por kilos, tiene 6 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Ademas se dedica a brindar servicio como peón agrícola en chacras de arroz obteniendo ingresos adicionales para cubrir los gastos de su familia.

Ronald ha solicitado un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio de compra de aves, así como de otros animales menores, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ronald is 36 years old and is the father of four children, ages 16, 11, 2 and 5 months. His two eldest children attend the local middle and high school in Pucará. Ronald and his family have lived in their own house for the past 19 years. Ronald is an upstanding man of good character who comes highly recommended as a borrower.

Ronald makes a living raising and selling farm birds such as chickens and ducks. He purchases his birds in surrounding villages and sells both live birds and their meat in the center of Pucará. He has 6 years of experience in this industry. To supplement his income from his business and make ends meet to provide for his family, Ronald also works as an agricultural day laborer on rice farms.

With the support from this loan, Ronald plans to purchase birds and other small animals to strengthen and grow his business. He hopes this investment will help him increase his overall income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase birds and small animals to expand his business.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom is purposeful young man. He was born in 1992. He is hardworking and glorious. Bahrom studied at the school very well and he was one of the best pupils. 

Nowadays, Bahrom is a student of the forth course. He studies at the Tajikistan Metal- Mountain University. He wants to search natural resources in his land, Tajikistan. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. 

His parents have been busy with farming. Bahrom helps his parents with farming in free time from classes.  Bahrom has a lot of plans for future and he awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university

loans.name: Isabelito

texts.en:
Isabelito earns a living through his hog raising business. He lives with his family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Isabelito has been in the hog raising business for more than 3 years now.

Isabelito is asking for a loan to buy more animal feed. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is 27 years old and married to his beautiful wife, with two children. Herbert previously worked for a wig company along with his wife for six years. After the birh of their second child, Herbert voluntarily stopped working and decided to take care of their children. 

Although Herbert had no solid income, he came up of an idea of breeding pigs in their backyard. For almost three years now, Herbert has been very succesful with this alternative business of his. But a few months ago, their neighbors started to complain due to the stink. Because of the complaints, Herbert decided to transfer his pigpen to the other side of their backyard near a stream and build a fresh new pigpen. 

That's why Herbert decided to apply for a loan to finance the construction of his new pigpen.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his new pigpen.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy trabajador es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho en su trabaja como maestro de construcción, Juan trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy cumplido y responsable.

Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar y renovar sus herramientas de trabajo como escaleras, martillos, combas, cinceles, entre otros, de esta manera podrá realizar mejor su trabajo y poder mejorar sus ingresos y así luchar por hacer realidad su sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijas y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hard-working man. He has three children whom he loves very much, and that's why he works so hard on a daily basis as a master builder. Juan works about 9 hours a day and he believes that he does well in his line of work because he's very polite and responsible.

Juan is grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he'll be able to purchase and renew his working tools such as ladders, hammers, sledge hammers, chisels, etc. That way he'll be able to do a better job and increase his profits. Therefore he'll strive to make his dream come true, which is to provide his daughters with a professional career and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tools.

loans.name: Jovanna Esther

texts.es:
Jovanna Esther tiene 28 años de edad es soltera , sin hijos, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Oyotún una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la región Lambayeque costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 08 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para que posteriormente los engorde y los venda a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Jovanna Esther, 28, is single with no children.  She lives with her parents in Oyotún District, an agricultural community two hours away from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region on Perú’s north coast.  

She’s been raising and selling animals in her back yard for 8 years and has requested a 2,000 new sol loan to buy small animals to sell at a higher price after she fattens them up.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 59 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural de Oyotun donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores en la zona rural de Oyotun a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
