Son una familia unida, Emilio se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio y ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar animales pequeños para luego ofrecerlos a sus clientes de las zonas aledañas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Emilio, 59, lives with his wife in a rural zone in Oyotún whose population works in agriculture and selling small animals.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

They are a unified family.  Emilio works raising and selling animals and has more than 15 years’ business experience.  He’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000 new sol loan to buy small animals to subsequently sell to his customers in zones adjacent to his community.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged between two and six. None of them goes to school. She has been selling animals for the previous six years and has been successful in her business. She has requested the loan to expand and buy more animals such as cows for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Agustin Roly

texts.es:
Agustín Roly tiene 35 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a sus 2 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotun donde su población realiza las actividades de agricultura y comercio de animales pequeños, dicho distrito está ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica desde hace 08 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en mejorar los corrales de sus animales y la compra de los mismos, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustín Roly, 35, is married living with his wife  and two children in Oyotún district whose population works in agriculture and selling small animals.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region on Peru’s north coast.

He’s worked raising and selling small animals for 8 years.  His business is located in his back yard and he’s asked for a 1,500 new sol loan to repair his animal corrals and to buy more animals to generate higher family income.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Azar

texts.en:
Azar is 41 years old and has two kids. Azar  is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Agdash IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He grows fruits and vegetables in he is garden and has been doing this for the last eight years.  He is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of the land and how to work it. 

Azar usually grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes.  His monthly income from this business is 120 AZN. This is only one source of income in his family.

Now he would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1200 AZN. He hopes this loan will improve life for his family.

loans.use: to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid, a 29-year-old man, lives in the city of Sana`a, Yemen. He is a symbol of ambition and industry. He is an employee in an electricity association getting a low salary. He said his salary is not enough to cover household expenses. He intends to buy home improvements but, he has no money to acquire what he needs. Therefore, he applied for a loan to pay for his new house furniture. He looks forward to continuing accumulating money to build own house, and to buy a taxi to increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for his new house furniture.

loans.name: Soliya

texts.en:
Soliya is 64 years old. She is a teacher at the school. Soliya has great experience in teaching. She is a widow. Her husband died 10 years ago. She married her children alone. 

Nowadays she has a big family. She has 4 children, daughter-in-laws and some grandchildren. Her younger son works in Russia. Her family needs a big house and that’s why some years ago she began to build a new house. Some work needs to be done to finish the building of the new house, but Soliya has no money to build her house. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as wood and slate. Ultimately, she will make a roof on her new house. She awaits your support and charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as wood and slate.

loans.name: Martiniana

texts.en:
Martiniana is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. She works with her husband in tilling their farm.

Martiniana is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm. 

In the future, Martiniana hopes to make her farming venture a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Ayda Nancy

texts.es:
Ayda tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial y para poder salir adelante trabaja como obrera de un fundo agrícola, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y lo hace con mucho empeño ya que ella es madre soltera y su pequeña hija tiene tan solo 4 años de edad, y la cual es su motivo de vivir, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado iniciar su negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra para los gastos del hogar

Ayda esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para confeccionar 2 jaulas para la crianza de cuyes, de esta manera podrá mejorar su negocio y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y poder mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Ayda is 28 years old and lives with her 4-year-old daughter in the city of Imperial. She is a single mother who works very hard to make a living in agriculture. She works 9 hours each day and has started up her own business raising and selling guinea pigs in order to cover household expenses and provide for her daughter.

Ayda is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and she plans to use the funds from this loan to purchase materials for making two large cages for housing her guinea pigs. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and expand her business and bring her closer to achieving her dream of giving her daughter an education and professional opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making cages for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Othoniel

texts.es:
Othoniel tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y agricultura, ubiacada a 02 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque.

Son una familia emprendedora, Othoniel comercializa hace 10 años la compra y venta de animales menores, tiene experiencia en el mercado y ha visto la oportunidad de llevar dichos animales a zonas aledañas de su comunidad para ofrecerlo a mejor precio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para incrementar su negocio y de esta manera emprender con esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Othoniel, 46, lives with his wife  and three children in Oyotún district whose population works in agriculture and selling small animals.  It’s located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in Lambayeque Region.

They are an enterprising family.  Othoniel has been buying and selling small animals for 10 years.  He has market experience and has recognized an opportunity in taking said animals to communities adjacent to his community to sell them at higher prices.  He’s asked for a 1,000 new sol loan to increase business and go with this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 57 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de los cuales el mayor de ellos trabaja y le ayuda en las labores de campo, los dos menores de 15 y 13 años de edad estudian en escuela de la zona , vive en casa propia hace 11 años, cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales.

La actividad que realiza es la cría, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno; como también la preparación de productos lácteos como quesillo, queso), estas actividades las realiza desde hace 4 años, trabajando sin cesar todos los días de la semana. Los ingresos obtenidos por la comercialización de sus animales y la venta de productos lácteos le sirven para obtener ingresos que le permiten apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Felicita se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. El destino del crédito sera para invertir en la compra de una vaca, con ello mejorar su productividad y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felicita, 57, has three children.  The eldest works and helps out with field chores; the two younger ones who are 15 and 13 attend the local school.  She’ s lived in her own house for 11 years and has good work and personal references.

The activity she carries out is raising, fattening up and selling cattle.  She also makes dairy products like string cheese and cheese.  She’s been doing these activities for the last four years working non-stop every day of the week.  She uses income from the sale of animals and dairy products to help her husband support the family economically.

Felicita’s asking for a 1,500 new sol loan to buy a cow to improve production and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
Ruth Noemi tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Oyotun donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores, que se encuentra ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad e Chiclayo, en la Región norte del Perú.

Ruth se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y su esposo trabaja en construcción en una comunidad aledaña a donde residen, el le envía giros para aportar con los gastos familiares. Ella ha solictado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para compra de animales pequeños para luego engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth Noemi is 23 years old and lives with her husband and son in the agrarian district of Oyotun. The majority of the residents of Oyotun make a living in agriculture, especially raising and selling small farm animals. Oyotun is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the northern region of Peru.

Ruth makes a living raising and selling farm birds, and her husband is a construction worker in a nearby village and sends his income to his home to support his family when he is off working.

With the support from this loan Ruth plans to purchase small birds and animals that she will raise and fatten up for eventual resale. She hopes that this investment will help her to generate more income and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm birds for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Shagufta. She is married and has five children. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

In 1995, her husband established a bushiness of clothes selling in his nearby town. Now, as his children are growing up, their needs are growing as well. With the rapid increase in the necessities of the family, he considers its necessary that his business should grow also. He does not have any other source of income to fulfill the needs of his family. He decided to establish his current enterprise with fresh capital but he does not have sufficient money for investment.

Shagufta requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could buy variety of clothes for ladies and gents to sell. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the enterprise of her husband and in her family as well. Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Shagufta raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ian Franco

texts.es:
Ian es un joven e 22 años el cual vive al lador e su esposa y de su pequeño hijos de 6 meses de edad en la ciudad de imperial. Para poder salir adelante Ian trabaja como empleado en una empresa empaquetadora de su ciudad, lo cual le permite llevar dinero para poder solventar los gastos del hogar.

Ian está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayudad que le han brindado el podrá solventar los gastos para tramitar su brevete ya que para que siga trabajando debe contar con el, asimismo podrá apoyar a su esposa comprando vitrinas para su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas y abarrotes, de esta manera el seguirá luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” darle una profesión a su hijo y tener un grifo”.
texts.en:
Ian, 22, lives in the city of Imperial with his wife and six-month-old son.  To be able to get ahead, Ian works for a packaging firm in his city which makes it possible for him to earn money to cover household expenses.

Ian’s grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to pay his driver’s license fee because in order to continue working he must have one.  He will also be able to help out his wife purchasing display cases for her small snack and grocery business.  He will thus continue striving and working to make his great dream reality: to provide his son with a profession and to own a gas station.

loans.use: to pay his driver's license fee and to buy display cases.

loans.name: Idelso

texts.es:
Idelso tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos menores de 15 y 13 años de edad, la zona donde reside se llama Caserío Cedropampa, en un caserío pequeño, ubicado en el distrito de Santo Domingo la Capilla en la región Cajamarca, ubicada en la sierra del Perú, reside en la zona desde hace 11 años, cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales.

Se gana la vida como conductor de un vehículo, ofreciendo servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros cubriendo la ruta desde el distrito de Chiple – a Cutervo, la capital provincial. La actividad la realiza desde hace 6 meses, durante todos los dias de la semana. Con los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad el sostiene sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía.

Idelso se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de neumáticos para dicha unidad, con ello tener mayor seguridad para el y sus pasajeros y así poder realizar su trabajo con mas tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Idelso is 22 years old and single without children. He lives in his parents' home with his two younger siblings who are 15 and 13 years old. The area where he lives is called the Cedropampa settlement, a small settlement located in the Santo Domingo La Capilla district in the Cajamarca region. This region is located in the mountainous area of Peru. He has lived in this area for eleven years and has good work and personal references.

Ha makes a living driving a vehicle, offering his transportation services for goods and passengers. He covers the road from the Chiple district to Cutervo, the capital of the province. He has done this type of work for six months for every day of the week. With his earnings he covers his personal expenses and supports his family. 

Idelso is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles which he plans to invest in the purchase of tires for his car. With this investment, he and his passengers will be safer and he will be able to carry out his work at ease.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente, tienen dos hijos; de 7 años de edad el cual estudia en escuela de la zona y otro de 4 años de edad estudia inicial en otra institución educativa del lugar, vive en casa propia hace 11 años , cuenta con buenas referencias laborales y personales. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito de Santo Domingo de la Capilla en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca.

La actividad que realiza es la elaboración de dulce y aguardiente de caña, hace 8 años, en el Caserío Cedropampa, su labor la realiza todos los días de la semana. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. El destino del crédito sera para invertir en mantenimiento de su cultivo de caña de azúcar y pago de peones, con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 30, lives with his spouse and they have two children, a 7-year-old attending the local school and a 4-year-old attending pre-school in another local educational institution.  He’s lived in a house he owns for 11 years and has good work and personal references.  He lives in the rural part of Santo Domingo de la Capilla district in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region.

The activity he’s been carrying  out  for the last 8 years is making sugarcane candy and spirits in Cedropampa hamlet.  He works every day of the week.  He’s asking for a 2,000 new sol loan to invest into his sugarcane crop care and to pay day laborers in order to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay labor costs.

location.town: Santo Domingo de la Capilla - Cutervo - Cajamarca

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo, vive en el distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural situada en la región Lambayeque

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, además es docente en un Pronoei en el mismo distrito de Oyotún, su esposo es vigilante, Solicita un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de animales de corral para su crianza y posterior venta.
texts.en:
Martha, 39, has a spouse and a minor son in her care.  She lives in Oyotún district, a rural zone located in Lambayeque region.

She works raising and selling yard animals and is also a teacher in a Oyotún district nursery school; her husband’s a security guard.  She’s asking for a 500 new sol loan to buy yard  animals to raise and then sell.

loans.use: to buy yard animals to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Analy

texts.es:
Analy tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Matanza, una zona agrícola y comercial situada en la Región Piura, al norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de chicha de jora. Prepara esta bebida en base a maíz y la ofrece en venta a los pobladores y trabajadores de la zona. Usualmente también los vende con otros platos como cebiche o sudados de pescado. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida y le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Analy se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de insumos como maíz para su negocio, así como comprar muebles para mejorar la atención de su negocio.
texts.en:
Analy, 21, is single living with her family in La Matanza district, an agricultural and commercial zone located in Piura Region in northern Peru.

She has a business making and selling ‘chicha de jora,’ a beverage made from corn that she sells to locals and workers in the zone.  She also usually sells other dishes like marinated seafood cocktails or fish stew.  The business is well-received and it helps her cover personal expenses and help with family costs.

She’s asking for a 2,500 new sol loan to buy ingredients like corn for the business as well as to buy some furniture to improve service in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and furniture.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz lleva más de 20 años dedicándose a atender su propio negocio, una pequeña frutería ubicada por el sector del estadio de la ciudad donde reside, allí ofrece todo tipo de frutas frescas, ensaladas de frutas, salpicón, mecato, helados, entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días de 7:00 am a 7:00 pm y los domingos extiende su horario de atención debido a la gran afluencia de personas por este sector. El negocio inicialmente era de sus padres, quienes decidieron cedérselo a ella para que se encargara de él y generara los ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y brindar a sus 2 hijos una excelente educación. La cliente es una mujer pujante, activa y luchadora, siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan avanzar y cumplir sus objetivos. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un congelador y surtido al por mayor (frutas, helados, mecato, crema de leche, entre otros) esto le permitirá almacenar bien sus productos y así poder ofrecer productos de calidad a sus clientes, además tendrá más variedad de alimentos para la venta, lo que le permitirá atraer nuevos y potenciales clientes, dando como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que recibe. De esta manera Luz podrá continuar con su labor, pues en un futuro desea cumplir el sueño de ampliar su establecimiento y así tener la posibilidad de generar oportunidades de empleo, mejorando no solo la calidad  de vida de su familia, sino la de otras personas que influyan en esta ardua labor.
texts.en:
Luz has been running her own business for more than 20 years.  It’s a small fruit shop located in the stadium area in the city she lives in.  She offers all types of fresh fruit, fruit salads, ‘salpicón’ [fruit mixed with soft-drink], packaged snacks, ice-cream, etc.  She works every day from 7am to 7pm and on Sunday extends business hours because of the large number of people that come into the sector.

The business was her parents’ initially and they decided to pass in on to her so that she’d run it and generate enough income to help her husband with the household expenses and provide her two children with an excellent education.

The client is a driven, active, hardworking woman who is always seeking new alternatives that will make it possible for her to advance and reach her goals.  She’s encouraged to request the loan in order to buy a freezer and stock at wholesale (fruit, ice-cream, packaged snacks, milk cream, etc.)  This will make it possible for her to properly store her products and be able to offer quality products to her customers.  In addition, she’ll have a wider variety of food on sale which will attract new, potential customers resulting in higher sales and earned income.

Luz will thus be able to continue with her work for in future she hopes to reach her dream of enlarging her establishment to have the opportunity of generating employment improving not only her family’s quality of life but also that of others who will go into this hard work.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and stock at wholesale.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat, age 45, is the leader of this borrower group. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a crockery shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Riffat’s husband needs finances to purchase a new variety of crockery. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers. Therefore, his wife Riffat is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will be purchasing plates, glasses, spoons, forks, etc. to sell. 

Riffat is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase plates, glasses, spoons, forks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooler and wholesale supplies like bread, cold cuts, sauces, soft drinks, charcoal, and others.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Meet Pauline, who lives in Kisii, a bananas and sugar cane growing region. She has two children and has been doing farming for nine years. Like so many residents of Kisii, Pauline derives her income from the sale of milk. She also has a personal business. 

She stated that weeding her farm is most enjoyable about farming. Her biggest challenge is climate change and diseases. Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Nyangera”. 

Pauline owns a cow and a mosquito net, but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, sewing machine, TV, or DVD, and does not have electricity, solar power, or running water.

Pauline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “It offers better services.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, to which she replied, “Low interest rate.”

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Pauline replied, “It will increase milk and manure for (my) farm plantations.”

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu is 30 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Abu has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and other foodstuffs. 

To help expand his business, Abu has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a new refrigerator, and will help Abu to generate greater profits, hence sustain family members. Abu hopes that in the future he will be able to to increase profits. 

Abu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
This is Mwanasha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to add mores stock of fruits and vegetables for her business.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (flat sandals, sneakers, and ballet flats).

loans.name: Ligia De Jesús

texts.es: Ligia es una mujer viuda de 60 años de edad y madre de 5 hijos. Durante 23 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propio negocio, un pequeño taller de confección que tiene ubicado en la casa donde reside, la idea surgió como una necesidad de confeccionar la ropa de todos sus hijos y así destinar el dinero que se ahorraba para suplir otras necesidades del hogar. Poco a poco la gente del barrio fue conociendo su labor y le comenzaron a solicitar el servicio, hoy en día ofrece el servicio de arreglos de modistería, confección de prendas sobre medida y además elabora lencería para el hogar como tendidos, sábanas, cojines, entre otros. Esto le ha permitido sacar a sus hijos adelante y continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar otra máquina de coser e insumos al por mayor (hilos, telas, cierres, elásticos), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y disminuir el tiempo de producción, además podrá entregar prendas de muy buena calidad con una excelente terminación, esto le ayudará a atraer nuevos clientes y así poder generar mejores recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar y para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener una casa propia, donde pueda pasar sus últimos años de vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Ligia, 60, is a widow and mother of five children.  She’s been working in her own business 23 years, a small sewing workshop located at home.  The idea arose as a need to make clothes for all her children and use the money saved that way for other household needs.  Gradually people in the neighborhood started to notice her work and started asking her for the service.  Today, she offers her services doing alterations, making clothes to order and making household goods like bedspreads, sheets, cushions, etc.

This has made it possible for her to move her children forward and to continue providing support for her home.  She’s asking for a loan now to buy another sewing machine and to buy supplies at wholesale (fabric, thread, zippers, elastic) which will allow her to improve her working conditions and shorten production time.  She will also be able to deliver good quality clothes that are excellently finished which will help her attract new customers to generate higher income to cover household needs and to continue advancing towards her main dream which is to own a house where she can spend her final years in a care-free old age.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and to buy sewing supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 41-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and two daughters, but she is living with her husband. She is living separately, and her relatives do not have contact with them due to their poverty. 

Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers fried chickpeas in the morning. She cooks delicious food with the help of her husband for the restaurant, and the people like to eat food from there. Her husband offers only breakfast. He wants to offer lunch and dinner as well, but he does not have amounts to increase the menus.

Therefore, Rasheeda requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy food items such as chickpeas, pulses, vegetables, beef, etc.

Rasheeda says thank you to Kiva and appreciates the warmth and support for her.

loans.use: to buy food items such as pulses, vegetables, and chickpeas to offer food for lunch and dinner.

loans.name: Mukhbira

texts.ru: Мухбира 39-летняя учительница, проживающая в городе Худжанд. Она замужем, имеет сына и дочь. Мухбира в течение 10 лет работает в средней школе и преподает русский язык. Ей нравится учить детей и давать им знание. Она никогда не променяет свою работу даже несмотря на то, что получает маленькую зарплату. Муж Мухбиры является мастером, предоставляющим услуги по установке оборудований. Старший сын учится в третьем курсе Политехнического Университета, а дочь ходит в детский сад. Мухбира сейчас нуждается в кредите. Ей срочно нужно оплатить за обучение сына в университете. Так как им трудно найти сразу такую большую сумму, Мухбира и ее муж решили получить кредит. Они надеются на Вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en:
Mukhbira is a 39-year-old teacher who lives in the town of Khujand. She is married with one son and one daughter. For ten years Mukhbira has worked in a high school teaching Russian. She likes teaching and has never changed jobs even though her salary is small. 

Mukhbira's husband provides installation services. Her son is a third-year student at the Politechnic University, and her daughter goes to kindergarten. Mukhbira urgently needs to take a loan to pay for her son's tuition because it's hard for them to earn such a large amount of money quickly. They hope for your sympathy.

loans.use: to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a farmer from Chibombo District, Zambia.  He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he may purchase a water pump to irrigate and expand his garden.

A father of seven, Kennedy has been selling tomatoes, fresh greens, and local eggplants from his garden for over five years.  He has been able to sell his produce at major markets in the capital city of Lusaka where he can fetch a good price.  Kennedy has so far managed to water his small garden, carrying water in buckets from a nearby well.  Kennedy hopes to expand his garden and production, but without a water pump he has been unable to do so.

Water pumps can be a major boost for small farmers such as Kennedy, who often struggle to expand to their potential while irrigating their crops with buckets.  A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive.  Once he secures a loan, Kennedy will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Kennedy believes the water pump will help him realize his plans to expand his farm, and increase his profits. It is for this reason Kennedy is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he can secure a water pump.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Collence

texts.en:
Collence, 52, is from the farming region of Chibombo District in Zambia.  He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to expand his vegetable farm.

Collence has been supplying markets in the capital city, Lusaka, with fresh vegetables for the last 3 years.  As carrying water with buckets is a labour intensive task, he has been hiring a water pump from a neighbour in order to irrigate his fields of tomatoes and cabbage.  Collence wants to get his own water pump so that he can effectively expand his production, and so that he no longer has to hire a water pump in order to water his crops.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Collence.  A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive, and many have to hire pumps from neighbors in their community or use buckets to water their crops by hand.  Once he secures a loan, Collence will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Collence plans to use the water pump to expand his production of tomatoes and cabbages, and also to begin to grow other crops such as fresh greens and soya beans.  It is for this reason Collence is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he can obtain a water pump.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en:
Ireen is 40 years old and lives in the region of Chibombo District, Zambia.  Ireen makes her living running a small shop and maintaining a garden where she grows okra, tomatoes and fresh greens to sell at the roadside markets. 

Ireen is asking Kiva lenders for a loan so that she can purchase a water pump to help her irrigate her garden.  A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive.  Once she secures a loan, Ireen will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Ireen hopes to use the extra profits from her garden to support her children and pay school fees.  With more income coming from her garden, she also has plans to eventually extend and grow her small shop.  It is for these reasons that Ireen is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with a loan for a water pump.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Sabenty Trader 55 Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Sabenty Trader 55” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Isatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Port Loko 39 years ago. She is married to a trader, and the couple has two children who are attending primary and secondary school. 

Isatu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and she has been doing this business for six years now. 

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a food vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her town.

Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, bananas, glutinous rice, and other items. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Narcisa hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, bananas, glutinous rice, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a metal griddle and stock at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosario Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora de 47 años de edad, casada, y madre de 4 hijos menores de edad de los cuales 3 de ellos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta la cual pudo cursar hasta el 4 grado gracias al apoyo moral y financiero de sus padres a pesar de las limitaciones y carencias que ellos tenían. Doña Rosario se dedica al cultivo de papa desde hace mucho tiempo siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad y hoy en día trabaja junto a su esposo. Ella cuenta con su propio terreno ya que sus padres le heredó un pedazo de tierra el cual poco a poco han ido incrementando y fortaleciendo mediante la compra. Por lo que ella todas las mañanas junto a su esposo camina 2 kilómetros desde su casa de habitación para llegar a su lugar de trabajo donde juntos se esfuerzan para cuidar y limpiar su cultivo y poder obtener una excelente cosecha. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semilla de primera calidad para poder cultivar papa y al mismo tiempo poder dar asistencia técnica a los mismos.
Ella sueña en un futuro poder comprar más tierra en la cual pueda sembrar y cultivar una mayor cantidad de papa y de esta forma poder generar mayores ingresos que le permitan brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos como también fortalecer el patrimonio de ellos.
texts.en:
Rosario, 47, is a very hardworking, tenacious married woman and mother of four minor children three of which attend the local school.  She did not complete elementary school; she only got to 4th grade thanks to her parents’ moral and financial support despite the limitations and needs they had.

Rosario has been working growing potatoes for a long time; her parents taught her to work the land when she was very young and today she works alongside her husband.  She has her own land because her parents passed down a piece of land to her that she’s gradually been enlarging and strengthening by means of purchases.  

She and her husband walk 2 kilometers from home daily to reach their place of work and they strive together to care for and weed their crop in order to obtain an excellent harvest which is why at present she needs to request a loan to buy agricultural supplies and top quality seeds to grow potatoes and at the same time provide them with technical assistance.

She dreams in future with being able to buy more land to plant and grow larger amounts of potatoes to generate higher income so she can provide her children with a better education as well as to strengthen their estate.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seed and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam, from Cimbombo District in Zambia, is 36 years old and a mother of 6 children.  She is asking for a Kiva loan to obtain a water pump to help her irrigate and expand her farm.

Using buckets to draw water from a nearby well, Mirriam has been watering her crops of cabbage, onion, and a local eggplant called ‘Impwa’.  She sells this produce to market traders who come from the Copperbelt region and from the capital city of Lusaka.  She has wanted to expand her garden but currently lacks a water pump to assist with watering.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Mirriam, who often struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets.  A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive.  Once she secures a loan, Mirriam will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm and will provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Mirriam plans to use the new profits to continue to support her family, especially paying school fees for her children.  It is for this reason Mirriam is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with a loan for a water pump.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet, 45, is a farmer with nine children from Chibombo District in Zambia.  She is asking for a Kiva loan to obtain a water pump to help her irrigate and expand her farm.

Using buckets to draw water from a nearby well, Violet has been growing and selling watermelons and green peppers for the last seven years.  She has consistent buyers at the roadside market, and also has customers who travel to the area from the capital city, Lusaka.  Violet is looking to expand her production, but is limited because she has to water her crops by hand using a bucket.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Violet, who often struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets.  A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive.  Once she secures a loan, Violet will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Violet believes the water pump will help her earn a better income and improve her standard of living.  It is for this reason Violet is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with a loan so that she can obtain a water pump.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Usama

texts.en:
Usama is a youth client from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married, with two children. Usama and his wife work together to provide their family's needs and pay the tuition fees of their children.

Usama is a barber. He owns a small barber shop in a small village where all the neighborhood lives like a family. He is well-known in the surrounding area and has gained an excellent reputation. Usama has been in this field since 2006, and through practice, he has mastered what he practices.

Usama is applying for a youth loan of USD 1,500. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop. Usama is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Женщина, которая имеет доброе сердце, нуждается финансовой поддержке. Мехринисо родилась в 1976 года. Она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Ее муж является разнорабочим и ели-ели справляется с семейными расходами. Она решила организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить скот. Она будет заниматься бизнесом одна. Она планирует купить скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehriniso has a good heart and needs financial support. She was born in 1976, is married and is raising three children. Her husband is a laborer and takes care of the household expenses. 

Mehriniso decided to start a cattle business since she has helped her parents with their cattle since she was a child. She has been looking for help for a long time and finally heard about a course: "Bring on Success," organized by the Association of Women's Issues. She took the course and got a lot out of it. She received a certificate upon completion of the course. Now she is ready to start her business, except that she lacks the money to buy cattle. She will be in business on her own. Mehriniso plans to buy the cattle, look after them for a few months and resell them in the local market. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cattle. Mehriniso awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Josselin Rosibel

texts.es:
Josselin de 22 años, es una chica muy emprendedora, a la edad 15 años aprendió al lado de su madre a elaborar artesanías en barro, al inicio de esta actividad ella aún estudiaba en la comunidad  el  6° grado. Luego, se trasladó a estudiar a la ciudad; pero  la situación económica solo le permitió llegar al octavo grado. Después,  de eso solamente se ha dedicado  a la elaboración de artesanías. Ella y su hijo  de un mes de nacido  viven con su madre, ya que el padre de su hijo los abandonó, pero  Josselin  a tomado  fuerza para seguir a delante  y darle un futuro  próspero  a su hijo y  a su madre. 

Josselin tiene la experiencia de 7 años en la elaboración de muñecos de barro en general, pero  a través de cursos impartidos por instituciones de apoyo, a la comunidad se ha especializado  en diseñar y pintar las artesanías, abriéndole el mercado laboral  y comercial, al presentar  una  mejor propuesta en diseño  y presentación de productos.

El préstamo será utilizado,  para la compra de pintura, pinceles #1 y 2 que ya se le han desgastado, pago de mano  de obra a personas que le colaboran a terminar los productos,  ya que ella no da abasto con la demanda de trabajo que tiene. Las pinturas y pinceles los compra en la capital, ya que ahí encuentra mayor variedad de colores  y precios.  


En el futuro  Josselin dese incrementar la producción de artesanías, que actualmente realiza y tal vez terminar al menos el bachillerato, ya que le presentara mayores oportunidades a futuro,  ya sea para continuar estudiando  en la universidad o para tener oportunidades de empleo como formadora en el área de elaboración de artesanías en barro.
texts.en:
Josselin, 22 years old, is a very enterprising young woman. When she was 15, her mother taught her to make crafts out of clay. In the beginning she was still in sixth grade in the village school. Later she transferred to study in the city, but economic circumstances only allowed her to complete the eighth grade. Since then, she has been working making crafts. She and her month-old son live with her mother, since the baby's father abandoned them. Josselin is determined to keep moving forward and give her son and her mother a prosperous future. 

Josselin has seven years of experience making clay dolls, but after taking a number of courses she has come to specialize in designing and painting the crafts, gaining access to the labor and commercial markets when she offers a better proposal for design and product presentation.

She will use the loan to buy paint, replace her worn-out paintbrushes, and pay labor costs for people who help her finish her products, since she can no longer keep up with the demand she has. She buys the paints and brushes in the capital city, since she can get a greater variety of colors and better prices there. 

In the future, Josselin would like to increase her craft production and perhaps at least finish high school, since it will give her more opportunities in the future, whether to keep studying in the university or to have employment opportunities teaching clay crafts.

loans.use: to buy paint, replace her worn-out paintbrushes, and pay people to help her finish her products.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a widow, and has been in the farming business for almost 20 years now.

Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her business.

Narcisa has hopes of making her farm business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, a rural villager from Kandal province's Kandal Steong district, where rice farming is a popular business, is 49 years old and has two children. One is still in school. Vannak is a rice farmer while her husband is a paid construction worker. To supplement the income, she has been working as a garment worker. Having been engaged in this business for 25 years, Vannak is able to save up to 14 US dollars per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the third-cycle loan for Vannak with Kiva's partner VisionFund. The past business loan, which she successfully paid back, has helped her to sustain her living conditions as well as her business in gradual manner. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university. She hopes that the loan also helps her daughter to obtain a higher educational background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a student at AUCA, in the Department of International Business Law. Here is her story:

It was difficult for me to choose which field to study at the American University of Central Asia, but I have to come to a firm and considered decision. It was quite an important decision for me because I will follow this major now and in the future. I feel that this  will significantly contribute to my future and plans. I strongly believe that upon graduating from AUCA, I will become a well-educated, responsible and professional specialist in the field of law.  

Kyrgyzstan is having many problems in many spheres. One of them is law. The Kyrgyz Republic needs more qualified and outstanding lawyers. I want to participate in political and social life in the future, try to help in developing and facing challenges in the future path of my country. The majority of lawyers usually become the heads of the countries. It is obvious that a random person never becomes a governor. For example, more than 60% of the presidents of the United States of America have been lawyers. 

The principles of any democratic society are based on laws. To build a strong government, it is necessary to build a solid foundation. The foundation of the government is fair law. Law is one of the most important and difficult fields. 

I have always wanted to broaden the horizons of my worldview and my knowledge. I want to achieve goals in my life; these four years in AUCA will help me to realize my plans. I am an industrious and hardworking person and always try to be ahead of my schedule. Every time I have been able to  accomplish my objectives. 

I am happy to enroll AUCA because it gives a unique opportunity to all its students--everything except for a loan to cover their tuition fees. The loan is given by Kiva. I would like to apply for a loan, so that I will be able to cover my tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay for my higher education.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia es una madre soltera de 33 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 5 años por el que lucha constantemente para sacarlo adelante. Hace aproximadamente 3 años inició su propio proyecto productivo, pues montó una papelería y almacén de variedades en un pequeño espacio que adecuó en la casa arrendada donde vive, motivada por la necesidad de generar ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su hijo. Ella aprendió la labor debido al apoyo que le prestaba a algunos amigos que tenían negocio propio, allí tomó práctica y experiencia y esto le permitió iniciar su negocio, allí trabaja de lunes a domingo de 10:00 am a 8:00 pm, adicionalmente alterna la labor de su negocio, prestando el servicio de manicure, pedicure y peluquería, pues de esta manera complementa la entrada de dinero a su hogar. Su espíritu emprendedor y las ganas de salir adelante la motivan a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar una silla de manicure y pedicure, herramientas e insumos de trabajo (tijeras, plancha para el cabello, cepillos,esmaltes para uñas, removedor de esmaltes, entre otros) y surtido al por mayor para la papelería (marcadores, lápices, cuadernos, entre otros), todo esto le permitirá continuar con ambas actividades, prestando un mejor servicio de belleza y ofreciendo más variedad de productos a sus clientes, con lo que mejorará los ingresos que recibe para seguir llevando el sustento diario a su hogar. Claudia sueña con poder tener un local propio en una zona más comercial donde haya más afluencia de personas y así mejorar la entrada de recursos económicos con los que dará una mejor calidad de vida y educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Claudia is 33 years old and is a single mother to her 5-year-old son. Three years ago she converted part of her home into a small office supplies store and general store so that she could spend more time at home with her son and generate additional income. With some advice and guidance from friends who had also started their own businesses, Claudia has learned many business management principles. Claudia works seven days a week from 10:00am until 8:00pm, and she also offers manicure, pedicure and hair salon services on the side to generate additional income. Her entrepreneurial spirit and motivation to get ahead in life and provide for her son have led her to this loan. 

With the support from this loan, Claudia plans to purchase purchase a manicure/pedicure chair, as well as the necessary tools for her beauty business (scissors, hair straightener, hair brushes, nail polish, nail polish remover, etc.). She also plans to purchase merchandise in bulk to stock her office/school supplies shop (markers, pencils, notebooks and other items). She hopes that this investment will help her to expand the range of services she can offer clients and will also allow her to generate more income to provide for her son and cover household expenses. Claudia's dream is to one day open up a store in the center of town closer to a greater customer base and to give her son the chance to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase a manicure/pedicure chair, as well as tools for her beauty business (scissors, hair straightener, hair brushes, nail polish, nail polish remover, etc.) and supplies for her office/school supply store (markers, pencils, notebooks and other products).

loans.name: Yuk

texts.en:
Yuk is 56 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Bakan district, in the Pursat Province. Yuk has been involved in the rice farming business for ages; it has passed on to her four married children. It’s a traditional family business, from which she can earn a moderate income to support their living expenses.

Since HKL provides a much lower interest rate for special loan products, Yuk is delighted and encouraged to take out a loan to build a latrine and buy accessories for use in their household. With loan of 1,000 US dollars, she will pay for the labor costs and buy the construction materials needed, as well as other accessories. This will be her first loan cycle with the institute; she promises to repay the loan punctually. She thanks lenders for their generosity in helping low-income families around the world.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and buy the construction materials needed to build a latrine.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn (pictured at home) is 21 years old, and lives with his parents, brother and sister in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phorn is now in his first year of the National University of Management, majoring in Finance and Banking. He asks for a loan to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 26 años, es un joven muy laborioso conocido en su comunidad por ser honesto  y trabajador, desde los 16 años que termino de estudiar el bachillerato, se ha dedicado a trabajar en una empresa que elabora bloques de cemento para construcción; ya que su familia es de escasos  recursos  y el trabajo  que realiza sirve para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.    

Al tener casi  10 años de experiencia en trabajar,  en la elaboración de bloques de cemento cuenta con la credibilidad  y confianza de sus jefes  para dejarlo a cargo del  trabajo.

Él utilizara el préstamo, para reparar el suelo de su casa, porque es de tierra  y en el invierno  la situación  se vuelve complicada, los materiales a utilizar son: 8 bolsas de cemento, 2 metros de arena, 60 ladrillos de obra, para levantar 30 centímetros del suelo y que no entre la tierra a lo reparado.  

En el futuro planea conformar una familia, pues no quiere dejar a sus hermanos desprotegidos y eso le detiene en la actualidad a casarse  y tener hijos, además, quiere estudiar  un técnico  en diseño gráfico  en el Megatec.
texts.en:
Juan is 26 years old and is well known in his community for being a very hardworking, honest man. He finished his high school studies at age 16 and has been working at a construction company that makes cement bricks. Juan's income serves to support his parents and family, since they are not well off. With almost 10 years of experience in the construction industry, Juan actually manages various projects and has his bosses' full confidence. 

With the support from this loan, Juan plans to purchase construction materials for repairing the floor of his family's home. Their house currently has a dirt floor that does not hold up well in winter. He hopes to purchase 8 bags of cement, 2 meters of sand, and 60 bricks for elevating the section of floor closest to the entrance so that dirt cannot get in the house. Juan's future goals include studying graphic design and one day having a family of his own, provided he can still take care of his siblings.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing the floor of his house, including: 8 bags of cement mix, 2 meters of sand, 60 bricks, etc.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is 34 years old.  She is the mother of four children, and is living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store.  His nearby relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and this is the reason his business is working well. Due to good relations, his sales have been increasing, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the increasing demand.  Therefore, Bashiran requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

She hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way.  This amount will help him to cope with the demand. Due to more sales, the profit will automatically increase, and she will be able to save more for her family. 

Bashiran is very glad to thank Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. for her husband's general store to sell.

loans.name: Lilian Carolina

texts.es:
Lilian es una  joven de 19 años,  termino la educación media, gracias al apoyo y sacrificio que hicieron sus padres, para que estudiara. Esta soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella unicamente vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanitas. 

Lilian es una persona humilde, responsable y con muchos deseos de continuar estudiando. Eso la ha llevado, a que coloque una pequeña tienda, en el patio de su casa, y obtener ingresos para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa y a la vez, tener ahorros para continuar con sus estudios de educación superior en la universidad el próximo año.

  Tiene seis meses de haber iniciado con el negocio, durante este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, pero es importante que continué esforzándose para lograr su meta.

El préstamo sera invertido, para comprar mas mercadería y hacer mas fuerte el negocio. Así se le estará dando la oportunidad a Lilian, de ayudar económicamente a sus padres y a la vez, que ahorre para iniciar con sus estudios el próximo año.

El sueño de Lilian, es graduarse de la universidad en Administración de Empresas. También desea, ayudar a sus hermanitas para que continúen estudiando, y se puedan preparar academicamente. Espera que su negocio aumente, para seguir apoyando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Lilian is 19 years old and lives with her parents and two younger sisters. Thanks to her parents' support and sacrifice, Lilian was able to complete her high school education. Lilian is a very humble, responsible young woman who wants to pursue a college degree next year. In hopes of generating income and savings to put toward her future education and her family's household expenses, Lilian opened a small general store six months ago in the patio of her home. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, business is going well so far. 

With the support from this loan, Lilian plans to purchase merchandise to stock her general store. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and grow her business and in time allow her to pursue her educational goals. Lilian's dream is to graduate from university with a degree in business administration. She also hopes to support her younger sisters in their studies and goals, as well as continue to help her parents with household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with seven children, six of whom attend school. One is too young. Mupa lives in her own house where she has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more goats. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat is a citizen from a rural area located in Kampong Cham Province’s Kang Meas District, where farming rice is a common business to make a living. She is married, and is the 52-year-old mother of three children. One of her children is at school. To feed her household, she earns a living through farming rice and growing vegetables. Her husband is a construction worker in the local area to supplement the income. She and her husband are able to earn up to US $7 per day from this business, in which she has been working for 17 years.  She can manage to save only US $3 each day for future needs.
 
Sinat has been with VisionFund for three cycles, and she completely repaid the loan. Now, she is asking for an education loan to pay the tuition fee for four years of her son’s bachelor degree majoring in information technology. 

Sinat hopes that her son will have a good and bright future from this academic study, and will earn a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for four years of college education for her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: Jessica es originaria de la Ciudad de Managua y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada con mucho empeño a la venta de celulares y CD. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito porque a traves del credito que le otorgaron logro surtir su negocio, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: celulares, accesorios variados, baterías, CD entre otros, Con el fin de ofrecer una buena calidad y seguridad a sus clientes. Estima que este crédito le será beneficioso ya que crecerá su negocio, aumentara sus ganancias, y así lograra apoyar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Jessica is a native of Managua and the mother of one son.  She works as a shop keeper.  She puts a lot of dedication and effort into her cell phone and CD sales.  Jessica is grateful for Kiva and Micrédito because through the previous loan they granted her, she was able to stock up her business and increase her sales and income.  Jessica is requesting a new loan to purchase cell phones, various accessories, batteries, CDs and other items.  Her goal is to offer her customers good quality and security.  Jessica feels that this new loan will be beneficial in that it will grow her business and increase her profits and thereby enable her to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones, various accessories, batteries, CDs and other items.

loans.name: Pamela De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Pamela de los Ángeles tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el Barrio Villa Venezuela de Managua. Por primera vez está solicitando su crédito a KIVA porque quiere engrandecer su estupendo negocio con el cual ayuda a sus padres y especialmente la recuperación de la salud de su mamá que se encuentra muy enferma. Ella no pudo terminar sus estudios por disponibilidad de recursos económicos y desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de productos varios de uso personal, los cuales entrega por encargo a su fiel clientela. Solicita su crédito para la compra de productos como: ropa de niño, dama y caballero, zapatos, cosméticos, perfumes  entre otros.
texts.en:
Pamela de los Ángeles is 27 years old and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood of Managua. She was not able to complete her education due to a lack of financial resources, and she therefore opened a business several years ago to sell clothing and items for personal use. Pamela has built up her customer base over the years and is doing well with her business.

With the support from this loan, Pamela plans to purchase merchandise to stock her business, including men's women's and children's clothing, shoes, cosmetics, perfume and other products. This is her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen her business and help her parents, especially her mother who is very sick.

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's and children's clothing, perfume, shoes, cosmetics and other products to stock her business.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is 28 years old and married.  He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is secondary school. He is doing the best he can to support himself and his family and live as he should. 

He works hard in the public sector with low income that doesn`t pay enough to offer a good life for his family. He owns a small house to settle down in with his family. 

He would like to expand his house, so he is asking to take out a loan from AMB to buy building materials for the expansion. He hopes to enroll his child in school and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy building materials to expand his house .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gasoline to resell

loans.name: Nahi

texts.en:
Nahi is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, and married with two children. Nahi and his eldest child work together to provide the family income.

Nahi runs a small grocery store that is widely known in his neighborhood. He sells many products like snacks, drinks, detergent and dairy products. He has been running this grocery store since 1998 and has much experience in this field. He has hired an employee and is respected by the entire neighborhood.

Nahi is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install an external ceiling and increase his inventory. He aims to continue growing his business and open an even bigger supermarket one day so he may earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Doña Lilian es una mujer trabajadora y muy luchadora de 42 años de edad, casada, y madre de 3 hijos los cuales cursan en diferentes grados de educación en la secundaria en un instituto de la comunidad. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero por parte de sus padres a pesar de las limitaciones que ellos tenían. Doña Lilian se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 3 años a este rubro y con el pensamiento, la idea y la ilusión de seguir ampliando sus cultivos para poder seguir apoyando en la economía de su hogar ya que gracias a este rubro sus padres en su adolescencia y hoy en día su familia gracias a este rubro han podido salir adelante.  
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, urea, fertilizantes entre otros que ayudaran a prevenir que sus cultivos de café puedan tener un desarrollo apropiado y un follaje atractivo para sus compradores.
Los planes para el futuro es poder graduar a sus hijos a nivel universitario apoyándolos en todo lo necesario para que ellos no se queden con la ilusión o el sueño de que algún día pudieron ir a la universidad y sacar una especialidad. También sueña en un futuro poder comprar más tierra en la cual pueda sembrar y cultivar una mayor cantidad de café y de esta forma poder generar mayores ingresos que le permitan brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos como también fortalecer el patrimonio de ellos.
texts.en:
Lilian is a hard working and very determined 42 year old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. They are in different grades at the local secondary school. 
She has a grade of primary education completed thanks to the moral and financial support from her parents even though they had limitations.
Lilian has been growing coffee for three years. With this field of work, she has the idea and enthusiasm to continue growing her crops in order to continue supporting her household. Thanks to this work, her parents during her adolescence and today, her family can move ahead. 
Today, she feels the necessity to request a loan in order to purchase farming supplies like fertilizers and other products. These products will help to prepare her coffee crops to grow properly and to have attractive foliage for her customers. 
The plans for the future are to have her children graduate to university and to help them with everything necessary, so that they don't just have an illusion that someday they could go to university and study a specialty. She also dreams that in the future, she can purchase more land in order to plant and grow more coffee. With the the land,  she can earn more income which allows her to offer a better education to her children and also strengthen their inheritance.

loans.use: purchase farming supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Merlin Janeth

texts.es:
Merlín Janeth es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, con un grado de educación secundaria completa graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público, madre de 2 hijos los cuales cursan la primaria en diferentes grados de educación y junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de café. Debido a la falta de trabajo que hay en su comunidad el único recurso para generar ingresos para las familias y fortalecer su economía es el cultivo de café y a pesar de la cantidad de productores que hay la competencia no es un problema si no la alza de los precios en el mercado de los insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos y la inestabilidad del precio del café a nivel nacional e internacional.   
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, urea, fertilizantes entre otros que ayudaran al fortalecimiento de sus cultivos.
Los planes para el futuro es poder construir una vivienda en el lugar donde tiene sus cultivos de café ya que esto ayudara a estar más pendiente de todas las necesidades que en un futuro puedan presentar estos. También poder comprar un vehículo para evitar el costo de acarreo de los insumos agrícolas y el transporte del grano de café ya cortado. Como madre de familia graduar a sus hijos a nivel universitario apoyándolos en todo lo necesario para que ellos no se queden con la ilusión o el sueño de que algún día pudieron ir a la universidad y sacar una especialidad.
texts.en:
Merlín Janeth is 35 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in elementary school. She completed her high school education with an emphasis on accounting, but due to a lack of jobs in her community, Merlín Janeth and her husband now both make a living as coffee farmers. Even though there are many coffee farmers in the area, the competition is not as worrisome a factor for them as national and international prices for coffee and agricultural input products needed to cultivate and tend coffee plants. 

With the support from this loan, Merlín Janeth plans to purchase agricultural inputs for tending her coffee plants, including manure, urea, fertilizers and other items to help to strengthen her crops. Her future goals include building a small storage shelter near her coffee crops and buying a car for transporting coffee berries and beans once they have been picked. As a mother, Merlín Janeth also hopes to continue supporting her children in their educational and professional endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural input items for tending her coffee plants.

loans.name: Sorokhon

texts.ru: Сорохон трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она более 8 лет является основной кормилицей семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Сорохон начала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур как овощи и зерно. Сорохон постепенно развивает свой бизнес. Данное время она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Сорохон в основном занимается откармливанием крупно - рогатого скота. Сорохон нуждается в поддержке. Ее муж уже давно болен и ему срочно надо лечиться. Однако Сорохон не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения мужа. Она нуждается вашей поддержки и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sorokhon is a hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  She has been her family's main breadwinner for more than eight years now.  She is married and raising four children.  She started her own farming business growing vegetables and grains, and is gradually developing this activity.  At the moment, she also makes an additional income from animal husbandry, essentially cattle fattening.  

Sorokhon needs support.  Her husband has been ill for a long time and urgently needs treatment.  However, Sorokhon does not have enough money (to pay for his treatment).  She is therefore requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy some medicine for her husband.  She needs your support and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her husband.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet Salamatu. She is a 44-year-old from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 years and 20 years.  

For the past 13 years, Salamatu has established her local food business. She began her business because her parent did not send her to school, so she was trained in business. Salamatu works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are storage facilities and the high cost of transportation.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more beans, gari (fermented cassava flakes) and bags of ground nuts for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. 

In the future, Salaatu plans to build a big house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, gari and bags of ground nuts for resale.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina earns a living through her sari-sari store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Rufina is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, biscuits, chips and snack foods, sugar, flour, cooking oil and other goods. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus allowing her to cater to more buyers in her store. 

Rufina wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, biscuits, chips and snack foods, sugar, flour, cooking oil and other goods.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra es madre de 2 hijos, originaria de la ciudad de Leon. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada con mucho esfuerzo a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito ya atraves del credito logro mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias.
