Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar los productos principales de elaboración de tortillas tales como: Maíz al por mayor, cal, bolsas, entre otros Con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de los clientes. Estima que este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y crecer sus ventas, además de garantizar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandra, originally from the city of Leon, is the mother of 2 children. She is a merchant, dedicated with great effort to making and selling tortillas. Alejandra is grateful to Kiva and Micredito because through their loans, she has improved the infrastructure of her business, augmented sales, and increased her earnings.

Alejandra is requesting a new loan to purchase at wholesale the principle products needed for making tortillas, including corn, powdered lime, and bags, among other items. She wants to meet customer demand. Alejandra believes this loan will help increase her income and expand sales, guaranteeing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy corn at wholesale, powdered lime, bags, and other items for her tortilla sales.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru:
Муяссар 62-летняя продавщица, работающая на местном рынке города Истаравшан. Она живет в этом же городе с мужем и сыном. Ее муж тоже занят в сфере торговли. 
Муяссар вот уже 15 лет занимается продажей женских галош, в частности резиновых и хлопчатобумажных галош. Галоши - это удобная непромокаемая и теплая обувь, которую используют жители сельской местности. С наступлением холодов торговля Муяссара идет полным ходом. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить партию галош для увеличения продаж.
texts.en:
Muyassar is a 62-year-old saleswoman who works at a local market in the city of Istaravshan, where she lives with her husband and son.  Her husband is also involved in retail business.

For the past fifteen years, she has been selling women's shoes, particularly "galoshes" made out of rubber or cotton.  Galoshes are comfortable, waterproof and warm, and worn by people in rural areas.  With the approaching winter season, Muyassar's business is in full swing.

She is taking a loan to buy a batch of galoshes and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy rubber and cotton shoes in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Doña Martha tiene 28 años, hace más de 15 años que llego al trópico vive en Ivirgarzama, estudio hasta quinto básico;  es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos pequeños a los que ayuda en su educación, se sacrifica todos los días muy temprano para poder terminar sus confecciones y poder llevar a sus hijos al colegio. Hace 8 años que se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir se compro una pequeña caseta en el mercado de su comunidad para poder estar mejor ubicada y poder comercializar sus prendas más rápido, solicita un crédito para comprar telas y hacer mantenimiento de sus maquinarias para que así también pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Doña Martha is 28-years old.  She came to the tropics more than fifteen years ago.  She lives in Ivirgarzama.  She went through five years of primary school.  Doña Martha is a single mother of two small children, whom she supports in their education.  She gets up very early every day in order to finish her sewing and be able to take her two children to school.  For eight years, doña Martha has made her living making clothing.  She bought a small stand in her community's market so she would have a better location from which to sell her clothing more quickly.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric and to provide maintenance for her sewing machines so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and to provide maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es: El señor  Zacarias nació en la comunidad de Tiraque, actualmente vive en su comunidad con su familia y su esposa y sus tres hijos menores, la descripción de su casa está construido de barro con techo de teja con revoques de barro la determinación es rustico prácticamente. La actividad económica es la agricultura que produce tubérculos y cereales, la producción es estacional en la zona. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de abono de gallina y semilla de papa, el señor  Zacarias  tiene interés de superarse y que sus ingresos económicos aumenten en los próximos años, los trabajos agrícolas lo realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos para la siembra y la cosecha los labores culturales trabajan la familia.
texts.en: Señor Zacarias was born in Tiraque and currently lives in the same community with his family- his wife and his three young children.  His house is made of mud with a tile roof and mud plaster.  It is a rustic home.  His business is agriculture, and he produces tubers and cereals.  The production in the area is seasonal.  The loan señor Zacarias is requesting is to purchase chicken manure and potato seed.  Señor  Zacarias is interested in improving his situation and seeing his income increase in the coming years.  His whole family helps with the agricultural work, and at times his neighbors help with the planting and harvesting.  His family works the cultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase chicken manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 48 years old and lives in the town of Busia in Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Sam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar salt and other foodstuffs. 

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items to sell, and will help Sam to generate greater profits and enable him to pay medical bills. Sam hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Walter Manuel

texts.es:
Walter de 33 año de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato, él es casado y su esposa también se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, ellos solo tienen una niña que vive junto a ellos de 2 años de edad,  la pequeña aun no estudia.

Walter, se dedica  a la venta y comercialización de ropa y calzado para todas las edades, desde  hace 5 años que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad. Él trabajaba con un tío en la venta de ropa y el veía que era una actividad  que le generaría buenos ingresos económicos para él, es por eso que decidió tener su propio negocio. Antes de montar su propio negocio él trabajaba con su tío y eso era toda la actividad que realizaba. El negocio lo tiene en su casa, no tiene que movilizarse para ir trabajar, abre el negocio a las 7 de la mañana y lo cierra a las 8 de la noche, acompañado de su esposa para realizar sus actividades en el negocio.

El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en el negocio específicamente, comprara 10 pantalones y 10 camisas  para caballero de diferentes tallas, 10 pantalones  y 10 blusa para señorita al igual que calzado para señorita, caballero y niño. Su negocio tendrá  mayor  variedad y estilo de ropa para sus clientes. Él siempre quiso ofrecer un buen servicio de calidad que le genere buenos ingresos económicos.

Para el futuro, desea ampliar  más su local tener más variedad, de ropa y calzado para las diferentes edades, y para su hija desea lo mejor que estudie mucho y logre terminar una carrera universitaria, para que sea una persona de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Walter is 33-years old.  He finished high school and is married.  His wife also sells clothing.  They have one daughter who is 2-years old and lives with them.  Their little girl doesn't go to school yet.  

Walter makes his living selling clothing and footwear for people of all ages.  He decided to make his living in this business five years ago.  Walter worked with an uncle selling clothing, and he saw that the business earned him a good income.  So Walter decided to open his own business.  Before opening the business, he worked with his uncle, and that was his only job.  Walter has his business set up in his home.  He doesn't need to go anywhere to get to work.  He opens for business at 7:00 in the morning and closes at 8:00 at night.  His wife works with him in the business. 

Walter will use the loan to invest in his business.  Specifically, he will purchase ten pairs of men's pants and 10 men's shirts in different sizes, ten pairs of women's pants and ten women's blouses as well as footwear for men, women and children.  His business will then have a greater variety of clothing styles for his customers.  Walter has always wanted to offer quality service, which earns him a good income. 

In the future, Walter wants to expand his store and to have a greater variety of clothing and footwear for people of all ages. For his daughter, he hopes she studies hard, is able to finish a university degree and grows up to be a good person in her community.

loans.use: to purchase 10 pairs of men's pants and 10 men's shirts in different sizes, 10 pairs of women's pants and 10 women's blouses as well as footwear for men, women and children.

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es: Doña Magda continua con su negocio de venta de productos de uso personal establecido en casa, su clientela ha aumentado y desde ya se está preparando para la mejor época para ofertas del año, como es Navidad. Ella se siente muy orgullosa de su hija, quien ha aprovechado el esfuerzo de ella y su esposo para trascurrir sus estudios universitarios con mucho éxito, anhela que ella se pueda desarrollar en su profesión ya que ella a pesar que ella es profesional no lo hace.  Magda está solicitan su séptimo crédito a AFODENIC para la compra de productos como cosméticos y perfumes para dama, quienes siempre demandan en mayor variedad y cantidad. Ella confía en tener un nuevo local y comercializar un mayor número de productos.
texts.en: Doña Magda is still in business selling personal products.  Her business is set up in her home, her clientele has increased, and she is preparing for the best time of year: year-end sales and Christmas.  Doña Magda feels very proud of her daughter, who is taking full advantage of doña Magda's and her husband's hard work to successfully complete her university studies.  She hopes that her daughter can develop her career, as she herself hasn't done, in spite of being a professional.  Doña Magda is requesting her seventh loan from AFODENIC to purchase products, such as cosmetics and ladies' perfumes.  The ladies always demand greater variety and quantity.  Doña Magda trusts that she will have a new shop and sell a greater number of products.

loans.use: to purchase products such as cosmetics and ladies' perfumes.

loans.name: Njeni

texts.en:
Njeni appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, various vegetables and potatoes for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru:
Рахмат порядочный  мужчина в возрасте 40 лет. Рахмат проживает в Спитаменском районе. Имеет одного сына и троих очаровательных дочерей.  Дети уже взрослые.  Две старшие дочки замужем. Жена Рахмата, Мукаррам заботливая мама, и верная жена. Мукаррам в прошлом работала воспитательницей в детском саду. Нынче она торгует на рынке, вместе с мужем продают арбузы,дыни.
 Рахмат занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур, и вот уже несколько лет подряд продолжает свою деятельность. А к сезону все вместе как "дружная семья" продают бахчевые культуры. Дополнительный доход Рахмата от его сына Алишера. Алишер работает в Российской Федерации ежемесячно высылает деньги родителям. Семья Рахмата недавно переехали в новый дом. Но дом еще не достроенный. 
Рахмат хотел бы до зимы достроить дом. Для стройки дома Рахмату не хватает денег поэтому он подал заявку на кредит. Надеется что организация "Арванд" поддержит его!
texts.en:
Rahmat, age 40, is an honest man who lives in the Spitamen district.  He is the father of four adult children: one son and three lovely daughters.  His two oldest daughters are already married.  His wife, Mukarram, is a caring mother and devoted spouse.  She used to work as a preschool teacher.  Nowadays she works with her husband, selling watermelons and cantaloupes at the market.

Rahmat grows fruits of the melon family, an activity he has been involved in for several years now.  When it is the season to sell melons, all members of the family participate, as a "happy family".  Rahmat  also receives an additional income from his son, Alisher, who works in Russia and sends money home every month.

Rahmat and his family recently moved to a new house, which is not finished yet.  Rahmat would like to complete the construction of his house before the winter.  However, he does not have enough money to do so, and has applied for a loan.  He hopes to receive some support from the microfinance organization "Arvand"!

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina de 71 años,  vive con su esposo con quien esta casada, desde hace muchos años y con quien ha realizado toda su vida y la que falta por vivir, tienen un único hijo que vive con ellos aunque tiene 32 años; quien ha pasado por algunos problemas difíciles en la vida, su único apoyo han sido sus padres, y gracias a eso el hijo ha encontrado el camino para salir adelante y están trabajando en un negocio el cual lo realiza el hijo, pero con el apoyo de su madre siempre. Su esposo se dedica, a los trabajos del campo donde cultiva la tierra y aporta para la familia. 

Ella posee una peluquería, en el Municipio, donde es el hijo quien corta el pelo; pero ella es quien lo administra desde hace 2 años, y su hijo es el  experto en cortar el pelo. Quien lo aprendió gracias a un amigo, que le enseño esta actividad y se decidió instalar este negocio, sin ninguna idea pero lo hizo con la intención, que su hijo lograra superar lo sucedido en su vida y sabiendo la actividad decidieron apoyarlo y es así como hoy es una peluquería conocida en la zona y de ahí dependen los ingresos. 

El negocio está a una distancia de 5 kilómetros,  desde su casa y debe salir a las 6 am en vehículos particulares para llegar al negocio y su madre, es la que lo administra para ver sus gastos y necesidades.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una silla adecuada para cortar pelo, también cambiara el espejo lo comprara más grande y piensa invertir en una maquina más, para poder tener una de repuesto o buscar a una persona más, para que le ayude con el negocio. Con esto estaría mejorando, los ingresos de su familia y también podrá mejorara la atención a los clientes, para brindar un mejor servicio y así pueda tener más afluencia de clientes y que las condiciones sean favorables y se  pueda dar buena imagen del negocio.

Con el negocio piensa tener no solo a su hijo trabajando, sino que tener, unos 2 empleados más ya que ese negocio al saber tener variedad de cortes y brindar buen servicio, como buena imagen puede ser rentable y ese es su sueño, que en un futuro poder emplear a personas y que su hijo también supere, los problemas vividos por el amor.
texts.en:
Cristina, age 71, lives with her husband who she has been married to for many years, and with whom she has created her whole life and the remainder of her life. They have one son who lives with them even though he is 32 years old, who has had many difficult problems in his life. His only support has been his parents, and thanks to them this son has found a way to move forward; they are working in a business created by their son, but always with the support of his mother. Her husband works in the country where he cultivates the land and contributes to the family. 

Cristina runs a barber shop in town where her son cuts hair. She has been the manager for two years and her son is the expert at cutting hair. He learned it thanks to a friend who taught him the trade and Cristina then decided to open this business without a clue, but she did it with the intention that her son would manage to overcome what had happened in his life. Knowing the job they decided to support him, and that is how today it is a well known barber shop in their area which they depend on for income. 

The shop is 5 kilometers away from their home and they have to leave at 6 A.M. in their own vehicles to get to work. His mother is the one who oversees their expenses and necessities. 

The loan being requested is to buy a suitable chair for cutting hair, and to change the mirror she will buy to a bigger one. She plans to invest in one more electric razor so she can have a spare one, or look for another employee to help with the business. With this she could be improving her family's income and can also improve customer service so she could have a bigger customer base. The conditions would be better and give a better image to the business.

With the business she plans to have not only her son working, but also to have two more employees so this shop knows how to offer a variety of cuts and good service. This as a good image could be profitable, and that is her dream: that in the future she can employ people, and that her son overcomes the problems he has experienced through love.  


.

loans.use: to buy a suitable chair for cutting hair, and to change the mirror she will buy to a bigger one. She plans to invest in one more electric razor so she can have a spare one, or look for another employee to help with the business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen belongs to an ultra-poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories which are used in houses, such as iron doors or windows. He has been providing service making iron doors and windows and repairing broken accessories with the help of a welding plant.

A few days ago his welding plant went out of order due to overheating and needs to be replacement with new one. However, he does not have enough money due to a lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband will be able to buy new welding plant to continue his business.

Shaheen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: Marvin es originario de la ciudad de Boaco; de 36 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos. De oficio mecánico, dedicado con mucho esfuerzo a su taller de mecánica, el cual lo inicio hace 10 años como ayudante de su padre. Hoy en día cuenta con negocio propio y mucha clientela. Su esposa e hijos lo apoyan en su negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos. Su meta próxima es comprar herramientas de trabajo, contratar personal para mano de obra y remodelar su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: neumáticos, lubricantes, aceites, espejos, entre otros, para garantizar un mejor servicio y seguridad a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias. Sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y comprar un terreno, para garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin is a native of the city of Boaco; 36 year's old, married and father of three children.  By trade he is a mechanic, and extremely dedicated to his tasks as a mechanic, which he began 10 years ago as his father's assistant.  Nowadays he has his own business and a large clientele.  His wife and children support him in his business, which has provided a better income.

His next goal is to buy work tools, contract personal for labor and remodel his business.  He is requesting the loan to buy tires, lubricants, oils, mirrors, etc to guarantee the best service and safety for his clients.  He feels that this loan will help him expand his business and increase his earnings.  His future plans are to improve the infrastructure of his house and buy a plot of land, to guarantee his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires, lubricants, oils, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in this business for more than 20 years. 

Susan is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this input, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Susan to make her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Sawa

texts.en:
Sawa is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, he has operated a water-selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase water pipes to repair leaking pipes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes to repair leaking pipes

loans.name: Norma Ruth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nuevas Semillas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ellos y estudian en universidad. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Norma junto al esposo e dedican al comercio, compran y venden ganado, dos veces a la semana ellos viajan en un camioncito que tienen hasta Santa Ana, ciudad en la cual conocen ganaderos que siempre les venden a muy buen precio, luego ellos transportan las reses hasta su ciudad de origen y entregan  a comerciantes de este lugar  que son los encargados de faenar las vacas y luego vender la carne para el consumo de los habitantes de la ciudad, su marido lleva más de 40 años dedicado a esto, actividad con la cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar reses. Lleva  7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son comprar un camión mas nuevo y grande.
texts.en:
The Nuevas Semillas communal bank meets in Jipijapa every two weeks.  This settlement is known as the coffee sultan because of the extensive coffee crops that have a unique flavor, the food, and the warm people.

Norma lives here.  She is 54 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has six minor children.  Three live with her and study at university.  Her husband is a merchant.

Norma and her husband buy and sell livestock and travel by pick-up truck to Santa Ana twice a week, where they know breeders who sell at very good prices, then take the cattle to merchants back in their town.  The merchants slaughter the cattle and then sell the meat to the residents.  Her husband has been doing this for 40 years and has gotten the family ahead in this way.

They will use the money from this loan to buy cattle.  They have been with the communal bank for seven years and like the benefits they receive.  Her dream is to buy a new and bigger truck.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sophat is 43 years old and a widow. She has two children, one of whom is in school. To struggle for a living, she manages rice farming on 1 hectare of rice farm, a business that she has been involved in for ages.  

This is the first microloan for Sophat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now forming a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her family. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop so she can earn more money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is the age of 46, and is living with her seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a mechanic by profession; he repairs motorbikes as well as rickshaws. He has been providing these services nearby his hometown for many years. Mostly people of his area, who have bikes or rickshaws, like for him to fix their bikes.

With the passage of time, his repairing tools have been wearing out and need to be replaced with new tools. But the major problem is that he does not have the amount to make these purchases. Therefore, Jameela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing vehicles.  

Jameela says thanks to Kiva and to its field parner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tools for vehicle repairing.

loans.name: Sobol

texts.en:
A rice grower residing in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sobol is married and blessed with seven children. Nowadays, only two children still rely on her as they are in school. She has been involved in this business since she was 24 years old. 

Sobol is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this loan, she will spend the entire loan portion to cover the tuition fee for her son, who wants to hold a bachelor degree in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can graduate and get a bachelor degree as he dreams, and get a good job.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Mloka

texts.en:
Mloka is a widowed man with six children. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 20 years, he has operated a business selling second-hand clothes for both men and women. He cites stiff competition as his major challenge in the business. 

Mloka is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Supaldo

texts.en:
Sulpado runs a small stall selling groceries, mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payments. Sulpado lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Sulpado is married and has children.

Sulpado began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $15 – 20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took a loan to purchase a printer from KIVA to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payment).

loans.use: To purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single woman with one school-going child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Alice dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
The group consists of three business partners. One of them is Janet who is 36 years old and has one child under her care. She has been selling towels, wigs and weavon (hair extensions) for five years. She has been a customer of the institution for one year. She is a very responsible person and ready to do business with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner. The loan request would be used to purchase half a bale of towels, wigs and weavon to sell to her customers. 

Adiza is 43 years old and has been selling slippers for 4 years. Margaret is 56 years old and works selling provisions. They need a total amount of GHS 2300 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase half a bale of towels, wigs and weavon (hair extensions) to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is a dressmaker from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children. Wilfreda has been in the business for more than 13 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Wilfreda is asking for a loan to buy more materials for sewing such as cloth and thread. In the future, Wilfreda hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and thread

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math, aged 31, is a market vendor selling clothes in a market of Phnom Penh. She has been in this business for more than three years and many customers know her and her products. Likewise, her husband is also a market vendor, selling fish in various markets. This couple can earn enough to provide for the basic needs of her children, one of whom is enrolled in the local primary school.

Math and her husband would like to increase their inventories to satisfy their customers’ needs. In this regard, she has applied for a loan of 500 US dollars to buy more clothes and fish to sell. She is grateful for the help provided by Kiva and HKL. They have given her the confidence to overcome challenges and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and fish to sell.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: One of the breadwinners in the family consisting of seven kids is Norn, a 61-year-old married mother. To ensure the daily basic needs of her family, she grows rice and raises pigs and cows with manpower support from her husband.  She has been engaged in her current business for several years and she is able to earn almost $6 USD per day. This is the first microloan for Norn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this loan cycle, she has applied for an education loan to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a Bachelor's Degree in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter can continue her studies, graduate and get a good job.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with seven school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rental bills, school fees and food for the family.

Victoria has operated a clothes selling business for the past six months. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is married with four school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Doris cooks fried potatoes and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario es un joven de 30 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida en la zona y trabajadora, dedicado al servicio de su comunidad, él vive con sus padres los cuales presentan una edad un poco avanzada .Su lucha es ser cada día mejor, para no defraudar el proyecto de su padre, que su papá se sienta orgulloso y triunfante como padre de familia.


Mario, gracias al esfuerzo de su papa logro estudiar una licenciatura en educación, en la cual dedica la mayoría de su tiempo, enseña en la comunidad y así pone en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos.

El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de material de construcción (arena, cemento) y también mano de obra, ya que se encuentran trabajando en la infraestructura del centro escolar de la comunidad. De esta manera, se mejoraran las condiciones para los niños en los horarios de clases.

Menciona que en un futuro, tiene pensado comprar un carro nuevo del que tiene, y también poder ayudar a su padre en la siembra del maíz en el próximo año, esto lo realizara con la ayuda del crédito que solicitara con la fundación campo.
texts.en:
Mario is a young man of 30 years. He is a well-known and hardworking person in his area, dedicated to serving his community. He lives with his parents, who are somewhat elderly. His struggle is to be better every day so that he doesn’t disappoint his father, as his dad is proud and magnificent as the father of the family. 

Mario, thanks to his father’s efforts, was able to complete a degree in education, to which he dedicates the majority of his time. He teaches in the community and in this way puts his acquired knowledge into practice. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials (sand, cement) and also in manpower, as they are working on the infrastructure of the community’s school. In this way, conditions for the children in their class schedules will improve. 

He says that in the future, he is thinking of buying a newer car than the one he has, and also being able to help his father to harvest corn next year. He will do this with the help of the loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials (sand, cement) and also for manpower, because they are working on the infrastructure of the community’s school.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 49 and is the mother of four children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband does small jobs. 

Safia sews bags  at home along with her two daughters and two sons to feed her family. She has two sewing machines, which are operated by her daughters, to sew the bags. Both of her sons deal with outsiders and take orders from them and they sew the bags on order.

Safia wants to sell her sewed bags directly in the market, so that she could get maximum reward for their efforts. But she does not have the initial capital to buy raw material to make bags.

Safia made a request to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she could buy raw material such as Rexine, zipper, buckles, etc. for sewing purses and bags.

Safia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy Rexine, zippers and polyester for making bags and purse.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 40-year-old hardworking housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four sons and two daughters. Her husband purchases iron rods and resells them in the main market at a profitable price. 

Presently, he needs funds to purchase iron, which is very important for him to continue his work. However due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to continue his work. 

Nazia hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase iron to sell.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a hard working and zealous young woman; she is 29 years of age and living with her parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has been holding the responsibility for the whole family and is responsible for all expenses and utility bills. He owns a general store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. His shop is situated in a populated area and lots of customers are wanting to purchase miscellaneous general store items. He does not want to refuse or disappoint his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily usage. In this way he will be successful in winning the trust of his customers and increasing his income as well. He wants to increase the quantity of inventories according to the demand. 
Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy the stock of inventories such as pulses, flour, sugar, biscuits and rice. Shazia thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy inventories for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. 
Anita is asking for a loan to buy more groceries for her store such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks thus allowing her to attract more buyers to her store. In the future, Anita hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Celiodora

texts.en:
Celiodora is a married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales of dry goods. This is her source of income.
Celiodora is asking for a loan to buy more dry goods to sell like umbrellas, slippers, thread and needles, children's toys and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her sales thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Celiodora hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell like umbrellas, slippers, thread and needles, children's toys and other items

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy, 43, is a resident from Takeo province where she does her agribusiness to support her four dependent kids. Currently, she tackles crops and animal husbandry to make a living. This is the first loan for Hoy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is seeking a loan in order to support her daughter who wants to become a midwife.  She hopes that this financial support will fully cover her daughter's tuition fee on time so that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To cover her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is a 33-year-old vigorous, married lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She has six children. She is striving hard to meet their needs including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Consequently, she started her business to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation when she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. Now, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of needles and buttons. With the loan, she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She desires to expand her business and wishes to use the earned revenue to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and buttons.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has five years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. Sajida wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is currently in her 6th loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation and has shown a good credit behavior in the past. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Tazeem

texts.en:
Tazeem is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small jewelry shop, in which he sales bracelets, bangles, lockets, necklaces, rings and earrings. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case for the attraction of customers.  
Her husband has only one source of income, and he has to meet the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children and household expenses, alone. He wants to offer precious stones for embroidering on bridal dresses, because most of his customers demand it. But he can not offer this product due to the high cost. Therefore, Tazeem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy stones and could earn the maximum income.
She hopes that she will be able to construct her house soon, so that her family members pass their lives comfortably.
Tazeem is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy precious stones to sell for embroidering on bridal dresses.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, age 42, lives in the capital city centre. She is divorced with two daughters. Her elder daughter attends a university and the younger daughter goes to the public school. The only source of income for the family is Nino's small monthly salary from working as a cook's assistant at a governmental institution. Her wage is nearly $240, which is barely enough to cover food and daily expenses. That is the reason that Nino decided to restart her clothing trading business, which she had stopped due to financial problems.

With the loan, Nino will go to Turkey (a neighboring country) and purchase apparel and household items at wholesale prices. The prices are lower in Turkey than in Georgia and Nino will generate a good income after selling the items. Her regular clients will be her neighbors and co-workers. She will work on orders as well and give her customers the chance to pay later for their purchase. This loan will be a great support for the family to earn additional income and improve their standard of living in the future.
 
Nino and her daughters hope for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to restart her trading business

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
Comfort is the representative for this group. They are all traders who sell kenkey (cooked maize paste) and fried fish, charcoal, car tires and pastries'. 

Comfort is 67 years old, a widow and a mother to two children. All the members of this group have the same aim: to be successful in their businesses. They have always repaid their loans without any problems with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner. 

Comfort's principal business is the sale of kenkey and fried fish. She buys her stock in Accra and she has operated this business for more than 14 years. Her earnings or profit pay for her rent, water, electricity, food, etc. She also has a savings account and pays her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy maize and fish to prepare and sell to customers.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and 22-year-old son. It has already been ten years that Artur has been involved in the construction business. In particular, he provides renovation services to locals and specializes in renovating flooring. Artur works very hard to be able to earn income and cover his family's daily needs. Despite the fact that Artur's wife is a nurse at a local clinic, the main income of the family comes from Artur's renovation business. Realizing this, Artur wants to purchase tools and equipment needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is really important for Artur and his family, and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment to provide renovation services

loans.name: Sharopat

texts.en: Sharopat is a hardworking woman. She is married and has four children. Sharopat is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry 12 years ago. She began building a new house some years ago for her children. Sharopat has a big family. Her sons are married and have children. They need a house. Sharopat requested a loan of 13,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as wood and cement for the ceiling and floor.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement

loans.name: Blanca Susana

texts.es:
Blanca de 24 años,  es una persona soltera, estudio hasta educación media. Ella, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a sus padres para iniciar las actividades que ayudan a llevar el sustento a la familia 

ella se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que su padres que le enseñaron desde pequeña, camina un 1 kilómetro,   para llegar al terreno en donde siembran durante la mañana, y en la tarde ella se dedica a elaborar comida típica (tamales, atol, yuca, etc.) que sale a vender en los alrededores de donde reside

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca lechera  y producir leche para la venta. 

 En un futuro desea, poder comprar mas vacas para  producir queso, crema, etc para incrementar sus  ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 24, single, and studied up to high school.  She gets up at 5.00 a.m. with her parents to begin the daily activity that helps take care of the family.

She works in agriculture, a profession that her parents have taught her since she was small.  She walks over half a mile to the field where they sow seeds during the morning.  Then in the afternoon she spends her time preparing typical food (tamales, traditional drinks, yucca, etc.) which she sells in the area around where she lives.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy a dairy cow so she can produce milk to sell.  In the future she would like to be able to buy more cows to be able to produce cheese, cream, etc. to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and produce milk to sell.

loans.name: Doris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doris de 39 años, estudio unicamente hasta 7º grado, ya que su padre falleció, y su madre no pudo seguirla apoyando para que terminara sus estudios, puesto que su madre la llevaba a que le ayudara a trabajar. Su esposo es agricultor.  De sus hijos tres unicamente, la menor vive con ella y estudia 5º  grado. 

Doris tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa,  pero hace un año inicio en el negocio propio  de venta de verduras y frutas. Ambos negocios los conoce muy bien, ya que cuando su padre murió, fue su madre quien le enseño a como, poder trabajar en estos negocios; así fue como aprendió las técnicas de comercializar los productos. Los lugares donde ella vende están a una distancia de cinco kilómetros, viaja en autobús, todos los días se levanta a las 4.30 de la mañana para arreglarle el desayuno a su esposo y a su hija, después sale a vender y regresa hasta las 3.00 de la tarde a su casa.


El préstamo sera utilizado, para comprar más ropa, ya que hace dos meses, estuvo enferma y gasto los ahorros del negocio. Ahora ya esta recuperada totalmente. Pero es necesario que empiece con el trabajo de nuevo, ya que en casa, los gastos no faltan y es importante que tenga ingresos para cubrir con dichos gastos. Con el otorgamiento del préstamo, se esta contribuyendo a que Doris, continué haciendo lo que mas le gusta, y a la vez tenga ingresos para su hogar.

Doris tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es poder dejarles donde vivir a sus hijos, para eso necesita remodelar su vivienda y construir el muro perimetral, para mas seguridad. También le gustaría tener una pequeña tienda, en su casa. Ademas quisiera poder comprarle un molino a su hijo, para que trabaje en lo propio.
texts.en:
39-year-old Doris only studied until the seventh grade as her father passed away and her mother could not continue supporting her education. Her mother took her to work with her to help out. Her husband is a farmer. Of her three children, only the youngest lives with her and is in fifth grade.

Doris has made a living by selling clothes for 18 years, but a year ago she began her own business selling fruit and vegetables. She knows both businesses very well, since when her father passed away her mother taught her how to work in these businesses; that was how she learnt product marketing skills. The places where she sells her products are five kilometres away. She goes on the bus. Every day she gets up at 4:30am to get breakfast for her husband and her daughter, and then she leaves to sell her products. She returns at 3:00pm. 

The loan will be used to purchase more clothing, since two months ago she was unwell and spent the savings from the business. She has now completely recovered, but it is necessary that she begins work again since there are still household expenses and it is important to have income to cover said expenses. Granting this loan means Doris can continue doing what she likes most while earning income for her household.

Doris has many dreams. One of them is to be able to leave her children a place to live in. For this it is necessary to remodel her home and construct a wall around the perimeter for safety. She would also like to have a small store in her home and be able to buy a mill for her son so that he can work for himself.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Zulola

texts.ru: Зулола молодой дизайнер. Она родилась в 1992 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет одну девочку. Зулола научилась шитью женской одежды у своей бабушки. Ее бабушка была опытной портнихой. Зулола с детства проявила большой интерес к этому ремеслу и с большим интересом обучила все тонкости своего ремесла. Зулола любит свою работу. Она сама придумывает дизайн. Зулола имеет своих постоянных клиентов, благодаря хорошему сервису. Зулола является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она вместе со свекровью строят новый дом, так как их настоящий дом маленький и имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zulola is a young designer. She was born in 1992. She is married and is raising one little girl. Zulola learned to sew women's ethnic dresses from her grandmother. Her grandmother was an experienced seamstress. From childhood, Zulola showed a great interest in this trade and enthusiastically learned all the intricacies of this profession. Zulola loves her job. She comes up with her designs on her own. Zulola has loyal customers thanks to her great customer service. Zulola is the main provider for her family, as her husband is a labor migrant in the Russian Federation. She is building a new house with her mother-in-law, as their current house is small and in disrepair. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, lumber, etc. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and lumber for her new house.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta de 36 años, es una persona que solo estudio hasta educación media, es madre soltera; su esposo la dejo con dos hijos. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto hijos, que asisten a la escuela y quienes depende de las actividades que ella realiza.

 Marta  se dedica  a la elaboración de ropa para caballero y dama,  oficio que aprendió de su madre, para comercializarla  lo hace en el mercado  y en los municipios y cantones aledaños.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas materia prima, para surtir el negocio ya que lo invierte no es suficiente y de los ingresos que genere podrá darle el sustento a su familia.


En un futuro, desea  poder enviar a sus hijos a la universidad, para que sean profesionales y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marta, 36, only has a middle school education.  She is a single mother since her husband left her and the two children.  She gets up at 4:30 a.m. with her children who attend school and depend on her for an income.

Marta makes men's and women's clothing.  It is a trade she learned from her mother.  She sells her products at the market and in neighboring towns and villages.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy sewing materials for her business.  She cannot invest enough on her own and needs to generate an income for the family.

In the future she wants to send her children to the university so they can have professional careers and a better future.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies for her business.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. For about six years, she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and glittering material. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers and wishes to spend her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and glittering material.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman and a mother of five grown children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now.

Cirila is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this loan, Cirila will be able to improve her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Naveela

texts.en:
Naveela is a 46-year-old married lady and a mother of three children. She has run a small general store in her community for many years along with her husband (the man shown in the picture). They offer a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. They make enough money to provide for their family. 

To make her store fully stocked, Naveela has requested a loan of PKR 35,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of customers consistently. Naveela dreams of expanding her business and plans to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Гулмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 400 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обеспечение хорошего будущего для своих детей.
texts.en: Gulmira is 42 years old, married and is raising two children with her husband. Gulmira has secondary education and as a main source of income for her family she is doing animal husbandry which she started 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 400 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Gulmira now has two milk cows and one calf. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. With the purpose to further grow her business Gulmira has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som to buy a calf to increase the headcount of livestock. Gulmira plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock and also save money to provide a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 48 años de edad, madre soltera de 1 hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, dedicada a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos, negocio el cual lo inicio hace 5 años con ayuda de su mama. Hoy en día cuenta con su negocio propio y con dos vitrinas para exhibir sus productos. Su meta próxima es tener otra tienda y ofrecer una gran cantidad de mercadería variada. Solicita un crédito para comprar: camisa, perfumes, cremas  y variedad de ropa nueva con el fin de aumentar la demanda de sus clientes y cumplir con sus necesidades. Estima que el crédito le será beneficioso ya que aumentara su inventario, obtendrá mejores ganancias y clientes nuevos. Su plan futuro expandir su negocio y tener un nuevo local en otra parte de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Reyna is from the city of Boaco.  She is 48 years old, single and has a son.  As a merchant, she has been selling new clothing and shoes for five years with the help of her mother.  She owns her own shop and two display cases, and her goal is to open another store so she can offer a wider variety of merchandise.

Reyna is requesting a loan to buy shirts, perfumes, creams and a variety of new clothing in order to meet customer demand.  She believes the loan will be beneficial because it will increase her inventory, giving her more profit and new customers.  Her plans for the future are to expand her business and open a new shop in another part of the city.

loans.use: To buy shirts, perfumes, creams and a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children who are growing older and their needs are increasing as well.

Previously, Noreen's husband started to drive an auto rickshaw that does not belong to him. He has to pay fees every day to the owner of the auto rickshaw. Therefore, he has decided to buy his own rickshaw to increase his income and savings. 

Noreen already has some savings; however, the amount is insufficient to buy a new auto rickshaw. This is the reason she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a new auto rickshaw.

Noreen believes that this loan could bring happiness and joy in her family’s life and enable her to easily meet the daily household expenses. Noreen is very glad after taking this loan, and she promises she will pay back the installments on time.

loans.use: To buy a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 40-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past nine years. She is passionate about her work, and her client demand is strong. However, business challenges combined with family expenditures frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Rukhsana’s embroidery patterns are very popular in her community, and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business. She has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Allah  Jawae

texts.en: Allah Jawae is a 54-year-old married woman who has been running an animal sales business for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them for the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 41 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos los cuales colaboran en casa en las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan como también en el campo. Ella es ama de casa y agricultura actividad que aprendió gracias a su familia ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones. Ana María en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos se involucran en las diferentes actividades que se realizan en la agricultura como ser: la recolección del grano, limpieza de la tierra y la planta, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el segundo grado pero sus padres al no poder apoyarle con sus estudios le enseñaron a trabajar para que el día de mañana ella fuese un apoyo en su familia ayudando a generar ingresos y fortaleciendo el apoyo familiar. 
Ella solicita ayuda para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de insumos entre otros para fertilizar y abonarlos para que el final de la temporada poder obtener una buena cosecha.
En un futuro ella espera adquirir un pedazo más de tierra poder heredar a sus hijos para que puedan enfrentar los problemas económicos y demás de manera favorable ya que la agricultura es su único medio de ingreso para cubrir las diferentes necesidades que a diario surgen.
texts.en:
Ana María, 41, has six children who all help with the daily activities at home and on the farm.  She is a homemaker and farmer, having learned about agriculture thanks to her family who have been farmers for generations.  Ana María, her husband and her children all take part in the farm activities: harvesting, clearing the field, planting, fertilizing, etc.  

She only has a second grade education because her parents were unable to pay for her to go to school, but they taught her how to work so she could support the family by earning an income.

Ana María is requesting help for the maintenance of her coffee crop.  She will buy fertilizer in order to produce a good crop for harvest time.

In the future she would like to buy more land to pass on to her children so they will be able to face economic problems and anything else in a positive way, since agriculture is their only source of income to cover daily necessities.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Salustiano

texts.es: Salustiano es originario de la comarca El Rancho y padre de 6 hijos. Su oficio es Agricultor, dedicado con mucho esfuerzo al cultivo de maíz, trigo y ordeñador de vacas. El cual le ha generado ingresos a su hogar.Esta gradecido con kiva y Micrédito ya que atravez del credito logro obtener mejores condiciones en su potrero para sus reses. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: 2 terneros y pagar el alquiler del potrero de su ganado. Estima que con este crédito reducirá sus gastos y aumentara poco a poco su ganado.
texts.en:
Salustiano is from the county of El Rancho and he has six children.  He is a farmer who, through much effort, grows corn and wheat and raises dairy cows.  This has generated an income for his household.  He is grateful to Kiva and Micrédito for the loan that has improved the conditions of the pastureland for his cattle.

He is requesting a new loan to buy two calves and pay for pastureland rental.  He believes the loan will help reduce his expenses and allow him to increase his livestock little by little.

loans.use: To buy two calves and pay pastureland rental.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José de 59 años,  es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos que van a la escuela.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar al terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos,  camina 500 mts  y trabaja durante toda la mañana, mientras  su esposa durante la mañana ordeña y se dedica a vender la leche y luego en el transcurso de la tarde el cuida los animales en los potreros que alquila.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras y producir mas leche, para la venta y así obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Desea, comprar un terreno para tener los animales, ya que actualmente alquila y le genera mayor gasto.
texts.en:
José, 59, has a ninth grade education.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  He gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his wife and two children, who attend school.

José is a farmer and learned the trade from his parents.  He walks 500 meters to his cropland and works all morning while his wife milks the cows and sells the milk.  In the afternoons he takes care of the animals in the rented corrals he has.

The loan being requested is to buy two dairy cows to produce more milk to increase the family's income.  He wants to buy more land for the animals because he currently rents land and this increases cost.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Séraphin

texts.fr: séraphin est un homme de 40 ans marié père de 3 enfant dont l'age varie entre 1 mois et  6 ans.Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis 02 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qui sera réinvesti en partie dans son activité et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Séraphin is a 40-year-old man who is married and the father of 3 children aged between 1 month and 6 years old. He is a retailer and has been running a small shop for 2 years. It is thanks to his business that he is able to meet his family's needs. Thanks to his warm welcome and the good relations he has with his neighbours, he has built up a loyal and growing clientèle. Currently he is unable to satisfy his customer demand which is why he needs this loan for his business as it will enable him to increase his inventory of basic supplies. This will increase his sales as well as his profit margin. Part of the profit he makes will be reinvested in his business and the rest will allow him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of essential supplies.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Назира.  Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 3  лет занимается скотоводством и постепенно развивает свой бизнес. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This is a kind person who always strives to improve her living conditions and hopes for a better future. She needs financial support. Her name is Nazira. She is 39 years old. She is married and is raising three children. As she lives in the countryside, she has a great opportunity to develop her business of cattle farming. She has practiced cattle farming for more than three years and is gradually developing her business. Thanks to the good shape of her cattle, she has loyal customers. She wants to develop her business and receive a larger profit. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy cattle. With the received earnings, she plans to improve her living conditions. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Jules

texts.fr: Jules est un homme  femme de 35 ans célibataire, père de trois enfants dont l'age varie entre 08 et 16 ans. Il a ouvert un petit secrétariat bureautique qu'il gère depuis 11 ans dans un quartier de la capitale. Sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors il sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en ajoutant un mini ordinateur, une souris et un copieur pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins  quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Jules is a young 35-year-old man who is single and the father of 3 children aged between 8 and 16. He has been running a small business office in a district of the capital for 11 years. His customer base keeps growing and he is therefore requesting a loan in order to expand his office and add a small computer, a mouse and a photocopier so that he can satisfy his customers and increase his production. The profits generated thanks to this loan will allow him to both add to his office equipment and to cover his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a small computer, a mouse, and a photocopier.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.fr: caroline est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle gère un stand dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend du plantain et des vivre frais depuis 3 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant du plantain et des pistaches afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et bénéfices. les bénéfices seront réinjectés dans son activité d'une part et vont améliorer le bien être de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en: Caroline is a 38-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 3 children. She runs a stall in a district of town from which she has been selling plantains and fresh food for 3 years. She is requesting this loan so that she can strengthen her inventory by buying plantains and pistachios in order to increase her turnover and profits. Part of the profits will be reinvested in her business and part will be used to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy plantains and pistachios.

loans.name: Alfonso Ines

texts.es: Don Alfonso es un hombre de avanzada edad, le agradece muchísimo a Dios por todas las bendiciones y oportunidades que le ha brindado, anhela con construir su propia iglesia para difundir la palabra de Dios. El continúa desempeñando su trabajo de comerciante, el cual junto a su esposa han desarrollado y engrandecido durante muchos años, siendo el único ingreso para la educación de sus dos hijos quienes ya son unos profesionales verdaderos. Ahora Don Alfonso quiere plasmar sus esfuerzos por mejorar las condiciones del techo de su casa porque en época de invierno se cuela el agua. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, golosos, material de soldadura, y pintura anticorrosiva. De esta manera é y su familia se sentirán protegidos de la lluvia.
texts.en: Alfonso is an elderly man. He is very grateful to God for all of the blessings that he has been given. He longs to build his own church to spread the word of God. He continues to work as a merchant and with his wife has worked and grown for many years. It has been the only income to raise his children who are true professionals now. Now Alfonso wants to focus his efforts on improving the condition of the roof on his house because in winter water leaks in.    He is asking for the loan to buy construction materials such as zinc sheeting, beams, screws, welding material, and anti-corrosive paint. In this way, he and his family will feel protected from the rain.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc sheeting, beams, screws, welding material and anti-corrosion paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Eveling

texts.es: Doña Eveling es una mujer trabajadora que esfuerza por obtener lo que desea, desde hace  muchos años se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en las afueras de su casa, la cual prepara con todo el amor para sus clientes, por el cuidado e higiene que esto requiere, necesita que su espacio de trabajo este limpio y ordenado, esto requiere de la inversión en infraestructura, a pesar que ella ya lo hecho, aun le hace falta. Ella piensa ampliar el espacio en la parte frontal de su casa, para lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como: zinc, bloques, cemento, hierro y arena. Esto permitirá atender a sus clientes en un espacio que preste mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Doña Eveling is a hardworking woman, fighting to meet her goals. She has been selling fast food outside her house for many years, preparing it with love for her customers. Because of the nature of her business, she must be careful and hygienic and must keep her work space clean and in order. For this, she needs to invest in the establishment. Although she has already made some investments, there are still some things left to do.

Eveling is planning to enlarge her front porch, so she needs to buy construction materials such as zinc sheets, bricks, cement, iron bars and sand. This will help her take care of her customers in a more attractive establishment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as zinc sheets, bricks, cement, iron bars and sand.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be disciplined. She operates a retail store where she sells coconuts. She describes her family challenge to be shortage of water and lack of proper storage facilities. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank  that will benefit 7 family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 60,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a hardworking man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He is 21 years old.  He is a student in university.  He works hard in the electricity association to cover expenses for his studying.  Now, he would like to buy home improvement but his income isn`t enough.  So, he is requesting a loan from AMB to buy a fridge to use for his house.  He hopes to complete his studying to become a professional engineer and to working for a good company.

loans.use: to buy fridge to use for his house.

loans.name: Samuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Samuel de 25 años, debido a la condición económica de sus padres, solo pudo estudiar un noveno grado, pero al mismo tiempo trabajaba ayudandole a su padre en la agricultura, es acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de animales de granja, su hijo esta recién nacido. 

Él se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, en la siembra de maíz se a dedicado a esta actividad, desde que estaba muy pequeño en compañía de su padre. Ademas, se dedica en la época de verano a la corta de caña de azúcar, trabaja todos los días  en esta época donde se traslada desde la madrugada y regresa a la anochecer; en invierno cuando cosecha el maíz los realiza a un Kilómetro de su casa, lo hace por la mañana y le ayuda a su padre.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar gallinas ponedoras y  concentrado para las mismas y lo administrara su compañera de vida.

Él aspira a futuro,  poder comprar un pequeño terreno para construir una pequeña vivienda y trasladarse con su compañera y su hijo, con la ganancia de la producción espera  mantener su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel is 25 years old. Due to his parents' financial condition, he was only able to go to school to the ninth grade. At the same time, he also worked helping his father with the farming. He is married and his spouse is a housewife and raises farm animals. His son is a newborn. 

He works in agriculture, growing corn. He has done this since he was very small with his father. In addition, during the summer he cuts sugar cane. He works every day at that time and travels at dawn, returning in the evening.  In winter, when he harvests the corn, he does it one kilometer from his house. He does it in the morning and helps his father. 

The loan he is asking for is to buy egg laying hens and concentrate for them. His life's companion will be the one who feeds them. 

In the future, he aspires to being able to buy his own small plot of land to build a small house and move there with his wife and son. With the profit from production, he hopes to support his family.

loans.use: to buy egg-laying hens and concentrate for them. His life's companion will be the one who feeds them.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es: Martha María es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada, ha procreado dos hijos junto a su esposo, quien labora en un taller de torno y soldadura. Ella continúa trabajando como domestica y venta de refrescos para compartir los gastos de educación de sus dos hijos. Desde adolescente ha luchado por salir adelante, a pesar de muchos obstáculos personales y familiares. Garantiza que ha iniciado con pie derecho para la construcción de su casa, siendo apoyada con crédito por AFODENIC, sin embargo falta mucho para considerar que su casa es segura y presta las condiciones que ella necesita para su familia. Solicita su segundo crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como: bloques, cemento, arena y  hierro, con los cuales avanzará en la construcción de paredes de su casa. Martha piensa que en un futuro ella pondrá su propio negocio en casa,  el cual le permitirá pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.
