texts.en: Martha María is a very hardworking and dedicated woman. She has two children with her husband. He works in a lathe and welding shop. She continues to work as a maid and selling beverages to share her two children's education expenses. Since she was a teenager, she has fought to get ahead, despite personal and family obstacles. She guarantees that she has started construction on her house on the right foot, supported by a loan from AFODENIC. Nonetheless, she is still a long way from considering her house to be safe and in the conditions she needs for her family. She is asking for her second loan to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand and iron. With these, she will advance the construction of the walls of her house. Martha plans in the future on being able to open her own business in her house. This will allow her to spend more time with her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is from Vanadzor town, where she lives with her big family of 7: Heghine herself, her husband, parents-in-law and three children.  Together with her father-in-law, Heghine has been involved in processing and selling Armenian traditional meal "khash".  The main ingredient in “khash” is cow's feet, although other cow parts, such as the head and stomach may also be used.  

So, Heghine and her father in law purchase cow's feet, clean it, keep in cold water in order to get rid of the bad smell and then sell them at local open markets.  This meal is known among locals in Armenia as a nutritious winter food and its demand is especially high in the cold season. So, as the autumn is the starting season for eating "khash", Heghine needs financial support to be able to purchase cow's feet and meat and purchase plates and containers. 

Heghine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.  The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.  The loan is very important for this hard working woman and she hopes for the lender's trust and support..

loans.use: to pay for cow's feet and meat and purchase plates and containers

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, vive en con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 y 5 años, ambos niños están estudiando.
Su actividad económica siembra de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, su jornada empieza de 5:00a.m. Hasta 4:00 p.m., , solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas (herbicidas, abonos, etc.) y alimento para ganado.
Con el préstamo tendrá  ingresos con los cuales pagara la deuda,  ampliara su negocio y tendrá una mejor producción.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio para tener todo lo necesario que le brinde a su familia una vida sin necesidades y un futro a sus hijos como profesionales.
texts.en:
José has a partner.  He lives with her and his two children, aged nine and five years old each.  Both the children are in school.

José makes a living growing basic grains and raising cattle.  His working day begins at 5am and continues until 4pm.  José is applying for a loan to buy farming supplies (herbicides, manure, etc) and cattle feed.

This loan will allow José to earn an income to pay off his debt and expand his business.  José will end up with higher production.

José's dream is to expand his business so that he has everything to provide his family with everything that they need.  In the future he wants his children to grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (herbicides, manure, etc) and cattle feed.

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás de 74 años,  es un hombre que se ha dedicado toda su vida al trabajo de la agricultura, ya que  esto  es  lo que su padre le enseño desde muy corta edad, él no realizo  estudios  por razones culturales y ser el hermano mayor, su padre lo involucro directamente en las tareas agrícolas, vive actualmente con su esposa,  ya que sus hijos tienen su familia. 


Toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura, manejando, pollos de engorde, gallinas ponedoras, cerdos, cabras, ganado  de repasto y la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para la producción de pollo de engorde, desde mejoras en la infraestructura y el incremento  de la unidad de producción,  lo que comprara  es: 10 bolsas de cemento para impermeabilizar el suelo,  10 sacos de concentrado de inicio, 10 sacos de final engorde  y 300 pollo de un día de nacidos  


En el futuro,  tiene  idea de cambiar un poco  del rumbo  que ha tenido  en su vida  y comprar  un molino para dar el servicio en su comunidad  y que además le genere ganancia, para tener  una mejor vejez a lado  de su esposa.
texts.en:
Seventy-four-year-old Nicolás has worked in agriculture his entire life as this was the trade he learned from his father from a very young age.  Nicolás did not study, for cultural reasons, and, being the eldest sibling, his father involved him directly in the farming work.  Nicolás lives with his wife.  Their children now have their own families.

Nicolás has worked in farming all his life, raising chickens to fatten up, raising hens, pigs, goats, pasturing cattle, and growing basic grains and vegetables.

This loan will used for Nicolás' work fattening up chickens - from improving their living space to increasing the number of chickens he has.  Nicolás will buy ten bags of cement to waterproof the ground, ten bags of feed, ten bags of feed for fattening, and 300 one-day-old chickens.

In the future Nicolás would like to change the direction his life has gone a little.  He would like to buy a grinder to serve the community and earn more money. That way he can enjoy his old age with his wife.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of cement to waterproof the ground, ten bags of feed, ten bags of feed for fattening, and 300 one-day-old chickens.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma, age 21, deals in the business of animals’ sales.  She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices, raises them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.  She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats.  She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.  With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 45-year-old married woman who has been doing business by selling milk for many years.  She has 2 buffaloes to milk.  She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk.  Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. 

She has two daughters and two sons; all are going to school.  She is very motivated to provide them  with a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.  She is happily running her business to support it.  Now she requested for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo.  She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children.  She has had a business manufacturing ‘waan’, which is a thread like material used to make a bedstead with a wooden frame on four legs.  She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and has become famous in providing good quality material to her community. 

Kousar operates the machine at home with the help of her husband.  Both are contentedly doing it for the sake of the family.  She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members.  She is also doing sewing as her part time job.  In this way, she is able to manage the household more efficiently.  It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation.  She is satisfied from the support of Kashf foundation.  She has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread to increase her sales.  She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread.

loans.name: Maria Celedonia

texts.es:
María Celedonia  es una Señora  muy luchadora de 38 años de edad, su estado civil en unión libre, madre de  4 hijos menores de edad que estan cursando primaria,Su nivel educativo primaria incompleta la cual no pudo cursar porque sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos. 
María Celedonia desde  hace 1 año se dedica junto a su compañero de hogar a la agricultura al cultivo de café, siembra de maíz y frijoles ellos cuentan con su propio terreno que se encuentra a 10 minutos de su casa de habitación por lo que día con día junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente y a la vez con mucho entusiasmo cuidan y limpian sus cultivos con la convicción que obtendrán una excelente  cosecha, ya que es el rubro que más ingresos genera.
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar  financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a su cultivo de café como ser  compra de fertilizantes, foliares fungicidas entre otros.
 Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad de  café y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan salir adelante con su familia y brindarle una mejor oportunidad de vida, educarlos de forma que ellos en un futuro sean personas preparadas y visionarios que cuiden el patrimonio que ella desea heredarles.
texts.en:
María Celedonia is a feisty, 38-year-old woman.  She lives with her partner and is a mother to four children, all of whom are in primary school.  María herself did not finish primary school as her parents were very poor. For one year, María has been working growing coffee, beans and corn with her husband.  They have their own plot of land, located ten minutes from their home.  Every day María goes out with her husband - they work hard but with enthusiasm they look after and clean their crops in the belief that they will have an excellent harvest.  With an excellent harvest, they can generate a higher income.

María is in need of a loan in order to buy farming supplies, in order to support her coffee plants.  She needs to buy fertilisers, fungicides, and other items.

In the future María dreams of expanding her crops by planting and growing a larger quantity of coffee. This way she can earn a higher income that would allow her to prosper with her family and to give them better opportunities in life.  María wants to educate her children so that, in the future, they become prepared visionaries who will look after the inheritance María will leave them.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like meat, vegetables, spices and seasonings, cooking oil, flour, sugar, banana and others

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 34-year-old married woman.  She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts over the years.  She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demands of her customers time after time.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is a 30-year-old man.  He lives with his parents, two brothers, sister-in-law and grandfather.  His grandfather is provided with a retirement pension.  The family runs an agricultural business.  In particular, they have a cow, a calf and a plot of agricultural land, where different types of vegetables are grown. 

They produce cheese and sell it with the harvested products at a good price.  Khvicha decided to open a store and has requested a loan.  The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL for purchasing a stock of groceries.  As the grocery store is opened, Khvicha will have a chance to generate stable income and thus improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and open a store

loans.name: Khazina

texts.en:
Khazina is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been sewing clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to sew more dresses in a timely manner. 

She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Yatai Poty Group

texts.es:
Yatai Poty es un grupo nuevo, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando sus vidas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con lo cual podrán conocer la situación en la que cada una está.
Hilaria es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, ella comenta que por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, tener los ingresos que necesitan y luchar por mejorar. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, pantalones, shorts y demás., y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Yatai Poty is a new group. Each member is fighting hard to improve their lives. They took part in the Poverty Elimination Survey, so they can know what their situation is.

Hilaria is one of the members. She sells different types of garments and says that through her sales, she earns what she needs to support her family and continue improving. She is a hardworking and persistent person.

She is requesting a loan to buy t-shirts, jeans, pants, shorts, etc. in order to continue selling. She appreciates the opportunity she is given to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is 45 years old, a vigorous, married woman. She has a business selling clothing. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Farhat is working hard to contribute to the family income. She purchases a variety of clothing from the main city, then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothing in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her increased sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

texts.en:
Kishwar is a 39-year-old, married woman. For the past six years, she has been successfully running a business, selling milk to the people of her community. She has one buffalo. She has become famous in her locality for providing good-quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income.

Kishwar is a loving mother of five children. Her husband works as a mason and earns insufficient income to support the needs of the family members. 

In order to inflate her sales, Kishwar needs to purchase an additional cow. For this, she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, to buy an additional cow. 

She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. She gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow for getting milk.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 34 years old and a mother of six children. 

For two years, Shazia has been running a business, selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

Shazia has some savings and she has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000/- to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 29-year-old, married man, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is involved in quarrying stones, along with farming, in order to earn income to support his family. A poor road network and lack of capital to hire manpower pose challenges to his business growth while his dreams are educating his children and expanding his business. 

Sam intends to use the loan to pay workers who are helping him quarry stones to sell.

loans.use: to pay workers who are helping him quarry stones to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and she has two children, ages nine and one. Jocelyn has been in the business for more than a year now. She works with her husband to till and oversee their farm.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. Moreover, Jocelyn wants to expand her farm, so it will generate more income necessary for their needs, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of sewing. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community; she has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. 

She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household with the educational needs of children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase thread, along with the packs of buttons, zippers, and lace in various colors. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand.  

Zahida hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more thread, along with the packs of buttons, zippers, and lace in various colors.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three. For about five years, she is been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community; her designs are in much demand, and she has managed to gain a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings, and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser has expertise in embroidery and she has been using her skill to provide for her family for about two years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns, with thread and beads. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Kouser has requested another loan, in the amount of PKR 15,000, to purchase spools of thread, along with packs of beads and pearls in various colors. 

She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Kouser has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, along with packs of beads and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as being very passionate about life. 

She has taken a loan of KES 21,000 to buy a water tank of 3,000 litres to store clean water for domestic use. She does farming to earn an income. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a piece of land. 

This is Esther's second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank of 3,000 litres.

loans.name: Nasem

texts.en:
This is Nasem’s second loan cycle from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and he had a positive outcome. He was able to purchase the equipment he needed and re-decorate his garage. 

Today, Nasem is planning to keep on developing his business to make sure that his five children will have the best living and education and, at the same time, ensure that his customers are satisfied. 

He decided to take this loan to purchase a power generator.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 33-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children. 

For three years, Ayesha has been running a business, selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner, at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

Ayesha has some savings and she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000/-to purchase another buffalo. She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and she has shown good repayment behavior. Ayesha expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Theresa's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of 3 determined members; one of whom is 40-year-old Theresa, who is married with two children. She has been selling plantains for 20 years. 

Theresa has been a client of the institution for 4 years. She is applying for the loan amount of GHS 1200 to buy plantains to sell to customers. 

Stella is a woman of 53 who sells wax-prints and needs GHS 700 and Joe is a man of 30 who is auto springing and needs GHS 1000.

loans.use: To buy plantains to sell to customers.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.ru: Айша, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Айша в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву национальных головных уборов с 2003 года, стартовав с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Айша с удовольствием занимается своей работой-пошивом головных уборов у себя на дому, бизнес семейный, супруг активно помогает в бизнесе. Готовую продукцию сдает реализаторам и торговцам на местном рынке. Этот бизнес приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 8,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айша обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS) на покупку материалов для производства и пошива головных уборов. На доходы от кредита Айша хочет увеличить товарооборот и благоустройство семьи.
texts.en: Aisha is married and, together with her husband, she is raising three children. In the pursuit of income for her family, Aisha started a small business sewing national hats.  She started this business in 2003 with 5,000 som (KGS). It is a good business, but most importantly, Aisha enjoys doing her work of sewing national hats at home. It is a family business and her husband actively helps her with it. She sells the finished products to retailers and sellers at the local market. This business brings her an average monthly income of 8,500 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her business, Aisha turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy materials for producing and embroidering hats. With the earnings from the loan, Aisha wants to increase sales turnover and improve her family's lives

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring national headgear

loans.name: Ita Yvate Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ita Yvate está en el ciclo número 6 del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y con ello quieren poder saber cómo esta cada una para poder trabajar y mejorar sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosana, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas variadas y de estación. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio esta luchando por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Su meta es poder tener un gran puesto surtido y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas de estación, con lo que podrá seguir con sus ventas y mejorar ingresos.
texts.en: The Ita Yvate group is in its sixth cycle of the communal bank programme.  They are carrying out a survey into eliminating poverty and want to use it to find out what each of them is like so as to be able to work and improve their income.  One of the members is Rosana, who sells various seasonal fruits.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who, with determination and sacrifice, is struggling to get by and give her family everything she could not have.  Her ambition is to have a big and well-stocked stall and to improve her living conditions.  She is applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of seasonal fruits, which will enable her to keep her business going and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 26 years old and is from Taiz, Yemen. He is married and works hard to provide for his daily expenses. He has a taxi business, which he wishes to improve to provide his family a pleasant life. He would like to attract more clients in different areas around his city in order to increase his profit. He is asking for a second loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts for his taxi. 

He thanks Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 29-year-old, married man from the small village of Khulo district. He lives with his large family: his wife, three children, mother, brother, sister-in-law, and two nephews. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have three cows and they produce cheese to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land where maize, potatoes, and cabbages are grown to sell. 

Malkhaz decided to start grocery store and he requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of USD 4,000 to purchase a stock of groceries. 

When the grocery store is opened, Malkhaz will be able to generate a stable income and, thus, improve the income of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Militona

texts.en:
Militona is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She grows rice and raises pigs. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children.

Militona is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm as well as her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Elio Misael

texts.es:
Elio de 29 años, es  una persona muy esforzada  y laboriosa  se dedica  a la albañilería desde hace 15 años, oficio que lo aprendió al lado de su tío, ese trabajo le ha dado la oportunidad de salir a delante, aunque en el año  2008  decidió viajar a los estados unidos, para trabajar pero solo estuvo  dos años  y regreso  a El Salvador,  con ganas de salir adelante en su país natal. Está casado con y aún  no  tienen hijos.     

Él tiene experiencia en la albañilería desde hace 15 años,  cuando comenzó a trabar al lado de su tío y desde ese momento  se ha dedicado a desempeñarse en esta área.  

El préstamo será utilizado,  para terminar de construir su casa  ya que  donde vive actualmente  no es propio y quiere tener casa propia, para él y su esposa y sus futuros hijos que piensan tener, los materiales a comprar son: 30 Polines para techo, 25 láminas, 400 tejas de barro, 4 puertas de metal y 3 ventanas. 

En el futuro, planea  terminar su vivienda, con la finalidad de que su familia, tenga un lugar adecuado  para  vivir, además de que están planeando  con su esposa incrementar la familia  y quieren que sus hijos vengan al mundo  en condiciones  diferentes, a las que ellos han vivido toda su vida.
texts.en:
Elio is 29 years old. He is very hardworking and dedicated. He has worked as a bricklayer for 15 years. He learned that trade at his uncle's side. That work has given him the opportunity to get ahead. Although in 2008 he decided to travel to the United States to work, he was only there for two years and he returned to El Salvador eager to get ahead in his native country. He is married and they don't have children yet.      

He has 15 years' experience of working as a bricklayer. He started working with his uncle and since then has worked in that area.     

The loan will be used to finish building his house, since where he lives right now doesn't belong to him and he wants to own his own house for him, his wife and the future children they are planning on having. The materials he will buy are: 30 rods for the roof, 25 sheets, 400  clay tiles, 4 metal doors and 3 windows. 

In the future, he plans on finishing his house so that his family can have an adequate place to live. He is also planning on he and his wife growing their family and they want their children to come into the world under different conditions than the ones they have had their whole lives.

loans.use: to buy 30 rods for the roof, 25 sheets, 400 clay tiles, 4 metal doors and 3 windows.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero, de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, donde tiene una Ferretería bien surtida, tiene local propio, casa propia, siempre ha sido una persona trabajadora que sabe luchar por salir adelante.
Es su primer negocio y por la buena ubicación, hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada por su antigüedad en el rubro. Cuenta que quiere seguir creciendo y ayudando a los suyos por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y poder comprar materiales de construcción, herramientas, repuestos y demás.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 43 years old and single.  He lives in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso, where he has a well-stocked hardware store.  The store has its own location and he owns a house.  He has always been a hardworking person who knows how to fight to get ahead.

This is his first business and since it is well located, until now it has been going very well.  He has formed a customer base since he has been in business a long time.  He says that he wants to continue growing and helping with his work.

He is requesting this loan for working capital to purchase construction materials, tools, spare parts, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, tools, spare parts, and other items.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu De Isla Umbu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Marangetu de Isla Umbu está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, gracias al cual ellas pueden ir mejorando su estilo de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Magna, es enfermera y comerciante tiene una farmacia y almacén, se  destaca por ser una persona que trabaja y que quiere salir adelante, está luchando por su familia, para poder darles una vida distinta a la de ella.
La Sra. Magna solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos farmacéutico y productos ya sea harina, aceite, jabón, azúcar, yerba, etc. para vender a los clientes, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Marangetu de Isla Umbu is in its 3rd cycle of the women's committee program where they all work and help each other to come out ahead. They are taking part in a poverty elimination survey through which they can improve their living conditions. 

Magna, one of the members, is a nurse and retailer. She has a pharmacy and store. She stands out for being a hard worker who wants to come out ahead. She is striving for her family, to be able to give them a life different from her own. 

Magna is requesting this loan to purchase pharmaceutical products and other products such as flour, oil, soap, sugar, herbs etc... in order to sell to her customers. This will help her to have a specified business plan which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceutical products and other products such as flour, oil, soap, sugar, herbs etc... in order to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres De Azucena Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Azucena está trabajando y luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de las integrantes, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, quien además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a la peluquería, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está creciendo y mejorando su estilo de vida. Quiere seguir mejorando, para poder generar puestos de trabajos para otras personas.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como enjuagues, cremas, útiles de peluquería y así generar más ingresos el cual la ayudara a mejorar  su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres de Azucena strives to improve its members standard of living. All the women head their households and are participating in the poverty reduction survey to determine their individual circumstances and ability to work.

Juana, one of the members, is a hair stylist. She works very hard and sacrifices to improve her standard of living. She wants to keep improving so that she can offer jobs to others. She will use this loan to buy supplies like rinses and lotions for her hair salon so that she can earn more and improve her circumstances.

loans.use: to buy hair salon supplies like rinses and lotions.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maria Auxiliadora 2 gracias al esfuerzo que vienen haciendo poco a poco están superando su pobreza, además gracias a la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza se busca la mejor estrategia para ayudarlas a ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cornelia, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 2, es decir medio, pero es consciente de que debe seguir trabajando y esforzarse. Ella cuenta que hace empanadas y otras minutas, que vende de forma ambulante, es una persona muy sacrificada, que con mucho esfuerzo y paciencia está saliendo adelante. Sabe que la única forma de ir mejorando su vida es por medio de su trabajo y lucha.
La Sra.  Cornelia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para la elaboración de sus minutas, como ser carne, jamón, queso, mayonesa, panificados y demás el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, e ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
Thanks to their efforts the Maria Suxiliadora 2 Group members are overcoming their poverty little by little, and also thanks to the Poverty Stoplight survey which looks for the best strategy to help them to improve.

One of the members is Cornelia, who in her latest survey showed a poverty level within level 2, that is to say midrange, but she is aware that she needs to continue working and struggling. She says that she makes fried pastries and other snacks that she sells on foot, she is a self-sacrificing person, who with a lot of effort and patience is getting ahead. She knows that the only way to improve her life is by working hard and fighting.

Cornelia is asking for this loan in order to buy products to make her snacks, such as meat, ham, cheese, mayonnaise, bread and more which will help her improve her earnings and keep improving her poverty level.

loans.use: to buy meat, ham, cheese, mayonnaise, bread, and more

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
Comité Mujeres Unidas de San Lorenzo está en su ciclo número 3, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y  9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos escasos, y deben seguir esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir con niveles medios de ingresos.  Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y vende de todo, gracias a su negocio y a su trabajo, sumado a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y mejorando su economía.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de vegetales, bebidas, artículos en general  productos a granel, etc, que le ayudara a surtir su negocio. Agradece por la oportunidad de crecer que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Comité Mujeres Unidas (United Women Committe) of San Lorenzo is in it’s 3rd loan cycle, and are taking part in the poverty elimination survey. Nine members find themselves below the poverty line that is low income and must continue to strive to improve.

Maria is one of the members. In her last survey she showed a level of poverty inside level 2, in other words average income level.  She has a well stocked store and sells everything. Thanks to her business and her work, plus her efforts she is coming out ahead and improving her finances.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, drinks, general products, bulk goods etc... which will help her supply her business. She is grateful for the opportunity of growing her business which she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, drinks, general products, bulk goods etc...

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Amanecer está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
Maria es una de ellas, es lavandera y también se dedica a la venta de comidas, es una persona que desde joven ha trabajado y luchado por su familia. Tiene una gran esperanza en el programa de comités para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este préstamo, para comprar jabones, suavizantes, y también insumos para hacer sus comidas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called “Amanecer” (Dawn) is in cycle #1 in the women’s committee program.  They all work and help each other to get ahead.  They are known in the community for being very hardworking women.

María is one of them.  She’s a laundress and also works selling prepared meals.  She’s a person who has worked and struggled for her family since she was very young.  She has great hope that in the committee program she’ll be able to improve her and her family’s lives.

She’s asking for this loan to buy soap, fabric softener and also ingredients to make her food.  She’s grateful for this opportunity she’s getting to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy soap, fabric softener and food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: Luis Carlos, habita en Juigalpa, en casa de Sus padres, él no trabaja aún, depende económicamente de ellos, pues la mamá es ama de Casa y su papá es el que aporta para los gastos del Hogar, él aunque tenga su propia Clínica como Medico que es, los estudios de su hijo a que aplica por ser buen alumno son demasiado costoso. Luis Carlos es egresado de la Carrera de ingeniería Industrial, y con el objetivo de continuar sus estudios profesionales  tiene que viajar hasta Managua a una distancia de 137 Km del Lugar donde habita, para poder realizar un Post- Grado con Sistema de Gestión de Calidad Innovación en las Organizaciones,  con esto pretende aportar sus conocimientos para el desarrollo de la Sociedad y el bienestar de su Familia.
texts.en: Luis Carlos lives in Juigalpa with his parents, on whom he is financially dependent as he does not yet work.  His Mum is a housewife and his Dad is the one whose earnings cover the household expenses.  Although his Dad has his own Doctor's surgery, the higher education course which his son (a good student) is applying for is too expensive.  Luis Carlos holds a bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering and, in order to continue his professional studies, he has to travel to Managua (137 kms from where he lives) to do a Postgraduate course.  He hopes that the qualification in Quality Management and Innovation in business will enable him to use his expertise for the good of society and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to study for a postgraduate qualification

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Robina has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy new wheels for her husband's vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara lives in Kapan town with his pensioner mother. For many years, Ara has been involved in retail business. He owns a small truck by which he goes to different places and sells fruits and vegetables. He purchases stock of products from the local city market and resells in nearby towns. Ara is the only breadwinner for the family, and he works really hard to cover daily needs. By applying for this loan, Ara wants to purchase new stock of fruits and vegetables and increase his sales.

Ara has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Ara to be able to enlarge his retail business and ensure a better life for his mother.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, tiene 44 años, es una mujer alegre, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, está casada con Pedro quien es el padre de sus 05 hijos de 25, 23, 21, 10 y 03 años de edad, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Vilma se dedica a la venta de sus propias frutas. Tiene un terreno agrícola en donde siembra principalmente papaya, además de otros como plátano, maíz y otros cultivos. Generalmente cosecha de manera semanal y una vez obtenido la cantidad necesaria traslada todo hasta el puerto fluvial en donde vende por cientos a precios al por mayor. Lleva en esta actividad mas de 10 años y por fortuna desde que empezó le ha ido muy bien aunque reconoce que tuvo que pasar algunos meses para que se acostumbre a la rutina laboral. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y de algunos trabajadores que contrata dependiendo de la magnitud del trabajo a realizar. En este crédito con Kiva se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles, contratará el personal necesario para la siembra de maíz que en esta temporada tiene un buen precio de venta.
texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old. She is an entrepeneur and very hard working. She is married to Pedro who is the father of her 5 children who are 25, 23, 21, 10 and 3 years old. They all live together in their own home. Vilma works selling her own fruits. She has a plot of land where she mainly sows papaya, as well as others such as bananas, corn and others. Generally she harvests on a weekly basis and once she has obtained the quantity she requires she takes it all to the river port where she sells her produce by the hundreds at wholesale prices. She has been in this line of work for more than 10 years and luckily since she started it has gone very well, although she recognizes that it took her several months to get used to the working routine. She works with the help of her husband and several contracted workers, depending on the size of the job to be done.

This is her sixth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful to the people that offer her the financing she needs to put her plans into action. She is also committed to making her monthly repayments on time. With the loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will contract the staff necessary to sow corn which is selling at a good price this season.

loans.use: to hire workers to help with growing corn.

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es: Diego es un joven de 24 años de edad que se dedica a prestar el servicio de corte y mantenimiento de céspedes y jardines en diferentes fincas de la vereda donde reside y en pueblos aledaños al sector; esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, quien también se dedica a esta labor. Con los ingresos que genera, aporta a la economía de su humilde familia. Su tenacidad, empuje y espíritu de superación le han permitido encontrar alternativas para seguir avanzando, por esa razón, solicita el apoyo de su segundo ciclo de crédito con el que comprará una guadañadora y pagará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, de esta forma podrá reemplazar la máquina que posee, pues actualmente presenta problemas y está en reparación pero no tiene la garantía que siga funcionando; así continuará realizando su labor y podrá seguir acreditando y fortaleciendo su negocio, para que en un futuro éste sea económicamente rentable y le permita seguir ayudando a sus padres con la manutención de su hogar, garantizando una mejor calidad de vida para todos.
texts.en:
Diego is 24 years old and works as a landscaper on various farms around his home as well as in neighboring towns.  He learned this trade from his father who was also a landscaper.  With the income he earns, he contributes to his humble family's finances.  His tenacity, drive and his spirit for improvement, have allowed him to find alternatives to continue advancing. 

He is seeking the help of a second loan with which he will purchase a lawn trimmer and pay the balance of his existing loan.  This will allow him to replace his current machine that has been causing him problems.  Although it is under repair, there is no guarantee that it will continue to function.  The new machine will allow him to continue to work and strengthen his business so that in the future it will be profitable and he can continue to help his parents maintain their home and guarantee a better quality of life for everyone.

loans.use: purchase a lawn trimmer and pay the balance of his outstanding loan

loans.name: Mirtha Estela

texts.es:
Mirtha Estela tiene 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposo no tienen hijos dependientes residen en el distrito de Morropon, es una comunidad grande que su principal actividad es la agricultura y crianza de ganado mayor y menor, a dos horas de la región Piura en la parte norte del Perú.

Se dedican a la venta de carne de cerdo en su domicilio y comercio de animales menores como aves de corral y conejos, con varios años de experiencia en el negocio, por lo que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles que tendrá como destino una parte para comprar mercadería de su negocio y la otra para arreglar los acorrales de su casa, esto ayudará a tener en mejor ambiente a sus animales y así tener una mejora en la calidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mirtha Estela, 50, lives with her husband in the district of Morropon which is a large community based mainly on agriculture and livestock farming.  It is two hours from the region of Piura in northern Peru.  The couple has no dependant children.

Mirtha Estela sells pork meat from home and also sells small animals such as chickens and rabbits.  She has several years' experience and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN to buy merchandise for the business.  She wants to fix up the animal pens and provide a better environment for the animals to increase the quality of her business.

loans.use: to buy animals for her business and repair animal pens

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres en Acción está en su ciclo número  9 del programa de comité, ellas son mujeres jefas de familias que se unieron con la idea de poder trabajar y luchar juntas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder saber cómo esta cada una.
Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora, quien por medio de su esfuerzo y su arduo trabajo está ayudando a su familia dándoles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades. Ella es modista y cuenta que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, y que quiere seguir creciendo. Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y demás para poder seguir con sus costuras y de esa forma seguir trabajando y luchando por crecer.
texts.en: The Mujeres en Acción (Women in Action) group is in its ninth cycle of the communal bank programme.  They are female heads of households who got together with the idea of working and fighting together.  They are carrying out a survey about eliminating poverty so they each can find out what the others are like.  Mercedes is a very hardworking person who, thanks to her determination and hard work, is helping her family by giving them all that they need and ensuring that they do not have to go without necessities.  She is a dressmaker and says that she already has a regular clientele which she wants to see grow further.  She is applying for this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other things which will enable her to continue her sewing business.  This will allow her to keep working and striving to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic and other things.

loans.name: Loyda

texts.es: Loyda, tiene 52 años, es una mujer alegre, firme y trabajadora, es viuda pero tiene 02 hijos de 35 y 33 años a quienes dedicó muchos años de su vida para convertirlos en personas responsables y de provecho para la sociedad, cada uno de ellos ya es independiente y con su hogar formado. Vive sola en su casa propia. Loyda, se dedica a trabajar como contratista de trabajadores de campo para proyectos estan alejadas de la ciudad. Realiza su actividad en diversos proyectos forestales y en ocasiones también lo hace en proyectos agrícolas. Su función consiste en brindar la cantidad de mano de obra necesaria para que el trabajo a ejecutar esté listo en el tiempo establecido y con la calidad que requiere bajo los lineamientos determinados por la empresa o persona que contrata sus servicios. Dependiendo de la magnitud de la obra también varía el número de personas que emplea en su actividad pudiendo ser de 02 hasta 10 obreros y de acuerdo a ello compra todo lo necesario para abastecerse durante el tiempo que dure el desarrollo del proyecto. Lleva en este negocio más de 04 años y le va muy bien. Su trabajo le gusta porque sus servicios son muy bien remunerados y emplea periodos cortos de tiempo para realizarlo, le agrada ser la cabeza del grupo y dirigir el desarrollo de las funciones que se deben plasmar en el campo. En este crédito con Kiva, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles, comprará combustible y productos comestibles enlatados para el campamento del nuevo proyecto que desarrollará ya que se encuentra en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Loyda is 52 years old, and is a happy, settled and hardworking woman. She is a widow with 2 children who are 35 and 33 years old, to whom she has dedicated many years of her life to helping them become responsible people who contribute to society. They are both independent and have their own homes. Loyda lives alone in her own home, and works as a contractor for field workers in projects that are a far way out of the city.

She contracts workers for various forest projects and on occasion for agricultural projects. Her job is to provide the quantity of labor required to ensure that the work is completed within the time frame and with the quality required and determined by the company or person who is hiring her services. Depending on the size of the job, the number of people employed can vary between 2 - 10 workers and so Loyda buys the necessary supplies according to the number of workers and the duration of the project. She has been in this line of work for more than 4 years and it is going very well. Loyda likes her work because she is well paid for her services and the work comes in short bursts. She likes being at the head of the group, directing the development of the projects taking shape in the field.

With her Kiva loan, Loyda is very happy with the financial support being offered since she will feel sure of advancing in her work. She also is committed to paying her monthly repayments on time. With the loan of 2000 nuevos soles, she will buy fuel and tinned food for the camp of the new project she will be developing since it is located a long distance from the city.

loans.use: buy fuel and tinned food.

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanamaqui Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “VIRGEN DE CHAPI DE YANAMAQUI” se encuentran pasando el 02 ciclo. Quienes se dedican a las diversas áreas del comercio y la agricultura y prestar servicios.  Alberto tiene 34 años es casado con 1 hijo educando en el colegio. Hace 15 años trabaja prestando servicios de albañilería. Actividad que aprendió como ayudante albañil y mediante capacitaciones que tuvo. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de unas máquinas: perforadora y un rotomartillo. Su mayor deseo es comprar todas las herramientas para brindar un buen servicio de albañilería. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Alberto es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho viste casaca marrón.
texts.en:
The members of the “Virgen de Chapi de Yanamaqui” communal bank are in their second cycle.  They are involved in various activities in commerce, agriculture and services.  

Alberto, 34, is married with a son attending school.  He’s worked in construction for 15 years having learned as a bricklayer’s assistant and through training courses he took.

He will use the loan to buy machinery:  a hydraulic auger and an electric drill.  His greatest wish is to buy all the tools needed to do good construction work.  Alberto is first on the left wearing a jade green shirt.

The group thanks Kiva lenders for the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 59 años de edad, tiene dos hijos dependientes, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pomahuaca, las actividades principales de la zona son la agricultura , comercio y ganadería.

Se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una bodega  ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con mas de 08 años de experiencia en el negocio, cuenta con muy  buenas referencias personales, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de la zona.

Pedro se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio  compra de mercadería. Con las ganancias de esta actividad espera obtener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia
texts.en:
Pedro is the head of his household.  He is 59 and has two dependent children.  He lives with his family in the district of Pomahuaca.  The main economic activities in the area are agriculture, retail, and livestock. 

He works in retail for a living.  He has a small grocery store located in his home.  He has over eight years of experience in the business.  He has very good personal references because of his good service and experience and he has a good-sized clientele in the area. 

Pedro is currently asking for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles.  He needs the loan to invest in his business by buying merchandise.  He hopes that the profits from his business will allow him to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple goods and groceries for his grocery store

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio de 44 años de edad conviviente con  su esposa hace 18 años, la familia vive en la comunidad de Colomi . Don Gregorio y su esposa son agricultores con ingresos económicos por la venta estacional de papa, haba en vaina verde y oca cultivando en herencia de terreno de parte de sus padres con rotación de cultivos en la misma comunidad de esta forma ellos mantienen económicamente a su familia, ellos necesitan sacar un préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza).  Por ultimo Don Gregorio comenta que ya tenía preparado las parcelas para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola y le falto dinero, ahora sembraran lo más antes posible para asi poder tener un ingreso mejor para el siguiente año, este ingreso le permitira ayudar a sus hijos para que continuen estudiando.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 44, and his wife have lived together for 18 years in Colomi.  Gregorio and his wife work in agriculture earning income selling seasonal potatoes, green beans and tubers working land that was inherited from their parents.  They rotate crops in the same community supporting their family this way.  

They need to take out a loan to buy agricultural supplies like organic manure (bird guano).  Gregorio relates that he’s already prepared the soil in his parcels for this next planting season but lacks money.  Now, they will be able to plant as soon as possible in order to earn higher income for next year, and the extra income will help with their children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy organic manure (bird guano)

loans.name: Anali Tedy

texts.es:
Anali tiene 35 años, vive al lado de su esposo y juntos tienen un hijo de 8 años de edad, por el cual trabaja cada día para poder sacarlo adelante; Anali trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, ya que es su fuentes ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Anali cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es carismática y amable con sus clientes.

Analí esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una exhibidora para colocar sus productos de belleza y así poder ofrecer mejor sus productos; así ella podrá mejorar sus  hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”
texts.en:
Anali, 35, lives with her husband and 8-year-old son she works for every day in order to move him forward.  Anali works selling beauty products.  She spends about 10 hours daily in her business since it’s her source of income to help her husband cover household expenses.  Anali believes she does well because she’s charismatic and kind to customers.

Anali is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided she will be able to buy a display case to arrange her beauty products thus being able to better display them.  She will be able to improve reaching her great dream of building her house out of substantial building materials.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Hace 2 años, Marisol inició su negocio de venta de carnes frías,  aprovechando que se había mudado a un barrio con un amplio potencial de clientes. Ella fue consiente de la oportunidad que tenia, para ayudar a su esposo a sostener su hogar, (conformado por el y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 16 años), y empezó comprando un enfriador, que surtió de carnes frías, producto que tiene mucha acogida en ese sector. Muy pronto empezó a vender a crédito y agregó bebidas frías, en mayor volumen y al detalle. Marisol se esfuerza de lunes a domingos, en sus taras de ventas con el fin de generar ingresos, para aumentar el bienestar de su familia. Su meta es aumentar su clientela y para ello requiere capital de trabajo, para invertir mientras recoge el dinero, producto de las financiaciones que hace a sus clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará carnes frías, para surtir su enfriador, pues tiene un volumen importante de pedidos, que planea responder, para con el producto de sus ventas, reinvertir y vender mucho mas, en el mes de Diciembre, temporada en la que usualmente las ventas ascienden.
texts.en:
Marisol started her business selling cold-cuts two years ago taking advantage of her move to a neighborhood with many potential customers.  She was aware of the opportunity she had to help her husband support their home (consisting of him, and their three children with ages ranging between 8 and 16 years) and bought a refrigerator that she stocked with cold-cuts which is a very well-received product in that sector.  She started selling on credit very soon after and added cold beverages in larger amounts and at retail.  

Marisol works hard Monday to Sunday in her sales tasks aimed at generating income to increase family well-being.  Her goal is to increase her clientele and to do so needs working capital to invest while she’s collecting payments from her customers.

This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cold-cuts to stock her refrigerator because she has a significant number of pending orders she intends to fill.  She will use profits from her sales to reinvest and to sell much more, especially in December, which is a season when sales usually increase.

loans.use: to buy cold-cuts.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald de 22 años de edad, tiene un pequeño negocio en el centro de la ciudad, donde vende bolsos viajeros, como morrales, maletas, maletines etc. Cuando tenia 15 años, empezó su experiencia comercial, pues su madre lo indujo a ella, con su apoyo incondicional, haciéndolo vivenciar su propia experiencia comercial. Así fue que cuando estuvo preparado para abordar, por si mismo el mercado, pues su padre quedó discapacitado, empezó su tarea  independiente. En la actualidad vende de contado y compra en diversos sitios de Barranquilla y de una población fronteriza, donde encuentra artículos a un buen precio, que traslada a sus compradores. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bolsos, morrales, maletas y maletines, pues se acerca la hora de viajar de vacaciones, para muchos de sus clientes y Ronald debe estar preparado, con artículos a buenos precios, muy cómodos y modernos. Su meta mas adelante es tener un gran almacén y mejorar sus condiciones de vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es la competencia y los altibajos de las ventas, por eso aprovecha cada temporada, para sacarle el máximo provecho y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ronald, 22 years of age, has a small business in the center of the city, where he sells travel bags such as backpacks, suitcases, satchels, etc. When he was 15, his experience in retail began: it was his mother's idea, and she gave him her unconditional support, making him live the experience of retail for himself. 

So it was that when he was preparing to tackle the market itself, his father became disabled, and he began his task on his own. He now sells, taking in cash, and buys from various places in Barranquilla, as well as from a border town. In these places he finds wares at a good price, which he passes on to his own buyers.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first one with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy bags, backpacks, suitcases, and satchels. Vacation time is getting close for many of his clients, and Ronald must be prepared with items that are well-priced, very comfortable, and modern.

His long-term goal is to have a large storage space and improve his living conditions, but his biggest challenge is the competition and the rise and fall of sales. So he takes advantage of every season, to make the most of it and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy bags, backpacks, suitcases, and satchels

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, She is a 31-year-old from the Waterloo Easten area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 8 and 13. Two of her children are currently attending school. For the past ten years, Fatmata has sold general merchandise business from her house.   She began her business because she wanted to change her living status; she works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven  days per week. She says that the main challenge to this business is that during the rainy season, sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap, and drinks for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful and improve her standard of living. In the future, Fatmata plans to open another out let. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, cigarettes, soap, and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Denis Claudia

texts.es:
Denis es una trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo píese sacar adelante a su niña de 3 años de edad, a la cual cría sola ya que es madre soltera, cada día se esfuerza mucho porque para ella lo más importante es darle una buena calidad de vida para su niña.
Denis esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para mejorar su vivienda, sobre todo porque ha habido constantes movimientos sísmicos y las paredes se han agrietado, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su niña y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Darle una carrera profesional a su hija”.
texts.en:
Denis works as a laborer in an agricultural base in the city. She works about ten hours daily and with the fruits of her labor she can get her three-year-old daughter ahead. She raises her alone as a single mother and each day she works very hard because for her, the most important things is to give her daughter a high quality life. 

Denis is thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the helps that is being brought to her, she will be able to buy materials to improve her home, above all because of the constant seismic activity that have caused her walls to crack. She will be able to improve her daughter's standard of living and fight to make her dream to come true to enable her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Yennifer Mary Isabel

texts.es:
Yennifer es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pequeña hija, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Yennifer pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de computación.
Por iniciativa propia, Yennifer trabaja brindando atención al publico en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yennifer se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir y cercar la parte trasera de su hogar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en: Yennifer is a young woman of 19 who lives in the city of Pisco with her small daughter.  She is a hardworking single mother who puts all her efforts into getting by.  Her determination enabled Yennifer to study for a computing qualification.  She works on her own initiative, serving the public in a business in her city.  She works for about 10 hours every day and believe that she is successful because of her dedication and effort.  Yennifer is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, with their help, she will be able to make improvements to her home.  She would like to build the back of her house and construct a wall round it and so will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a decent and safe place to live.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge de 26 años de edad, se dedica a fabricar calzado artesanal y a remontarlo; él diariamente trabaja en este arte, por cuenta propia, desde hace 10 años.  Su padre tradicionalmente se dedicó a esta actividad y su hermano y él, ganaron con ello mucha experiencia, que tradujeron en su propio generador de ingresos. Hoy Jorge de lunes a sábados, trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, produciendo sandalias y calzado formal,  comprando todos sus insumos y materia primas de contado, en almacenes especializados y vendiendo también de contado a comerciantes, ubicados en el centro de la ciudad.  Su meta más adelante es tener un local adecuado  y alcanzar una carrera profesional, que le permita ampliar sus posibilidades de éxito. 
Día a día, Jorge se esmera interactuando entre follajes, cuero, suelas, plantillas y demás accesorios, para ofrecer en el mercado nuevos diseños y productos con un acabado inigualable. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cuero, plantillas, follaje, puntillas, pegantes etc., con el fin de lanzar su más actualizada producción, en la temporada de fin de año, que aumenta usualmente sus ingresos y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva tenga mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Jorge, age 26, works manufacturing and assembling artisanal footwear.  According to him, he has worked at this art daily for the past ten years. His father traditionally worked at this, as well.  He and his brother have gained a lot of experience with him, and they have translated this into their own means of generating income.  Currently Jorge works from 9 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon from Monday to Saturday.  He makes sandals and formal footwear, paying cash for all his supplies and raw materials from specialty stores and selling them, also for cash, to retailers located downtown in the city. His future goal is to have an adequate workspace and to receive a professional degree, which will allow him to increase his chances of success.

From day to day, Jorge goes to a lot of effort intermixing padding, leather, patterns, and other accessories to offer new designs and products in the market, all with an unequaled finishing touch.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this he will buy leather, insoles, padding, tacks, glue, etc., with the goal of launching his most up-to-date line in the end-of-the-year season.  This usually increases his earnings, and that is exactly what ensures that his Kiva loan will have great success.

loans.use: to buy leather, insoles, padding, tacks, glue, etc.

loans.name: Giner

texts.es: Giner de 26 años de edad habita en el sur occidente de Barranquilla lugar donde se dedica ala labor de venta de mercancías, como ropa productos de aseo, entre otros artículos.  Giner tiene 2 años de experiencia  en el negocio, el cual inició, para lograr generar ingresos pues no había logrado emplearse. Así fue como comenzó a vender ropa, cremas, colonias, accesorios femeninos, y todo lo que su clientela le solicitaba en condiciones de crédito; poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo entre su principal clientela de amigos,  y extendiéndose entre sus vecinos. Sus compras las realiza de contado en el centro de la ciudad donde encuentra precios competitivos y sus ventas las realiza también de contado, En la actualidad Giner ha recibido un crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual ha logrado un surtido diverso, . Su meta es continuar ampliándolo, hasta tener su propio local, para apoyar a su madre a quien ama profundamente. Giner hoy está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará productos de aseo personal, ropa y variedades para impactar a su clientela en las fiestas más hermosas de las familias las de fin de año, época en la cual se celebra la navidad y se recibe con felicidad y nuevas esperanzas,  el año nuevo
texts.en: Giner, 26 years old, lives in southwestern Barranquilla, where he makes a living selling clothing, bath products, and other goods. Giner has had his business for two years. He started it so he could earn some money since he had been unable to find a job. So he started selling clothing, lotions, cologne, feminine accessories, and everything else his customers asked for. Gradually his business expanded from his initial customer base among his friends to also include his neighbors. He makes his purchases in cash in the city center, where he can get competitive prices, and sells his goods for cash. Giner has received a loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he has used to buy a variety of products. His goal is to keep expanding his business and eventually open a shop so he can support his mother, whom he loves deeply. Giner is applying for a Kiva loan to buy bath products, clothing, and other goods to offer his customers for the family celebrations that take place at the end of the year, when people celebrate Christmas and await the new year with joy and hope.

loans.use: to buy bath products, clothing, and other goods.

loans.name: Roepchand

texts.en: Roepchand is a serious farmer and lives with his wife Maheshwari and child. He plants 14 acres of land and has inherited a tractor from his parents. He has recently refurbished his house with the profits he made with his farm over the past years. Roepchand has received eight loans from Seva MFi since 2009, varying between SRD 1.250 to SRD 10.000. These loans he repaid on time. Now he has approached Seva MFI for a new loan of SRD 10.000 for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 52-year-old vigorous lady. She is motivated and for the past ten years has been running a business selling clothes. She buys cloth from the wholesale markets and, after making beautiful clothes out of it, sells them in her community and in the local market. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Tahira wants to expand her business to earn better profits and therefore has requested a loan of  25,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees) to buy a variety of fabric in different colors and designs. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has shown good credit repayment behavior in the past. She wishes to provide a better lifestyle to her family by earning better profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabric in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Binthamisi

texts.en:
Binthamisi is a married woman with one child who is still underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality  as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES (Kenya Shillings)  loan, she wants to purchase sweets, cookies, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, cookies, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, age 23, is a single lady. She had a difficult time after her father's business failure. She decided to work herself to support her family for a better future. Four years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her third loan cycle and has borrowed  30,000 PKR (Pakistani Rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, and zippers. In this way, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She expects a  boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, and zippers.

loans.name: Usup

texts.en:
