Usup is 44 years old and lives in the village of Urekhi with his sister and mother. Usup’s mother is provided with a retirement pension and his sister trades in shoes at the fair-market. 

Usup is a hired driver and works in transportation. Besides his monthly wage, he has income from renting out a room which is located in his house. Their existing income is not enough for a family of three. With this start-up loan, Usup will purchase his own truck and start his own transportation business. He will carry and transport different things, depending on the needs and requests of his customers, in order to generate income. 

As he has the appropriate experience in this field, Usup hopes his project will be successful and lucrative. Usup would like to thank all Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase a truck and use it in the transportation business

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en:
Nooran is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as they have maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, health and education. 

Nooran wants to grow her business and therefore has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, beverages, etc to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 52, lives with her husband and her four children. During her working life she has earned a living as an independent merchant, a job she knows because many of her relatives have worked in the field. She has run provision, eggs, and fruits stores.

For this reason Ruth needs a loan amount of GHS 3,000 to buy stock wholesale and sell to customers in her community. She has been earning respectable income to help her husband with the financial responsibility of the household.

Ruth dreams of making her business grow and strengthening it so it will be recognized in the sector and generate a good income, so that she can take good care of her children. She hopes to give her family better living conditions and her children an excellent education in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock wholesale and sell to customers in her community.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en:
Zahi is 45 years old. He lives in Nablus with his wife and their three children.

He has a shop for welding services. He earns a monthly income $850. He started his business on the first of October, 2010.

He asked Ryada for this loan to buy another welding machine. This will enable him to employ a helper, which will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

Zahi is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy another welding machine.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and the mother of three children, from San Miguel, Bohol. 

She runs a sari-sari (or variety) store business in her place.  Virginia is asking for a loan to buy more stocks for her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda, and toiletries, and to pay the school fees of her children. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks and continue supporting her children's education.

Virginia is optimistic that through this loan, she will be able to improve her livelihood and experience fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store, like canned goods, noodles, soda, and toiletries, and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as trustworthy. 

She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale. She describes her biggest business challenges as lack of water and high prices of water facilities. 

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a 3,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase another dairy cow. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a 3,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family through the Kiva loan she received, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar that she will sell to invest in her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergents, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana earns a living through her food-vending business. She lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Vitaliana cooks snack food like bibingka, or rice cake, which is made from ground glutinous rice.

Vitaliana is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food vending like sugar, flour, glutinous rice, milk and other items. With this loan, she will be able to cook more, thus allowing her to sell more snack foods.

In the future, Vitaliana hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like sugar, flour, glutinous rice, milk and other items.

loans.name: Fatie

texts.en:
Fatie, 51, lives with her husband and her two children. During her working life she has earned a living from the sale of millet for eighteen years now. For this reason Ruth needs a loan of 1800 GHS (Ghana Cedi) to buy stock from the millet market and sell it to customers in her community. 

She has been earning a respectable income to help her husband with the financial responsibility of the household. Ruth dreams of making her business grow and strengthening it so it will be recognized in the sector and generate a good income, so that she can take good care of her children. She hopes to give her family better living conditions and her children an excellent education in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock from the millet market and sell it to customers in her community.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with seven children; six go to school and one is an adult. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites school fees and food as her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Hawa lives in Paynesville South with her boyfriend, who is a teacher. They have three children between 9 months old and 19 years old. Their children are currently in school, and they all live at home. 

For 10 years now, she has been producing and selling iron soap (local soap made from caustic and palm oil) in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and caustic for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and caustic for her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. 

She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her place. She is also in the hog-raising business. 

Susana is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her store, so she can then attract buyers and customers. In the future, Susana hopes to expand her business so that it will generate more income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. Binti dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the  region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, who are currently in school. 

For the past five years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, and other foodstuffs. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used buy more foodstuffs for the shop, and it will help Grace to generate greater profits and pay for the education of her children. 

Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to start selling fish. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs for her shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Gloria is asking for a loan to buy  more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Gloria wants to expand her business in the future so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Norgul

texts.ru: Норгул трудолюбивая женщина, которая живет на северной части горного Таджикистана и более 22 года занимается скотоводством. Ей 49  лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет  4 детей. Климат ее местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Поэтому 22 года назад она выбрала этот бизнес и до сих пор развивает этот бизнес. Она продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще она продает скот, за которым она присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. Она хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму    8000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Norgul is a hardworking woman who lives in the northern part of mountainous Tajikistan and has been working in animal husbandry for more than 22 years. She is 49 and married and has four children. The climate where she lives is very good for agriculture and also for raising animals. Therefore 22 years ago she chose this business and is developing it to this day. She sells milk to her neighbours, who are very pleased with the natural dairy product they receive. She also sells cattle that she has taken care of for several months. She wants to develop her business but does not have enough capital to do so. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 somoni to purchase cattle, in order to develop the business. She plans to provide her children with a good education and modern technology with the revenue she receives. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for resale

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mbodze has operated a fruit-and-vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini greengrocers in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maqboola

texts.en:
Maqboola is a 51-year-old widow. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house and has six years of experience in this field.  Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her shop. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have eight children between 12 and 25 years old. Only three are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years she has been cooking and selling rice and soup in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, etc. for her business.
